AIkIMROFLp1fwVXAK3Dutg.text: We love this place for brunch! Service has been consistently good, as well as the food. We love craft beer and it's cool to drink local. Though I'll admit usually when I'm here I drink the novelty sized mimosas. Lesson learned though, don't drink 2 unless you're able to go home and take a long nap. They're basically straight champagne!

2odVNduZLJ_wSC1wq34Aqg.text: I've been coming here for years now and love this place. The atmosphere is awesome and the staff is friendly and we've always gotten great service. Their brunch is a great deal and it's nice that you can bring your dogs and hang out on the patio. Totally my kind of place and the location is perfect too!

Z9xqv97DgP90YUOBMQlVZQ.text: The food is good, the service is ok, the vibe is decent. I've been there twice and both times have seen cockroaches. First time was for brunch and saw the thing scurry across the bar. 2nd time was late night and it was crawling up the wall right next to me.  If I'm 2 for 2 in plain sight, I'm curious to know what's going on behind the scenes. But not really.

PAPD5EyW9cidPqbX44YYsQ.text: What a cool place, they brew their own beer infuse their on spirits. They have a bomb veggie burger, and a great wait staff. All around a perfect experience. I would recommend to anyone and everyone looking for great food and drinks in Arcadia.

Kza0zajWi-6A8gZYZZDLgA.text: Never disappointed by the food, beer or staff .. My favorite is the Morning Brew and the Beer Brunch is awesome, 10oz beer or Mimosa included

a1jC16AvwfG7c1Bpx6JjIg.text: This place is so cute!  It has an interesting, eclectic atmosphere that's a bit rustic (lots of wood), a bit hipster (lots of bikes and doggies welcome) and a bit big-awesome-brew-pub-sports-bar (big tvs and spacious - lots of seating, big booths, big bar, lots of room to move around).    The food is yummy, the atmosphere is laid back and the service is pleasant.  We had the fish tacos and the veggie burger, which were both quite tasty, well above the usual level of bar food.  My friend and I are already planning what we'll eat next time we go!

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Happy hour pretzels, ahi tuna salad, cute front patio and beer - a pitcher with 2.5 beers costs only $6.
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious veggie burger with enormous asparagus.
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish tacos - look at that delicious avocado!

EXdCR6_fjnRy1ULpzQ0icw.text: The floor is a bit of a trip hazard. There are bubbles under the laminate. Too funny. I met a friend who's in commercial construction and we just had to laugh. The service was great. The food was as follows:  Appetizer was chips and guac (one of my favs). My biggest pet peeve lately is that restaurants seem to think its necessary to sweeten what should be a savory food. The guac would have been amazing with all its numerous ingredients less the cherries...I mean seriously!  Cherries are meant for drinks and dessert not guacamole.   Meals were as follows: My friend ordered a blackened salmon sandwich which came out way overcooked.  I ordered a salad with salmon and the plate was piled high with greens and very little of the other items such as pears and cheese and the server forgot my salmon for which he brought to me after we let him know and it was cooked to PERFECTION!  My friend took a bite of mine and was saddened that his was so tough and mine so good. The server did comp us for the salmon which I thought was very nice. These guys just need to work on consistency and maybe take the cherries out of the guac.

YQoftt-Y_bAVXtFZjG69Xg.text: #1 they are SUPER dog friendly and my pups love when they get to come out with me. There burgers  are SO good, and their sweet potato fries are even better. Staff is always awesome, love OHSO, ill be back again and again

lBzWVLV4t5dTsJebCJzRCQ.text: Burger is bloody good. $6 Happy Hour Pitchers too!  Been half-jokingly trying to get my friends to eat here but they kept passing because of the overflowing parking lot and the name. BUT AT LAST I HAVE ARRIVED  BBQ Burger - Perfectly medium rare with lots of juice. 2 fat slabs of bacon and veggies on a great bun. You can definitely taste the quality of the ingredients here - Yes please.  I wanted to get a glass of grapefruit Hefeweizen but found out during Happy Hour a pitcher is just $1 more. (Who could pass that up @_@)  One of the best burgers in the Camelback area and definitely a notch above the ones at the Attic.

8LtGBdbA8XCt9-6S0elzpw.text: I come here almost every weekend for the beer brunch, and everything I've ever ordered has been phenomenal. Case and point: Tried their chicken + waffles last weekend, and they were on par with Lolo's.  The dog friendly patios (front and back) and bike racks are quite nice as well.  Don't be an idiot, go to OHSO.

1hIytr-psfeYYKKC0KbgXA.text: Honestly one of my favorite places to go for a light lunch. Great salads and exceptional service!

hlujJIW8pJaG-i10T_R0Cw.text: OHSO is another of our favorites. I love that we can walk or ride to them in about 10 minutes. We came last year for the first time and loved it and go back quite often and every time it gets better and better - whether it be the food or the decor.  We went for the brunch for the first time the other day and WOW. Best bloody mary I have ever had. How can you go wrong with a giant piece of beef jerky to mix it with! The monster mimosa's are just that, monster and delicious.  The biscuits and gravy are the best I have had since I moved to AZ. I tried everyone elses food and it was awesome as well but they were all into my biscuits.   My favorite dinner dish is the gnocchi but literally everything on the menu is awesome. We will keep coming to this place as long as its open and it seems they have no desire to slow down.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Monster mimosa!

ozpTekizPd-ElnhrglJIsw.text: This is one of my favorite weekend places! Despite the wait, once you sit, it is always enjoyable. They usually have a nice crowd in the back patio, with a handful of furry happily wagging pups. If you're not into the dog-friendly environment, the front patio or inside seating is really nice as well. The wait staff is wonderfully attentive, and ive never had a bad experience the many times i have been here. There are great menu options and a good assortment of local beers..they have an orange blossom beer that i really like. My favorite things on the menu are the cobb salad, and the Salmon blt.  Parking is a bit of a nuisance, but they have complementary valet that helps the issue. This location. Is extremely convenient, and its right off of the canal path. One of my favorite weekend events is to bike over with our pup. Its great exercise and you get to enjoy a beer at the end of it!

qoGdaeZdzrN3_YA6o5hLTQ.text: Hands down, best burger in town. AZ burger with the jalapeno polenta will literally make your mouth water. You have got try it. You are missing out if you haven't had it yet.

nJbCySxd413CmxI1SC79Gg.text: Ordered The Gobbler with sweet potato fries. The burger is on the sweeter side with the pear compote. In addition to the bacon and the tomato, it was a sweet, savory, and salty experience.   I really love sweet potato fries (they make them perfectly here) but suggest pairing the burger with another side. It turned out to be an overly sweet combination for me.

seM6dw9gSk_zwCZu813NPQ.text: This place has good food, and a great selection of beers. They even had a Hefeweizen on tap that was brewed in-house!  Do you have any idea how rare that is in this day of hipsters and IPA's?! Rare.  The big thing to know about this place is that it is more than dog-friendly. It is actually dog-occupied. Like, if you go here, you will see some dogs. Obviously this is a good thing, and there were some pretty good dogs when I went. There was one dog that was a bulldog and he was really round and stout like somebody put legs on a giant meatloaf. There was also a skinny dog that was wide-eyed and crazy looking. I give each of those dogs a rating of 4-stars as well. If you have a fine dog, I suggest you bring it with you, and I think they even had complimentary dog treats.

OsN4kF1_EoKDFivaVMv97g.text: I absolutely hate the food here but come here somehow every Saturday or Sunday for the brunch with the mimosa alone. Wish they'd improve the food to justify my spending here. The mimosa is too good to pass up. Lots of booze little juice.

RLV_JE_THkRLECjBtf0tVg.text: It's hard for me to go to OHSO when it's not for brunch. LOL! I really enjoy the brunch menu. The environment is killer, who doesn't love dogs?? The parking situation is kinda a nightmare as you always have to valet unless you're lucky. All OHSO beer on tab is delicious, but for brunch I always go with the mimosa.  Bartender at the time was super friendly and handled a huge crowed really well.

P-zOA8cuillaJNT-frLo7A.text: I popped in for a beer today after a long ride, paid cash.  Got the bills back, but not the change owed me.  Bartender was a jerk about it, so I reminded him that I expect all my change be returned to me, is this so hard, or is the bartender really in need of the extra change?  Terrible customer service.

5fEtbS2qV9lmbT11QKAx2A.text: I am at the satellite airport location.  They are out of  my first and second menu choices.  This leaves me with fake scar a led egg options. I asked if I could have a lunch menu item.  The request was for a cold sandwich. He checked with manager and was told no.  Horrible customer service.

nCYRlmMnbIE6-7G1BY6XRA.text: Great casual atmosphere with a couple of nice patios.  It's located along the SRP Canal so many people ride bikes to the place.  I've been here on many Sunday afternoons for the brunch special which includes an entree and pitcher of beer.    Last night I tried the homemade mac & cheese with Beef Brisket.  It's delicious and if you're not famished it's a good one to split.  The Orange Blossom micro brew is very good as well at $8 for a 32 oz pitcher.  The service has always been consistently good and the staff takes pride in the place.    The only shortcoming is the lack of appealing appetizers.  If they expand these options (spice it up a bit) this becomes a 5 star pub.

Ly5IWgMHapI19XqGHuXsPQ.text: This place was very impressive many different types of brews to try lots of seating a great view to the outside patio the food was incredible  I tried the hamburgers they were delicious probably one of the best I've had in town.   Animals are allowed as well they're very dog friendly you can have them on the patio.  They even provide gourmet dog biscuits.

RZtjz12BncLCBP2xsEqnyA.text: 7th visit and it has been a great experience every time!  The latest visit was just a quick 5pm stops for some beers and appetizers with friends, again some interesting new beers to try. We had the Brewers Board app, nice selection of appetizers and all tasty.  Previous visits have been on the back patio, a very fun place eat and even let your dogs socialize. Sunday breakfasts and the weekend barbecues are some of our favorites. It's a bit of a drive for us, but definitely worth it, the food and service have been consistently great  My dog is addicted to the free dog biscuits they bake there, so I always make sure I have a pocketful on the way out.

R4OCkvuGYNlkLyn-h_dqoA.text: A very nice selection of microbrews, some of which are really quite good. The food offered doesn't, sadly, even reach the level of mediocrity. I lunched here over the weekend with a party of four; all of us ordered something different, and none were particularly palatable in anyone's opinion. My Waldorf salad wrap resembled and tasted like something that you'd buy wrapped in cellophane at a gas station rest stop for considerably less than the $10 menu price. Nice outside dog-friendly patio, but be aware that on a nice day the wait for a table may take quite a while - we were told 45 minutes. Nah....maybe for a beer, but never again for a meal. I'll not waste my time and money with this place when there are plenty of other better choices around.

f0vNFnBuwI0BXH1u5TmDBQ.text: Petty much the most awesome lunch in a while.over 30 beers on tap and green Chile sandwich is bomb

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States

QvwKRAawpyAdymAvfiPBPw.text: So I did not attempt the beer BUT the bloody mary's are amazing. A-ma-zing. Additionally , I purchased the pork arepa. Superb flavorful as well as the right number in the event that you are beyond starving, which I was. My buddy purchased the green chili pulled pork sandwich that was equally as great. I'll undoubtedly be back. If anyone has had a terrible experience here, it has to 've been a fluke...

n_O3FLnlhwDr37NtFIUzPw.text: Amazing service and great food! I sat at the outside bar and the bar bartender was so helpful and pointed out the best sellers.  Their local beers are so good. I'm not from here but would come back in a minute. Service goes a long way! Manager- give kudos to bartender working 10/5 at 7:30pm at the bar.

cLJkMOtAhAAu_tf7_cH3nQ.text: One of the best places to go for good food and drinks at a reasonable price. Never disappointed in the service or selection offered on the menu. Definitely give it a try. Although, their known for their brewery the red or white sangrias...delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. White wine sangria. .delicious

7OkB4881RoVoQMpnrlQiHA.text: Yep.  This place is as good as it gets.  When I lived in Tempe, Boulders on Broadway was my friendly neighborhood bar.  Now that I have a more permanent location in the Arcadia area this is where I go.  A quick bike ride up the 48th street greenbelt and im there!   As everyone says, the back patio is awesome.  I spend the majority of my time here.  Love seeing all the different dogs and love all the local beer choices.  I am currently drinking quite a bit of dragoon IPA which they seem to always have on tap.  The prices are fair and the food is great.  I like their small bites menu for late night munchies.  A couple beers split up with a pretzel makes for a good night.    If you have friends in town and want to show them a little local flavor, check this place out.  So many local beers and they also micro-brew in house.  The back patio shows off our great weather, their menu features local ingredients such as the yucca chips.  This place is the epitome of your local bar.

-Xag1rLeHIxMQJWIM8ocug.text: Spent several hours sipping beer and munching on snacks at this awesome pub. First, for everyone who loves to take their beloved dog on field trips: the patio is dog friendly! Now that I've shared that crucial piece of information, I can talk about the other things I like about this establishment: The beer is great. This is the first "nanobrewery" I've ever been to, and based on the beer menu, "nano-" means a team of brewers that work in small batch to contribute to a beer menu that is full of options. For comparison: on most microbrewery tap lists you'll see maybe six different offerings. O.H.S.O. had over a dozen different beers to sample. The only caveat is that during my visit, at least four of the beers available were orange-flavored wheat ales, but I suspect they usually have a greater variety available. That said, I really liked my beer!  For munching, I ordered a plate of garlic shrimp tacos. They came with spicy cabbage slaw, salsa, and guacamole and I was really, really pleased! The portion size was ideal for a light lung and they were super tasty! The service was good. I totally recommend this place to anyone looking for yummy beer in the Phoenix area.

dHP624izxc1HA_k8Agnfqg.text: Love the patio atmosphere.   So many people taking their dogs with them for dinner and drinks.   Love it!   The beers were unique and the servers were overly friendly.   We'll be back!

KaeD-C8EMrVYkvEu8l7rZg.text: First time at this very popular place! We tried to get a seat on the back patio as the weather was beautiful - but it was a 45 min. wait! Our tummy's just couldn't wait that long so inside it was. But all was good. Our waiter was awesome. When we told him it was our first time at O.H.S.O., he gave us a 'tour' of the happy hour menu, explaining the beers, and just generally answered every question before we could ask.  The happy hour starter of thai-spiced hummus was so good! (I almost embarrassed myself by liking the bowl to get every last bit!) The beet salad followed, and as I usually do, I asked for the dressing on the side. It came with EVERYTHING on the side. I don't know if that's how they always serve it, but the spinach/greens on the plate, surrounded with little bowls containing the red and yellow beets, tomatoes, pecans, goat cheese, dressing. I piled everything on, drizzled on the dressing, and dug in. Very, very good. Fresh greens, the tomatoes tasted like tomatoes, beets yummy and the dressing flavorful. The brisket sandwich was huge! Half was taken home for lunch the next day. Flavorful bbq sauce. The menu indicates this this a staff choice and my son concurred! The spicy green chile pulled pork sandwich and jalapeno slaw was tasty, too! None left to take home, it was that good!  Good selection of beers and other libations. The flights are inexpensive and a great way to taste some of those beers you aren't too sure about!  Our waiter told us that another O.H.S.O is coming to the Paradise Valley Mall area...but didn't know when. That'll be awesome!   Another great find. Can't wait to go back!

_rZmonE-IMBfFiMuOmJUpQ.text: Ok, so I've been back a few times - couple for brunch and once for happy hour since my last review.    Overall, the foods mediocre and I noticed they serve the beer colder now.  I do appreciate the beer selection (the white chocolate one is my favorite, sweet but not too sweet like so many others!).  The shrimp tacos are passable, salmon flatbread brunch thing was ok.  Same with German sausage plate.    My favorite and the one dish I feel like beats other restaurants is the french toast.  This is the only thing I've found that would make me go - I would like to go to OHSO!

ZRdFJS8SXSjKPGs_whLafA.text: Great beer, great food, and if you are a dog lover..the most pet friendly restaurant ever!  Service is fantastic too. This is one place where we will go every trip to Phoenix.  My dog is craving O.S.H.o dog biscuits!

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yuki loves O.H.S.O dog biscuits.

pEvFOk-pUzcX3QlkqcbKGQ.text: I am just not a fan of the food.    THe beers are good location is great and the dog friendly patio is amazing.    The food is what brings the rating down for me.

9U_O4jZ-HLY0NsaCiGFDjA.text: Things I love: -The happy hour beer. $5 pitches of local beer is a spanking deal -The Thai hummus and ceviche, for a fresh snack -The cheese plate! Even this lactose-intolerant lady will steal a bite. -The valet, as parking is super limited  Things I don't love so much: -the cocktails. Poor form on my part, who gets a cocktail at a brewery -the entrees. They taste like they're just menu filler/something to eat with beer. Stick to many small plates.

27O_AfmZ7sEowS0bf9G5EA.text: O.H.S.O. is one of the many declining restaurants that is propped up by good food and a wide selection of beers and being dragged down by poor service.   I once went there for breakfast and had a waiter that was really spacey and inattentive. He had to be reminded of orders and things he forgot more than once. When I pointed out that fruit on my plate was moldy he took the single moldy piece of fruit off the plate ant set it back on my table reminding me that sometimes these things happen. Really? I've never been served moldy food before. That is disgusting and the completely wrong attitude.   I took that experience as a red flag, but didn't think it was damning. Yet another visit clued me in that my money is better spent elsewhere.  I went one night and sat in the bar one weeknight after the dinning room had closed. Just after I ordered food and drinks and group of people went from the bar to the patio to smoke. The patio opening is as wide as the patio so the smoke naturally blows into the bar. I mention the smoke to the bartender who brought our drinks and before I finished speaking she cut me off and said, "because you're sensitive?" in a completely inappropriate tone. I should have just left then and there. There is no excuse to be that rude to a guest.   Our food comes and it's less than impressive. The fries in my order were recooked. When the waiter cleared our table he dropped the two uneaten cups of mustard that come with the pretzels on the floor. He was upset because he got mustard on his pants. He wasn't that upset that he'd gotten it on the floor which explains why he left it there. When I left the table I slipped and nearly fell from it. What kind of jackass just dumps something you could slip on in front of your table?   I tried calling the restaurant to voice my discontent and no one would ever pick up the phone. I sent a message through a forum on their website. The response I got back was defensive and told me I should have talked to a manager that night. So should I have talked to the rude bartender or the guy to busy to clean up the mustard from the floor?!?! The message might as well have just been a suggestion of other restaurants to visit instead.

6RjMRiR7T2nhhkQy-w6grw.text: Just - wow. Pub-like menu with a creative twist makes for some truly delicious dishes. Try the AZ burger and the green chili dip with pineapple salsa (to die for!). Fun and relaxed atmosphere with absolutely fantastic service!

iEpD-rfUHV4cD7CI3IXR4Q.text: Don't give your car to valet. If they do something to it they are not responsible for any damages.   The food is ok and comparable to Applebee's and TGI Friday's and is a pretty cool hang out spot. It's always fun hanging out here but parking is a pain which keeps me away from this place.  The beer here is always good craft beer. They either brew it themselves or buy it from a local brewery.

CDckB46aXXjM2AgQt9RC9Q.text: Five stars without a doubt. My favorite spot in the Valley.  They offer dog treats from their spent beer grains.  Their beer is mediocre, but the service and experience more than makes up for it. Plus, they let ASH members put their beer on tap. VERY friendly to home brewers, and that's what counts!  For me, this is Heaven.

Nx7AV4aI5ZJjmhdNruTa-g.text: I ate there last night on the patio, where restaurant workers were taking soil from the peri-canal area where clearly people had been walking their dogs, filling and passing used plant containers with holes in the bottom over the fence, dust spewing all over. When I pointed this out to management as likely unsanitary to diners, I was ignored. When I again insisted that this should cease during service, the owner first insisted he hadn't been aware, then stated he had asked them to stop 20 minutes ago. The food was mediocre at best, and in this era of food-borne illness, I would avoid it. If they have so little concern about their diners' health to be tossing around buckets of dust during dinner on a windy day, who knows what's going on in the kitchen.

3GljSB3QF9oRLwObnfaLFA.text: One of my most favorite places to go!  And I haven't even tried the patio yet!  Loud enough that a "feisty" kid doesn't bother others but not so loud you can't talk to people at your table.  Food has been good and consistent.  Beer selection has yet to disappoint.  They focus on local...so I"m a fan!!!

s-kTrq_MJfM807GNXzQS8A.text: I really like this place.  Went on a hot Saturday afternoon just looking for drinks and a bite.  We sat on the patio, had excellent service, and pretty good food!  I had a veggie burger and hubby had the gnocchi, both were very good!  Highly recommend!!!

fN_20Ov9zPnjWK6mJWySEQ.text: LOVE this place! Great location. Neat bike theme. Fantastic food and beverage. Awesome patio. Excellent view of the mountain. Big tables available for big groups. Outstanding friendly staff. Even a dog friendly patio! They encourage walking and biking to their place. Which we do! Only reason for 4 stars and not 5? They need more deals on wine. But I guess it's a brewery...so Yeah..I guess I get it. But Dang it! I love wine!

np0oIq-YeNQHTgPC749nBg.text: Food is fantastic, my friends and I have been here many times and we have never had a bad experience.  The new back patio is great, service always good.  Good overall vibe there..

Vzm9RSgepXh2nzQBREf_hg.text: great food and beer for 10 bucks cant beat that.

33J_3Eo5Inar9RZHPSYYZA.text: I'd love to give this place more stars just based on the local beer selection and decent beer prices however the food leaves much to be desired and is way overpriced. Ordered a burger and honestly I think I would have enjoyed a Mickey D's Big Mac just as much and $9 cheaper. We also split a hummus and a cheese plate. The cheese plate was good but again overpriced and the hummus was pretty much inedible. Tasted more like unflavored bean dip than hummus. The decor and patio are major improvements over the former establishment. Service was good and friendly. Hope they improve the menu and food pricing.

HWvq6W8rYJjzPiAYtsZNww.text: I was excited about having another neighborhood restaurant, but after our experience there I've changed my mind. the green chile hummus was truly awful, tasted like hot spinach dip. and I keep wondering how they could ruin a grilled cheese sandwich, which had no arugula, one slice of bacon and one tomato slice. My friend's chopped veggie salad was small and sloppy on the plate. the service was friendly, and the beer prices and selection were good, but I agree with Melissa, DO NOT come here to eat. OHSO is only SOSO.

pvo_7XyzddqmdmlZ1BjkQw.text: OHSO has great food, a wonderful selection of beer, and a very cool, modern decor.  Above all, it looks and feels local.  Local beer, local ingredients, your neighborhood bar.  I really like this type of restaurant.  Keep it up guys.  We'll be back.

8O4pnculubBoL3y9HJYMZg.text: Perfection.  Excellent beer selection with lots of AZ beers.  Great patio with a nice view of Camelback Mountain.  Straightforward food with fresh, tasty ingredients.  Brunch with a beer?  My kind of people.  Everytime I go, I like it even more.

f1NfZtPYlmvfz2LYcCRoNw.text: Anyone who knows me or is a FB friend knows I love this place.  So when I order the shrimp tacos and I find the shrimp is scarcely cooked and send it back please don't come back and tell me the chef says I am wrong.  A petty battle of egos knows no place in a restaurant.  Okay, I'm finished.  See you soon.

rrAXmVPoj7WUIYNKTPYKeg.text: Quaint place, but service on Sundays is troublesome.  Took a party of 8 over two hours to get served the meal.  Food was ok - nothing to let the food network know about though.

44sA5QfQrhB2kBEADNDS5Q.text: I love this place, they offer great local beer and the food is excellent! The Mule is one of the best drinks I have had ever, it is made with fresh made ginger beer and it is awesome. One of my favorite new places to hang out.

LeRKEDRNOY3v1oYvmSzG-g.text: Went to OHSO on a Sunday afternoon for some Beers and Grub. Being that I mostly find myself hanging out in Downtown Scottsdale and Arcadia I had felt bad by not showing them some love. Wish I could say the love was returned. For only being open as short of a time as they have been what a dirty place. I sat and watched at least five of the beer taps constantly drip which in turn created rust spots dripping down the same cabinets that were just painted over from German Corner. The food was a two. Brisket sandwich was a gut busting stomach rock and if you are going to try to do breakfast/brunch it really shouldn't be that difficult . As we were leaving we ran into some local food industry people we knew and found out about a back patio which you really wouldn't know was there if it wasn't pointed out. Was hoping for a mind-blowing patio to save our overall experience but ended up being a bar made of 2x4's with a bunch of fruit flies and a not so great view of the Scottsdale drainage canal. Woohoo.

43cGdUnJiAlnLZ4pVVYoYg.text: OHSO is a great neighborhood bar and eatery.  I'm not even really sure why they have a full bar, because anyone who likes beer can always find some awesome craft beers on tap here.  The beer brunch is a great deal; $10 gets you a filling meal and a 10 oz AZ craft beer.  Their green chili dip and hummus are great appetizers - both come with yucca chips and those are amazeballs!  The grilled cheese and hot pastrami are my two favorite meals there.  The Sunday BBQ on the patio is a crazy amount of great BBQ food.  It's endless, but I have no idea who can get a second helping.  I still have yet to try their late night menu or bloody marys, both of which look promising.  The service is hit or miss...everyone is always very nice, just not always prompt.  Which is ok, because usually when we go it's to hang out for a while and try a few new beers on tap in addition to a meal.  Their patio is great, and is dog friendly which is always a good thing.  They have homemade doggie treats also, which are a big hit with the pups.  Thanks for being a great local spot!!

GezgudKcLdbhtuamk4Mm4g.text: If you're a beer fan, run - don't walk to O.H.S.O. (Full name = O.H.S.O. Eatery + Nano Brewery)  I've never seen so many craft beers and such a large representation of small and local breweries.  This place  has all the ingredients of a great casual neighborhood hang out. Perfect kind of place to ride your bike to - location is very North East Phoenix in the Arcadia neighborhood. The ambiance  -  It felt to me a little bit like being at a friend's house.  Inside - very comfortable - not stuffy at all.  Outside patio seating is really welcoming.   Love seeing the orange umbrellas on the patio facing Indian School Rd. - It just looks like HAPPY!  While were there we saw all ages, even some little kids with mommies having a 'girls' lunch'.  Plenty of variety on the menu - Items look really good and interesting spin on casual with a twist - from the familiar burgers  - Yummy with Gouda and bacon - house-made tomato soup to these cute little corn cake sandwiches.  Lots of smaller appetizer items to snack on.  The proprietor - Jon - even came over and introduced himself.  I'd say this would be a great place to meet up with some friends, and try a few new brews, watch a game, with a very decent accompaniment of tasty small plates or bigger meals.

0I8A3hU7EXoF1Bkmw4w_6g.text: We enjoyed a wonderful afternoon of lunch and beers, and were looked after by super friendly staff. This included having to opportunity to chat to brewers and a sneak peak behind the scenes into their brewing operations. We can't fault this whole experience. A tip to visitors, order the Brewers Board off the food menu.

l_I93P4PyyQU52rJoOjMfg.text: My favorite thing about OHSO is that you can bring your furbabies!!!!!! We love bringing Oscar to OHSO and enjoying an ice cold beer and brunch or an appetizer. We really just love the atmosphere & Oscar loves the homemade dog treats!!   Last night, we hopped on our bikes and zipped over for some Monday Night Football and tacos!! {Their Carne Asada Tacos are amazing!!!} I love the Orange Blossom wheat beer from Papago and also their seasonal Pumpkin Chai beer that is made in house! Now that it is cooling down, I will be making frequent visits with the pooch! I'll be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummy pretzel board!!! Perfect paired with a delicious beer from their fabulous beer list!
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This is not the best photo, it was super dark where we were sitting but the Carne Asada Tacos are fab!!

Ti51lUBI1BCbsU1wqj8_zg.text: This is the worst service I've had. They wouldn't serve my parents and I saying we were stumbling in when we had had one beer all day. They were rude and absolutely ridiculous and I will never eat there again.

BkhyT0An4X2mvPvzGl4EqQ.text: I had heard OHSO was dog-friendly but I was completely struck by the degree. The patio is quite chaotic but if you're a dog-lover, it's a happy chaos. I should have known that it would be super-crowded on a Sunday. Luckily, I only had a dog with me and I was willing to sit at the communal table. So, no wait. I loved all the little touches they did to make dogs feel welcome _ from the paper water bowl with the dog's name written on to the wrapped homemade dog treats. The only thing is with so many dogs, everybody wants to sniff. I had to keep one eye on my pooch to make sure she wasn't pulling her leash and possibly tripping someone.  I love the ambience. The food gets almost as good marks. I went with the "breakfast bowl" which had scrambled eggs, cheese, guacamole, potato hash and pico de gallo. It was very solid but not knock-your-socks-off. I was expecting some melted cheese, not sprinkling of grated cheddar and white cheese. Next time I go, I will have to order something more heartier or carby so that I feel really full after. But it's a pretty good brunch deal as it includes either a beer or a mimosa.  I felt weird doing valet for just myself and a dog. So I parked at the nearby Safeway and walked not quite a block. I preferred it over waiting for the valet in a very crowded lot. But I will definitely be back--dog in tow.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Penny on the patio.
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Penny enjoying OHSO patio.

_nH3ckY0j1eYY5iksV5ioA.text: Interesting patio. Too many dogs. Food ok, beer better...pkg tough & ingress/egress as well.

jA2Zmlikc91kLq9B_GLqlA.text: I've been here a few times, and I just LOVE their Mac del mar. Their brisket Mac is delicious too! I just can't get over it! But this day that I went, I decided to try something different. I tried the surf and turf. I was expecting a steak and shrimp, but when the dish arrived, you can see in my picture that they were pieces of steak and shrimp. I didn't hate it. It was tasty, and very low carb.   I still prefer the macaroni and cheese whether it be the brisket or the del mar. They have such a wide selection of beers too and you'll definitely find something you'll like. The past few times I've been though, I've been wishing they would have frosty glasses or that the beer would be colder. And that would be my only gripe. I still like this place a lot though!

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mac del mar. My favorite! Mmmmm
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Surf and turf

S8u-iusBr9nTIWs3taleuQ.text: Great place to take your Dog ! The food is average American style and sometimes the service is hit and miss. If I did not have a dog I would not go , but I do have a dog ! The burger is a solid choice and is tasty. The OHSO in paradise valley is bigger and now nicer .

e8mugSCfcRzT94FdcqIptg.text: OSHO Arcadia is a never fail, always a solid go-to weekend brunch choice.  Mimosa and food, about $10.  Enjoyable atmosphere, back patio is the best.  Large booths, ample shade, cool fans in bike tires and the best puppy watching!  And the Jalapeno Beer, if they have it, it's I think seasonaly, highly recommend!

F0vMbdckoy4cZYqTiAt5Qw.text: My boyfriend and I came here on our vacation after hiking Camelback Mountain...Great food, great brews, and great atmosphere hit the spot! Dog friendly patio made it extra fun for me!

qs41T2pIOz_-mVbROuKatg.text: All we wanted to do was go to Trader Joes after our hike but we were lured into OHSO by the steel drum music we heard from outside. "Brewery!? Let's go!" Glad we did! The atmosphere outside was awesome, which was both dog and child/baby friendly. I got the Happy Hefe and my husband got the Hoppy beer, which we both enjoyed. Didn't try anything else, including the food, but we will probably be back! Visiting AZ for a few weeks on our year long journey around the US, which you can follow at tandaintheusofa.com!

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Barking bar! No humans allowed!

VoMWE5gliVGjmh9PlqKjtA.text: You think you wanna take you pet out to dinner with you to a nice restaurant?!! Just visit OhSo!! They are just so pet friendly, its hard to believe. And not just that, they have a great selection of burgers and salads! I was actually surprised that my burger was so damn fine.   This is a great setting for dinner and beer on a summer eve. Would definitely visit again!

D7NmjVF67utPW0kU8-zIew.text: Been to OHSO twice and I'm told it used to be the home of the softball team: The Nuts...all of these people were different sorts from Salty to Sweaty...  This last time I chose to take my friend Matt and his wife who were flying out of Sky Harbor early in the AM.  The last time I'd been here the popsicle beer was out, so glad we got two pitchers...but let's be honest when it comes to pitchers these days...bring me the big pitchers where I can get five beers and not two and a half please!  I also tried the Winter is Coming and that was the business.  It's not that my friend Matt and his wife shared the Mac Del Mar but they both got it! I must say it was delicious.  I split the Chile burger with my girlfriend and that was on point for the second time.  Matt had ordered up the artichoke dip and that was also legit.  I've been meaning to run here for brunch, will definitely have to, then I'll walk home.

LeXnll_7qa7u6cj8vDANKw.text: The wait staff took very good care of us.  I enjoyed the beer selection.  My brother liked the first beer he had so much that he ordered it again.  My wife and brother had the chicken and waffle entree.  It was really big and very rich.  They both were very happy to have ordered it and our dog enjoyed the leftover chicken when we got home.  I had the brisket Mac and cheese and found it very tasty.  We usually go to the Hayden store but met here since my brother was staying in a downtown hotel.  I prefer the layout of the smaller local store with its easier parking but that is just preference. There was nothing to complain about other than trivial matters.  Going here again would be fine if it was easier for the person we were to meet.

c2tpMHtRN7OKFGnORgN_WA.text: Sometimes I stop here for lunch because of the great food and friendly service. My favorites are the tacos and wings. Burgers are also a win!  OHSO also has a great selection of beer to choose from.

ALLocnrkrwu-Tk9CfcWZmQ.text: Hands down, this is one of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix.  They brew their own beer and have a great list of local brews, they allow dogs on the patio (and give them goodie bags), food is great and each location varies their menu slightly, and they have a $10 beer brunch (for $10 you get a 10 oz beer + brunch).  I used to frequent this place when I lived in Phoenix.  When I visited last year I saw that they now make their own whiskey too!

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States

VYFThOSf5X7KTL1jKg8X1w.text: We took my dad here for his birthday and at the end of the meal they gave him a FREE brownie and ice cream in a skillet! We sat on the back patio at about 10:30 am and it was gorgeous out. Tons of people brought their dogs which made it a really fun, relaxed environment! All the dogs were calm and well behaved. They also have a little area where you can grab water and treats for your pet! I ordered the avocado toast on wheat bread which included 2 over-easy eggs and a slice of tomato. So so good and not too unhealthy! It also came with a side of chopped potatoes which were plain, no seasoning, but tasted good. I love that you get a free mimosa or beer with the brunch special. My mimosa was larger than the menu said it would be but I didn't complain! Haha. The server was attentive at refilling our cucumber waters. Love this place, can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dog friendly!
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. So sunny on the patio! Delish mimosa!
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Artistic decor on the back patio.

4XutiFc7ZACqCOCJOQwieA.text: Dog hair all over the patio tables. It's more like a kennel out there. Dogs everywhere! Came for Happy hour, but only deals on liquor not food. The entrees are expensive! I left after I peeped the dog hair. lol

ICpz01unyFqr-boT8zcE8g.text: OHSO is a great place for all you brunch enthusiasts out there. Reasons why it's great: You can bike the canal and end up here and they have a station for you to park. They pour a S ton of champagne in your mimosa. The DOGS. Today I got sat next to four dogs and I might walk out with one. I don't have a dog but they make dog treats that you can take on the way out. They are apparently good because I convinced someone I was dating they were cookies for adults one time. He said it wasn't bad. Oh and the food is pretty good.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States

MHAa1Y7kqO17iWT59UESpw.text: I've driven past OHSO about 1000 times and finally stopped by today for lunch. No idea what to expect. No idea what the letters OHSO mean. No idea how expensive of a lunch I'm about to have. Well OHSO...is Oh So Fine! Cool looking interior, nice bar, friendly hostess and server. Fine looking brewery in deed.  The logo on the menu made me smile. I often will criticize a restaurants menu because most of the time they're thrown together with very little thought. I like the type treatment with a motorcycle graphic.  But what about the beer and food you ask?  The beer I don't know about except that it's extensive and some day I'll be back with a designated driver. The food I can tell you about. I ordered the Angry Bird chicken sandwich, a $15 dollar sandwich. What??? Wow, better be one hella good sandwich. And the soup on the side was kale and chicken. Hmm, sounds bland. Well not the case! I was totally impressed! Fried chicken so good! Sauces really interesting and a spice with an extra kick. Soup had about 30 ingredients and home made chicken broth with an amazing flavor. But that sandwich was worth the price. Delicious and a little different than your average chicken sandwich.  OHSO is outstanding. I'll be back. I'll be back because I want to try the artichoke dip. And I'll be back because I forgot what the heck OHSO stands for. It's on the sign right when I walked in...Outrageous, something something. Ah who cares, I just need to get a beer and try a burger or pastrami. Next time!

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oh so fine! I recommend the chicken sandwich!

JGQQoe5LiX1DPP8qyqY0ug.text: We went with a decent sized group. 7 adults and 5 kids. We were about to sit on the patio out front with us alone.  *They offer complimentary valet parking  We had a nice, attentive waitress. We ordered all from the brunch menu. My whole table ordered the Chicken and Waffles. When it came out we were shocked at how huge the single serving portion was. We probably could have just shared it with one other person. It comes out layered. One fresh waffle, a well seasoned, hard fried chicken breast and then another waffle, another breast and then another waffle with FIVE pieces of bacon on top and softened butter on the side and spicy maple syrup (had hot sauce it in - or at least that's what it tasted like). It was a lot of food but it was all delicious and it came with either a free mimosa or a beer. All of it was good. Also, all the water is served with a slice of cucumber in it- super refreshing as always. A nice touch and nice alternative to the usual lemon wedge.   A friend picked this place but we'll for sure be back either as a group or with my family individually. They had a nice option of food for children too. All were happy and we had plenty of space and didn't feel like one of those places where kids are simply 'tolerated' but where they are welcomed. (At least during daylight hours).

MI0wMmZayzIs32rMmTgLpA.text: I've been to OHSO many times before and normally just go to drink on their awesome patio out back.  Today I went for lunch with a work friend.    We both ordered the same thing actually.  The green chile pulled pork sandwich with fries.    The spice of the green chile was perfect.  Not overwhelming as some green chile can be.  The slaw made a perfect combo on the sandwich and the bun was so soft and tasted like it was made this morning.   Their fries are perfectly crispy with great seasoning.  No ketchup needed with these fries.  I sat at the bar and was taken care of quite nicely by one of the two bartenders they had on staff.  Love this place and will be back for sure!

xVO4g0WeBMdBjyS-IjoWHQ.text: If you serve Papago Orange Blossom, I'm probably going to give you 4 stars for that alone. This says more about how much I love Papago Brewery than it does about O.H.S.O., but that's how good this beer is.   Another thing I love? Cream cheese. And at O.H.S.O., they put that on a burger. I can't tell you how good this combo is. It's mouthwatering. Honestly, nothing else I've tried was worth ordering again. That cream cheese, jalapeno burger ruined me. It is so good, that I have to stay away from this place unless I want to start exclusively wearing pants with elastic waistbands.

LoNBrgg1jp9NPDo8dk6D-g.text: Awesome awesome awesome awesome brunch experience. There was a bit of a wait for Sunday brunch but the weather was really nice outside. So The wait gave me and my best friend a chance to look at the store Products of shirts  and mugs.we ended up purchasing two cool shirts that said #vodka. The shirts were great because the store makes its own vodkaWhat I did love about brunch was with the entree you receive  a large glass a Mimosa for a penny & the mimosas were great Made with great champagne & didn't make it all bubbly for the day. My  choice of brunch  was the chicken and waffles . the waffles were great ,the bacon was cooked perfectly the chicken was seasoned. Great seating areas inside in out. The bar was very chaotic. Only thing I didn't like because it was also a gathering spot for people waiting for tables and to pay for merchandise. I ended up having my server run my card for the peso stuff. He didn't mind. Will be back they next time in Arizona

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States

RalOsW21zkAvL8BV5kTf4g.text: I had the guac b chips n Ensalada Del Sol salad... it was so awesome! Took my 3 fur babies n staff was so accommodating n genuinely friendly. Highly recommend this place to everyone... it's a must go!

pSBIh8H5xKGae92cYxJqEg.text: Yes it's has friendly cool wait staff a nice open patio that is dog friendly but a sprinkle of Scottsdale douchebaggery and hipsters but comes with the territory. Weekends are extremely busy for breakfast and lunch. Valet is probably the best choice or if you bike there they have bike parking behind the patio by the canal. The  menu for the most part is new american but has a variety from pulled pork to stuffed won-tons. I like the late night and happy hour menus too. Ridiculous amount of draft beers and at the inside bar some cool one off scotch whiskies and I think even sakes(maybe it was Asian scotch) to try. If you're trying to be seen or checking out the talent that Scottsdale brings go on a weekend late morning early afternoon but prepare to wait. If you want good beer something to eat and just wanna chill try a weeknight.

H_7rqAa0UqHq-8Efzk1VAg.text: Overrated. The Mac and cheese was dry and old, burger was average.  Atmosphere is nice but the food is okay at best and the kids Mac and Cheese for my daughter was disgusting. Box Mac and cheese would have honestly been better.

hWnZFW15IW32cp8M-DvVSQ.text: Delicious brunch!  Hostess staff was great and we were sat in less than the quoted time.  Our server Justin was killing it!  Chill service, very personable.   I had the avocado toast which was exactly what I wanted, but kind of skimpy on the avocado :/ Can't wait to come back and bring the pup!

m8UkK4st2BvL91ODCy6ZaQ.text: I want to like this place, but their food is not that great, and their wait staff is meh. The beer selection is decent, but the beer that they, themselves, make is not good. Not entirely bad if my friends drag me here, but not somewhere I'd really choose to go.

J06PNsQ0UZmBP6qt2GVMLg.text: I'm in love with Ohso Arcadia! The bartenders are the bestest, burgers for dinner and the scramble for brunch are my fave. Right now the grapefruit cocktail is my go to... or of course the monster mimosas!!

6cguyMF27761uk2GPAyk8A.text: The one star was for the dessert, which was phenomenal! Other than that... sub par menu, sub par food. Dog friendly my ass! They escort you around the building to the "backyard" dogs are friendly here, but what restaurants aren't dog friendly with outdoor sitting. Needless to say I brought a puppy, which I tried to carry through the inside to the back, but was stopped in my tracks and told to go to the backyard. You will not be seeing me eating here again. Maybe a takeout on dessert night. My dog and I will stick to our own backyard.

sIU1wFK7EizJoMBCc5Yp2Q.text: Didn't come here for brunch like a lot of Yelpers seemed to have. No, I came on a regular weekday for lunch. I met a good friend and our experience wasn't what I was hoping for. I do love the feeling that this restaurant exudes. It really felt like a cool place to hang out. My buddy T ordered the Cobb Salad ($12) Spring mix, Bacon, baby Tomato, Avocado, Corn, Blue Cheese Crumbles, egg, Cucumber & citrus vinaigrette.  The lettuce was old, the bacon was missing and he said the vinaigrette tasted like ass. Here's the problem. Why did the cold prep station make a salad with old, wilted, gross, spring mix? Why didn't the server look at the salad and refuse to bring it out and tell them to make a new one? Why didn't either notice the bacon was missing? No bueno. T decided that since putting a salad together is pretty basic and he felt it was obvious they couldn't handle it, he would just pass on lunch. The manager took the salad off the bill. I ordered the Green Chile Pork Skillet ($12). Hatch Green Chile's, pulled Pork, roasted Corn, aloha rice, Cotija, Poblano Aioli, and pickled red Onion. The flavors were fine. The portion size was appropriate for the price and it came out steamy hot. It all worked together nicely. There were not a lot of people in the restaurant. The one thing T commented on was that as I was paying my bill and subsequently walking out he noticed the chef, or one of the chefs, chatting away with one of the waitresses by the host stand. T thought it was interesting that the chef had the time to stand around chit chatting @ 1:15 instead of maybe, checking the prep work of his staff since they just had something returned. Nice ambiance. Lousy Parking. Questionable food preparation standards. Fair Pricing. 2 Stars.

dYryZU3qv-uVXDZ7YwF9mw.text: Great for a day out with you and your best dog!    The food isn't fancy but it is good and consistent.  However, I go for the outdoor dog friendly patio and the amazing atmosphere.    The dog friendly patio - has a water bowl bar, dog treats, and even a dog cool off area.  I love how you can ride your bike down the canal to get here too.    I just hope that now that it is summer they figure out how to keep the patio cooler.  Maybe a nice sail shade :)

D2xIz18O4-lYOTbezOGOvw.text: This has been the best restaurant I've been to in the area. Back in the day I worked for a really good burger restaurant and I didn't think a burger could get any better. Well OHSO proved me wrong! I ordered the AZ burger (pink) with fries, ranch, and one of their beers and everything was great!

UAK908i0KcI-76bPFlJAJA.text: Beer was served warm. Not European temp. Warm. Pretzel plate was ok, but mustard was bitter. Brisket Mac was ok but not overly exciting. I wasn't paying, so I am not heart broken about the experience, but I see no reason to go back...

1dI5U5eBw_I_nfg-a7ksSw.text: I am a huge fan of the concept of this place. The food was killer the beer was awesome! Literally everything on the menu was impressive!  We sat on the patio where there were tons of puppies out playing while the servers dipped and dogged over the dogs as if they weren't even there. My only complaint was that the service was a little bit slow. We had finished our entrees before the waitress had asked us if we wanted to order another beer. Other than that I will most certainly be going back!

QYCRczxcZBA7jJqaKj-BGg.text: We were 5 in our party. Mac Del Mar was just spicy enough and filled with seafood. The Salmon, although cooked a bit too much for my taste was delicious and served with perfect roasted veggies - Brussel sprouts, turnips, carrots. The brisket sandwich was full of meat. The braised beef short ribs were the best! Just enough gravy and those wonderful grilled veggies. Unreal selection of beers and a decent wine collection. Hurry and open in Gilbert!

o3dbn1FhZgPUS73EC8c9Qg.text: This review is for the bar only. The atmosphere is great. The bartenders were friendly, but there has to be a better way to show which beers are out. Upon sitting at the bar we were given a beer list almost immediately. My husband and I each selected a beer. Each beer we chose was out. Now its a busier Saturday night so we look at the list for a few minutes and wait a few minutes to order our beer. We then look again. 5 beers later between the two of us we each find a beer that is available.   Now your speciality is Homebrewers. I understand beers will run out, but there has to be a better way to show whats available.

u0AtVoZcNNph3Q6bsPjJ0w.text: Good food and beer. Decent atmosphere; albeit a bit formulaic and lacking originality.  Service was actually pretty good! Just wish I could have poured my own beer from the pitcher instead of our server.  Four stars based on what I've seen from the city so far, would have been three back in Stumptown.

OLjW56s5p0bv3gtTG1qlxA.text: I've only gone on the weekend for Sunday brunch but if that's what you're interested in, read on!  The service : excellent!  The price: considering the atmosphere and opportunities for play and pets, very good! The food: yum, yum! Go on a Sunday, sit outside with your pooch and kids. Then join in on the fun or sit back and relax. Play bean bag toss, ping pong and other outdoor games. The misters are cool and the huge fans work well. Your dog can meet and greet others. You won't regret the visit or the wait.

MJRdGoomtkr1RCCXCb5hlg.text: I would come back here everyday if I could.   Too bad I live across the country, can you open one in Boston?  This is a perfect spot for dog owners, which I am.    So much beer, so much great food, so many wonderful dogs!   I met some friends here while on a business trip and I had no idea what a gem this was from the front.  As soon as you walk in, there's this great outdoor patio, great inside area and as you continue to the back patio, it opens up to a whole new world!  The beer was fantastic.  Craft brewed, and I ordered a small pitcher of amber on my own.  I got a burger and fries and it was juicy, tasty and went perfectly with the beer.  One of my friends ordered fish taco's and I had the pleasure of taking a bite.   Yep, I'll be getting those next time.  Fantastic place and I will come back any chance I get!

LqZ6F-58WIldSCi1dB-rEw.text: This joint had been on my bookmarked list of "gotta try" for quite a few months.  I'm not often in the area, but my buddy's wife planned his surprise b-day party here - so I happily agreed to kill two birds with one stone.  Ambiance is nice, beer was delicious and cold, and the food was great.  The service was solid, and upon finding out that I dabble in home-brewing, he mentioned the ability to come to O.H.S.O. and brew your own with the assistance of the brewmasters.  I was pretty impressed, not many breweries take the time to do something like that - so we downloaded the handy dandy app and were able to see the upcoming dates that were available.  They are currently booked through the end of November, but the concept is so cool that I will check periodically to book a brewing session.  I just love it when you can tell a place has passion for what they do, and this place was no exception.

WWYE2l9P-UaRDD3bkb-YHw.text: Thanks so much for responding to my original Yelp post. Went back and had an amazing meal and experience!

MzDcWqBFjF10piEpxZmAVA.text: If I lived closer I would probably eat and drink here weekly.  The outside patio is the best part about this place!  I love how a lot of patrons ride their bikes to OHSO and how they have a bike hanging from the outside bar.  If you like beer and I mean good beer you will enjoy this place!  They have an amazing amount of beers on tap and support all of the Arizona micro brews!  The food is alright...my favorite is the pastrami sandwich!  Doesn't matter your age you will enjoy this place and the owners seem like real good guys and have put a lot effort making this place great!

QH0Dg70Dp5KATOo2muK5jA.text: Been here several times, always have a great time. Great food, Great Service, and of course Great local beer selection.  While is does get noisy from time to time, I still find it a great place to take a date.  Introduced many people into the world of beer here, and plan to continue!

ehSUZTrSJDuCR8790qcw-g.text: I love the atmosphere of this place and has a really cozy back patio. You can't go wrong with the 4 cheese flatbread pizza and they are always nice enough to throw on some pesto for me too. I like the beer and wine selection but the only thing I have found is they seems under staffed when I have been there. Other wise thumbs up.

-Rsa7XjDIDsoelBYoVJ5jg.text: First let me say that I have been to OHSO several times and genuinely enjoy this place. As of late I am not overly impressed with some places in the neighborhood. They seem too uppity and lose their appeal after the first beer. The first thing that hits me is the valet at the front door. The parking lot is congested and very limited in parking already. Now you get to throw in taking away spots to a "complimentary valet" that is worthless. They park your car 30 yards from the front door when you could open up more parking for regular customers. I wasn't even going to use the valet and found them inappropriate, rude, and almost killed my experience before entering the place. Our bartender comped our food after hearing our complaint which was nice but no one should have to apologize for a crappy service that can easily be taken away...I thank you for seeing the problem and addressing your customers.  For the bar itself, the beer is always good and the food is pretty good. The location is  awesome and I will probably come again but I will take a look around and see what can accommodate a more laid back group.

_Q4VkLm10lICUt_9-UK7SQ.text: Great addition to the Indian School corridor.  I love the location along the canal and the patio has great views of Camelback Mountain.  There is an extensive beer list and the drafts are reasonably priced.  The vibe is very cool and the bartender was extremely friendly and helpful.

z5DB7CAS6sZsFRbLqjvD_w.text: So I didn't try the beer BUT the bloody mary's are amazing.  A-ma-zing.  I also ordered the pork arepa.  Super flavorful and the perfect amount if you're beyond starving, which I was.  My friend ordered the green chili pulled pork sandwich which was equally as good.  I will definitely be back.  If anyone has had a bad experience here, it must've been a fluke...

msN7oTPjWUxwmtSme3mg4g.text: Love this place. Great food. A large beer selection. The patio area is unique and is pet friendly. It even has a "Barking Bar" where your pup can get a drink of water.

-GAb3xCW41lAQfr4TWpB6A.text: Being from Seattle, we love to go to brewerys and try local beers. The food was good as was the service. Definitely worth trying.

RHg2Jd7cQozPp0MLlT0XSA.text: Great selection of beer and very friendly to cyclists!  The food here is good as well !  Parking is a little tight but overall a great experience!

duGlizTY3nt4d4ti0_jhFg.text: I have been here a few times too.  Mostly for happy hour.  You cant beat the 6 buck pitchers.  I just wish they would add some food items to the HH menu.  The food is good, the location is good, the atmosphere is good.  Its all good!

tTLpi-EeLjtcT44NdQiw1g.text: Great changing beer list, without pandering to the mainstream boring choices. Manager Paul is a class act.

8hFgXo4CPOJCBPCu3fKDOQ.text: The Grovey was great. Too bad their disbelief in AC and their pretentious, annoying clientele make you only want to stay for one pint.

Yp2HLUO29XGIUR5G-nnZOw.text: Wow! What excellent place. Definitely get a burger and go for the white chocolate ale. Loved it!! Plus they allow you to bring your dog to the back patio. Sweet.

injPsaa3h4h3uNdUwj0dJw.text: Recently stopped in on a Sunday and didn't have the best vibe for some reason. Perhaps it was just too busy. Also, the salmon BLT I ordered didn't really sit well. I like the beer they brew there so I'll probably be back and give it another try.

J5oSydWcqzrHJiTSsLepGQ.text: It was a great meal. Love the beers. Think this place has a few kinks to work out on their menu. But welcome to the Arcadia hood we look forward to you succeeding!

0CEA_dWRmJ26s3LkEdMGDw.text: I've been here twice and not impressed - seems highly overrated. The view is nice from the patio and it is right next to the canal - also the barking bar is cute. I would go back after biking along the canal for a quick beer but that's about it.

jfEPioiAqVSYJkzB1CtfAg.text: Great Place. Seat yourself. Quick service. Friendly staff. I'm a vegetarian and there were several options. There was a full brewery, and a full bar with great selection of wine as well as signature cocktails. I had the veggie burger. Flavorful and very hearty. It was a bit spicy. But I like spicy. The flourless chocolate was amazing and worth going just for that! This is a great place to hangout with friends, bring a date or a pet :-)

s4RE0UM1oiTYlz3XQvavgA.text: Enjoyed the extensive beer list.  With hot summer days just around the corner...and this place just around MY corner...the thought of summer just became a tad bit more tolerable!

IYyp6JOGfe0EX4JYCHdjhg.text: Giving it 2-stars because of the food and beer...  however, I haven't had this bad of a service in a long time!!!   We sat at the outside bar and both bartenders were horrible!  Un-attentive, rude, slow and plain awful.  The atmosphere is good for a younger crowd, otherwise I wouldn't recommend.  Might be back to try their newer brews coming up but this first visit left a lot to wish for...

yeL5uSJB94C9OOwWNhOU7A.text: I love everything about this place, and frequent it often for many reasons. The wait staff is always in a good mood, and pays attention to you even if the place is packed. The food is original, different than the run of the mill bar, and the craft beers are on point. You can try many beverages without breaking the bank. For $1 you can sample the many local and foreign brews. On the weekend you can stop in for a $10 brunch which includes a drink. They have good bbq, great appetizers, and I haven't had anything I didn't really enjoy and that's a serious plus. For their brunch the flatbread with breakfast on top rocks my socks. I would suggest this to my friends and I'll see you there! :)

fbMQhMvFRRmBlxhaZDb2ow.text: We absolutely love this place! Such an awesome idea to create a bar where you can bring your dog. We drive all the way from the west side at least once a week because we love it so much. Great happy hour prices and pretty good food as well. Try the seafood Mac n cheese or tacos are my fav!

G94vWCtSn8CFyCvqOB2cNA.text: Definitely a great place to go to! Patio is perfect especially for the type of weather we've been having lately. I had the pulled pork, husband had the burger and cheese, 3 yr old had the chicken tenders. Also tried one of their low hop beers. We were all happy that we didn't even feel the desire to try one another's order lol the fries too! They were crunchy throughout and didn't get soggy or hard. My pulled pork had just the right amount of spicy and even though it was really juicy, the bread that it was on served on soaked it up to where the taste of the bread and juice made it even more of a 10!  The burger was flavorful as opposed to places where the patty isn't seasoned enough. The sauce was just the right amount and gave it that extra kick while still keeping that hint of ketchup.  Needless to say we finished everything on our plates and the portions were huge. Reasonable price and service was great! We'll be back for sure!

CuzgHQD-UZEJHGd00pisLQ.text: Over the weekend we had my husband's 30th birthday dinner at OHSO-Arcadia and had 17 guests. They were able to accommodate our large group in a semi-private room (the Brew Room) and it was perfect. The food, beer and service were all outstanding. We will definitely be back!

7m6bDUn7JAH2GhjuRC3VDA.text: Beer brunch? I don't mind if I do. Great food great local/national beer with bartenders who know what beer really is all about...and even how to mix beers. Great gravy. BTW bring your dog.

Lcc-cF8JayTS1LwO8zIByg.text: I love this place - great food & great atmosphere! They have yummy salad and FANTASTIC Blackened Salmon Tacos. Dog friendly. Bike friendly. Good tunes. Parking is a pain, but they have complimentary valet. Totally recommend!

fomkFucl5ivCrbXeunYrUA.text: Popular indoor/outdoor casual dining: sports bar inside with dog friendly patio.  Very attentive service and (as a nearby resident) one of my top neighborhood FAVS!  Love the salads and there's also a variety of other yummy menu options!

AEcW5qcUznGsMnvpTXP5Sg.text: The atmosphere is great, the food is alright... Be aware the sides are very big portions but the entrees are very small. Overall, I wasn't impressed but it is Scottsdale and the environment is beautiful making the patio dining pleasurable. I am told brunch is stellar, but they can keep their lunch.

ly5b9SkcXnjiYsVYiTmpYg.text: The atmosphere and the food are amazing. This place is a great hang out spot that feels upscale but it's very casual. I had the pleasure of eating the BBQ burger and it was one of the best I've ever had.

94mRmLBzYkZCRa9ry0QXIw.text: Seriously love this place! Fantastic local brewery just in general :)

sAmQCVpWjr1K_zUEiKlvQg.text: OHSO always makes me OSHO happy.  We enjoy biking the 5ish miles from home to OHSO and hanging out on the patio.  We're actually thinking of getting bike trailer to put the dogs in, because we know they'd love to go to OHSO too!  Overall the drinks are great, service is fantastic, and the food is pretty good (we've found a couple landmines on the menu).  Brunch is an awesome deal - $10 for a brunch entree and it includes an AZ beer or a mimosa (a big mimosa!).

Dxo8W3iBVPmdjrS99_FMfg.text: Delicious food, just wish I had more to enjoy. Great beer choices, full bar, just sad to have spent 9.00$ on guacamole and 15$ on pork and I'm still hungry.

OBSOP-nmPcxoJOhaE2af9A.text: Great for a night out! We had an awesome time with the extensive beer and cocktails selection. Their happy hour prices are spectacular- a pitcher of beer ended up being just a dollar or two more than a glass. Our group of 12 or so had awesome service outside on the front patio. Everything we ordered food-wise was great too- artichoke dip, green chile dip, sandwiches, etc.  My only real quibble here is with the parking. One, the lot is tiny compared to the number of people the place can hold, and parking is very tight. Secondly, there is optional valet parking, which is apparently free but that fact isn't well marked anywhere that we saw. The stop and go of the valet parking tends to get in the way of the non-valet parking and overall it seems like there is no real benefit to having the valet.

wTA4mjnbaByt_xpaO2jKbQ.text: I've been to OHSO once before and it didn't inspire a review one way or another. This time I felt the urge.  Of the lengthy beer menu, OHSO has 3 of their own in-house brews. Two of which they were out of which is ok because the one left was an IPA. I like IPAs, this was not an IPA. It was bad. This "IPA" came in a pitcher. It reminded me of those beers that are made by another brewery but have a different label slapped on the bottle. My buddy and I couldn't finish it. It had the bottom of the keg, sat too long in the lines taste to it. Did I mention, not good? On to the next beer, a guest beer, Mother Road, it was advertised as hoppy and malty... What was I thinking? I hate mixing my malts with hops and verse vicea. Once again, it tasted like it was long in the lines. I peered over at the bar, crap, these guys have like 30 taps! I'll never get a fresh beer unless I get the same that everyone else gets. Lame. It's not a brewery but a tap house. Crap.   After BSing about all things dude, our food comes. I ordered a cheeseburger. The meat was HOT and cooked properly but the rest was just a mess. The bun was waaaay too big for the patty, two small slices of roma tomato and a rib of romaine were dwarfed by the bready top and fat soaked bottom. The bacon must have been sliced by a Ginsu knife because you could read through it. And if I didn't see the cheese, I would not have known it was there. The fries were good; crispy and salty. I expected more from an $11 burger and fries. So after a couple trips to OHSO, I'll now be referring to it as NOTSO, as in "Did you like it?" NOTSO much.

_0ExJTT2xkFbZVVy4CneLg.text: The main reason why I'm giving this place 2 stars is because their burger gave me food poisoning. I had their regular burger and cheese because my boyfriend and I came really late and they only make a few things off their menu after 10. It obviously wasn't cooked or prepared properly, whatever the reason may be, but I got sick the next morning and was sick for the next 3 days. Other than that, our server was stuck up and condescending to us at first, after he realized we were under 21 and not here to drink, but he must have thought that I noticed because after two comments that my boyfriend and I noticed were a little rude, he gave us great service and I ended up thanking him for good service before we left. Still it was that first encounter. Neither one of us are 21, so we don't go out to new places for drinks just yet, but it doesn't matter. He was very condescending to us once we said we were under 21, which meant to him we must have been a couple of kids. And even if we WERE just kids, which we AREN'T, we didn't need to be talked down to just because we aren't 21, but love breweries and brewery food.

pazUDNgPtnQTl9L_4xQ1bQ.text: A friend and I decided to walk down here Sunday afternoon with her dogs to have a drink on their patio and I couldn't be happier with that decision.  We really lucked out on the all you can eat BBQ (which included Ribs, pulled pork and Chicken)  While it was all enjoyable - the chicken was by far my favorite part of the meal.  As always, beer list is incredible and at $9 / pitcher, leaves you without much to complain about.  I recommend this place and will be back on a Sunday sometime soon.

UsuNdmQ-vc0aBiF8QFfFDA.text: I've been to OHSO a few times as I love the atmosphere and food plus a great place to bring your cute dog! But, I can't get over how warm the beer is. Seriously what a great and fun selection of beer to try, but what an awful temperature. I sure hope in the future they are able to add a better cooling system to the taps as I think the beer would taste even better. This food is worth trying, especially for brunch but don't get hung up on the warm beer.

IO7_QY_gHJX2TSxl5V7Jiw.text: Love the feel of this place. I highly recommend hitting it up after a good Saturday night for their Sunday brunch. Nothing like a bit of the hair of the dog to get you back on track. The food is good and fresh and the beer is always cold and refreshing. Bring the dog for a fun time. Mine loves the spent grain from the brewing process biscuits.

oIbWt-1hDR01vWIFxXA1RQ.text: Solid but after hour menu sucks! Starts at 10 pm so get in before that if you want some food other than pretzels or burgers, also the place has a weird echo or something. It's really difficult to hear your server especially with the music.

fLHQlmzLdlvci7wCJ50IFQ.text: OHSO Arcadia is location right off Indian School and 49th Street- their is patio seating in the front and back of the restaurant that also back the canal.  Food;  The hummus plater you cant go wrong with - hummus is delicious and pita is already fresh.  The brew is the best in town - plenty of different flavors to pick from.  The Vodka is actually very tasty as well.   Service; The servers are always on hand to never let you go without.

FkZwe172u72rAEj3K_RhUQ.text: Nice staff and outdoor eating. Everything from avocado toast to fruity pebble French toast. Weekend brunch has mimosa and beer for $0.01 if you order from the brunch menu. Dog friendly and yard games. Showed up at 10am on a Saturday and was seated right away.

CACLITPKdqFNviFPSaq_6g.text: Haven't been to OHSO for over a year! Revisited because I was meeting a friend who lives near the Indian School location. It was hopping with activity due to it being Friday and Happy Hour. We opted for patio seating due to the great weather. It was a 20 minute wait but we had a beer in the interior while we waited. Service was friendly at both areas- the interior bar & the patio. We enjoyed a sampling of the $3 small plates which were all very good. My one pet peeve is the fact they have this awesome beer selection but, you get it served in unfrosted glasses. I love having my beer Cold and when I get it in a warm/hot fresh out of the dishwasher glass- it just leaves me disappointed . That being said it was a pleasant evening and reasonably priced as well!

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States

nA6P9Od5G9ZRMWWESEwW9Q.text: Wow! OHSO Arcadia's backyard/patio might be the coolest/best outdoor space I've ever been to at a restaurant! Definitely check this place out, and bring your pup!   An awesome list of brews, AND they make their own spirits, too! I'll be back to try the whiskey flight, and maybe some flavored vodka? So unique!   The food was great, too - my S/O and I ordered a burger to split, and the kitchen was so kind as to cut the burger in half for us and serve it on two plates - both with fries!   Our server was a little brusque, but nothing to keep us from coming back. See you soon, OHSO!

u_qw6eq3b-o-eU7pjLkhlQ.text: We came on a Friday night in summer (8/17) for a coworkers going away party. We sat at an outside table and there was not very many people out there, as it was 9pm. There were maybe 15 of us in our party one point.   Our waiter was sooooo slow. He would take a few drink orders at a time and at one point it took 21 minutes to get a drink. We timed it.   One person  ordered a beer and about 10 minutes later when he asked the location of his drink, he was told they didn't have that beer anymore. The waiter had not e en come back to the table to tell him that and ask if he'd like a different beer. Also, the waiter did not tell us the kitchen was closing, so when he finally got around to taking out food orders, he informed us that the kitchen was closed and there was only a small late night menu we could order from. At that point many of us had been there for over an hour.   I used to live up by the  PV location and never had this type of lackadaisical service. Arcadia, you need to step up your game because you left a bad taste in the mouths of 15 people.

25_OWrq8kIjO0nV_QoSViw.text: Never been.  Was in the neighborhood and I was in need of nourishment.  So glad I made the stop.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States

i6HS6tQ1luOGZvxu7plysQ.text: Eat here! I recommend you go on the weekends and get the chicken and waffles there, which ARE BETTER THAN LO-LO'S. If you don't believe me try them yourself. They also come with a mimosa.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The best chicken and waffles in Phoenix. Period.

VTeW6jDY9rRDZDfuXKmsjg.text: First stop once getting off the plane & couldn't have been more satisfied with our choice. They had an extensive beer list, happy hour from open to, and a super chill vibe. A outdoor seating area in the front & a patio that's dog friendly in the back. Loved it! Got the brisket mac & chicken n waffles...definitely filling and so delicious! Tried their signature mojito & dreamcycle- very refreshing. Would definitely return back in the future if back in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. chicken &amp; waffles, wontons, and brisket mac with a signature mojito and dreamcycle.

wfZey8WpV8wHTQGvqXlVuA.text: Went here for brunch for the first time yesterday and I loved it! The inside is very cool and they have a really nice patio (it was way too hot to sit out there yesterday, but they had the doors open and misters on which was nice).   If you're into beer, they have a huge beer list with mostly local beers, and the majority of those are OHSO beers. My boyfriend had the Three Ravens, Boom! Dynamite and Peanut Butter Jelly Time and he really like them all. The peanut butter one legitimately tasted like PB&J, so cool!   I stuck with mimosas yesterday, and they're really good too. They also give you the good ones in wine glasses, and they were only $8 each so a much better deal than most places :) I had the chicken and waffles, which comes with a spicy syrup. That was kind of weird for me, but not bad! Definitely not too spicy either if that's not your thing. He got the classic breakfast which looked really good as well.   I can't remember what the server's name was, but he was great too. Super helpful when it came to questions about what to order and he was very friendly and always there when we needed anything. I'll definitely be coming back here for brunch and to try dinner, too!

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken &amp; Waffles
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Really good mimosas, which come in the big glasses so you get a good deal ;)
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States

hwjpcee4qZi737bZ2UClAg.text: The steak fries with cheese was absolutely delectable... the beer was phenomenal... bloody Mary with horseradish vodka and homemade beef jerky was so good... and the frothy lady is accurately named, i mean, change my panties why don't ya?!?   Skip the braised pork though.  The taste and size is not worth the price. $25 for a tiny plate, meh meat, undercooked veggies, and potatoes that didn't have flavor but served as a paste to hold everything together.
