RYGjRb1krICIB0jDqAlNKQ.text: As I write I am sitting in OSHO having been here 90 minutes so far. Still haven't eaten. Our 25 minute wait time turned to 50 minutes because "no one is leaving". When we got our table, apparently no one was serving either. Btw, the menu here is so basic that I picture Chef Boy Ardee in the kitchen standing next to Ward Clever. The beer? Well, it is quite artsy. But no better than a thousand other places where they chill their glasses before pouring beer into them. Bottom line, don't waste your Friday night here. Obviously, this place is too much for the staff to handle.

PuNGJkIfsZHkTcCZtNhxag.text: Oh So mediocre  Beer was just average. I actually like their other craft taps (not the house ones) much more than their own. Had the dubbel and quad, and both were quite lackluster. Definitely not the place for a True Belgian fan.   Food was solid. Certainly better than the beer. But I could have gotten a decent chicken wrap just about anywhere.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States

qfJ1l6l15nPF9WuD-PSUTw.text: One of my favorite places to grab a drink or get brunch in Phoenix! Great location and great atmosphere. A lot of times I'll take my dogs on a walk on the canal to OHSO! My dogs also love OHSO. They also have the best brunch deal in town! 10 to 15 dollar entrees included with a MONSTER MIMOSA! Let me say you feel pretty good after that mimosa! Go there and you will love it

FgCWdn1-vhtik4OfWpkUkA.text: I've gone to OHSO fairly often for their drinks, but once I tried their AZ burger, I knew I had to review it. The combination of aioli and jalapeno cream cheese was different yet perfect; the flavors complemented each other well and took the burger to another level. I've heard good things about their other burgers as well, but the AZ burger is a must-try experience. Just be prepared for the food coma that follows.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States

0hrRFHLU_UBBhaiNGksEOA.text: Came here with a friend for happy hour. great drinks, great prices, happy hour till 6 pm on a Friday, loved the atmosphere. Going back for sure.  Oh and free valet :)

-Xt5wr8NMRm75KkrjYFYww.text: Just a great place for beer, spirits and food! The atmosphere is chill and inviting. Management is top notch! The manager, Luis, was there when we came in and he was just wonderful! Great service!

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_LOXAblAG9boP5Bu5-HeqA.text: Great micro brew to grab a bite to eat on patio.  Ordered Green Chili Pork and Blackened Salmon.  Washed it down with Rose wine and Boom Dynamite Beer.  Everything was delicious and will definitely be back to try everything on the menu and all there beers!

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ordered Green Chili Pork and Blackened Salmon. Rose and Boom Dynamite Beer were delicious!
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Out door bar in back is popular to grab drinks while waiting for your table.  Ended up eating at bar.

Dvmbpsb2jBHUQSXHSlNWMQ.text: Looking for a dog friendly patio with good food, good beer, and awesome brunch?  OHSO Brewery in Arcadia should be your go-to spot then.  The patio here is really large, and they are by far the most dog friendly place in town.  They'll bring water bowls for your pups, and even allow them to sit up in the booth with you if you so choose.  I love bringing my two babies here, and they love being able to hang with mama, meet other pups, and get lavished with attention.  And the food and drink options here are definitely spot on!  So many things to choose from, and great specials for happy hour and brunch.  I particularly love the brunch special - you get a beer or mimosa with your brunch meal for $10.  Seriously, how can you beat that!?!  If you like chicken and waffles, I highly recommend giving them a whirl here - they taste even better with a heft mimosa ;)  Definitely bring the dog-family to OHSO to enjoy some great grub!
