IHIPjCJLSp7T6DPHeQFj0Q.text: Food excellent.  I had the PBJ burger, cheese curds and a dark beer.   Atmosphere/decor was great...valet parking a nice touch.... clean bathrooms despite the restaurant being full.   Major complaint: Noise level. It was  extreme. Had to shout at both the wait staff and my companion to be heard...

1qwIY3I9jcs7zCjjEWJEfA.text: This place is so unique!! From the beers to the people to the atmosphere to even the bathrooms, it's like no other place I've tried.   When I first walked in I thought it was a small location until I walked around and saw the back patio! It's huge! To my knowledge both the back and front patios are dog friendly. It was also cool to watch them brew beer right in the middle of the restaurant!   The service was great and informative. We asked what our waiter's favorite brew was and he brought out a whole pint for us to try! How nice! My favorite beer was the O.H.S.O. Hoppy. (If you follow my reviews you can tell I'm an IPA person).   Be sure to grab your doggos a treat from the hostess stand before you leave!

3-seMe2l2Oc4OPM7x4p3LQ.text: This place was totally accommodating for my large group of 12. They were able to seat us outside on the patio, which was perfect. We could still feel the AC from the restaurant and kept cool under the umbrellas while still enjoying the Arizona sunshine. The menu had something for everyone. They even have infused vodkas on their drink menu. A bunch of us had cocktails with their vodkas and it was a super tasty! Check this place out if you are in the neighborhood.

iXIbr6UhhLLxYocvI1-miQ.text: Really cool spot with lots of seating and some cool patios.  Parking can be a bit limited during busy hours.  Decent house beers and some pretty good food overall.  Like most of this area though, the food here is a bit pricey

NTQIlrHkpd07s8avQXMoqQ.text: Went for brunch today and it took about 15minutes for a server to come to our table after we were seated to ask us if we wanted to order anything... very poor service to start, but it got a little better along the way I guess.  I then ordered the chicken and waffles and received half frozen waffles and super dry chicken (no seriously, the middle of the waffles were ice). I told the server and she took it back and got me another order. The next order was still disgusting (at least the waffles were like warm this time). It was probably one of the most horrible meals I've ever received at any brewery I've been to. How do you mess up chicken and waffles?  To top it off I paid $20 bucks for the meal. She could've at least comped one of my beers...  My gf ordered a burger and it was delicious... maybe I just ordered the wrong item, which is why I'm giving this place 2 stars instead of 1.

U5yKOiR1uwbX--k-V1_ZrA.text: My salad was delicious until I bit hard on this unexpected screw. I will let the Marriott know they should no longer recommend this restaurant to out of town visitors. Never had anything like this happen to me before.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States

hk9wiz5PvRSO9jR8v0fgxw.text: Dogs, cold beer, good food, sunshine and more dogs. What's not to love about OHSO? Well the parking situation that's for sure.   The patio is awesome, great view of Camelback and a ton of dogs all around you. This place is the definition of dog friendly.   The food is good, the drinks are good and the prices aren't bad. You're really coming here for the location and dogs if you ask me and dogs are always five stars!

qZmWnmpBRO9CzupENvKw-Q.text: Came here for brunch and thoroughly enjoyed myself. We sat on the back patio where there are booths and tables, fans, heat lamps, umbrellas, you name it. A mimosa/pitcher of beer come included with a brunch item which was nice. I got a Bloody Mary and it was VERY good. It comes with a piece of beef jerky in it which is interesting. I ordered the avocado toast and ate every last bite. It was SO good. After eating and drinking I felt full but not heavy and bad about myself. They are pet friendly and there were so many dogs on the patio. Dog owners will love this place. At the end we itemized the check and our server was so nice and brought them back with individual clipboards with everything correct. I wish I could remember his name, but he was very efficient and I enjoyed my time here. I will 100% be back!!!

HYZrrrlfmvShUXhxAC5ZiA.text: First stop on our self-made brewery tour on Sunday. This place was BUSY! They had brunch going on with some specials available. Everything looked and sounded good but we had just eaten so we weren't looking for more food. Got a flight of OHSO beers. Not the best but definitely not the worst beers I've had. I liked the Popcycle, Boom! Dynamite the most. We had Bug Blue Van from College street which was also delicious! Definitely recommend making a trip here if you haven't been. We sat out on the front porch which had misters and decent shade available. I would have liked to sit outside in the back but it was full. It looked like they can accommodate large parties pretty well. Parking looked ridiculous. They do offer valet. We Ubered which I was happy about once we got to sit and watch people try to come and go. Dog friendly!

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_XPIlSlOUT1E2oAThHSJkQ.text: Brought my dog here, he's still a little antsy around other dogs but the staff here was so kind to him. He got a little treat and water bowl. If you love dogs you'll get plenty of adorable ones to pet here.  Had the Mac and cheese with chicken which wasn't amazing but good enough. Want to come back on a day when it's not so crowded, and my dog is a little more used to other dogs.

5b__O6pfXLVApjSIcBYyTA.text: Always a great time and usually it's always a 5 star but sadly the bbq sandwich I had was not up to standard and par! Service was great and the experience was as expected but sadly the bbq was too mushy, the bun was soggy by the time I got it and just wasn't enjoyable- maybe next time!

F9TPMdYRMwaCIQfHeeXXUQ.text: The patio is what really makes this place. Surrounded by bikes and shade with direct access to the bike path. Beer, burger and fries are delicious. I suggest going during their happy hour otherwise it's relatively pricey.

0lj6E-WWAviIavV34hRNFA.text: Awesome food, good beers and great service. Patio was very warm even though it was a cooler evening. Server was very good at recommending beers for flights.   Would love to come back!

i7ePSY-hCCr3CGyPIdlklg.text: I was in Phoenix visiting my brother and he suggested this place. I'm stoked he did!  We brought our dog with us to sit in the outdoor area and they had a really cool knee-height tap setup to pour water for your dog into a bowl. They also had free dog biscuit made from left over grain from the brewing process to give to your dog.  We were seated immediately outside on a Saturday around 4pm which was nice.  I had the O.H.S.O. Bright, which was every bit as light, crisp, and floral as described. It's a peefect beer for hot weather. I also ordered a flight of four, but was disappointed that they were out of the blackberry IPA. I loved the mango and pineapple IPA they had. I must have it again. It may even supplant Ballast Point Pineapple Sculpin as one of my favorite beers.  I had the Angry Bird sandwich, which was very tasty. The chicken was nice and the pickled apples were a good complement. The fries were some of the saltier ones I've had but still good.  Overall, this ranks among the top restaurant/breweries I've been to. I can't wait to come back when I visit Phoenix again.

GcCFvcxAyofJSi1OjzoNpA.text: My sister and I were stopping through after a grueling leg of a road trip. We found parking pretty easily during happy hour. We ordered a pitcher of beer, delicious buffalo chicken fries and the pretzel with cheese. The waitress was attentive and even put a personal touch making an effort to joke with us when things were slow. The food was absolutely amazing, it was great to have some local brews. I wish I could have gotten her name because she was amazing. Overall experience was perfect.

mUKOMeMvX1CZtHwA8yBbdg.text: Recently went here for Saturday brunch and enjoyed the food and atmosphere. Although the brunch menu is limited to around 8-10 menu items, lunch is available as well. If you enjoy beer or a mimosa with your brunch make sure you order as beer brunch, which comes with one of those drinks as part of your order. The mimosa glass size is decent wine glass size, not your small Champaign flute like most places. I had the chicken and waffles and really liked it. Came with slices of bacon too! My husband had the biscuits and gravy which he liked as well, but forewarn the sauce has a bit of a kick. This place also gets major kudos for the dog friendly patio and dog treats. Downside is parking but they do offer complementary valet.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beeeeeerrrrrrr
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Local beer menu
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States

rz6wiy4Rn9OCVoywMOOYFg.text: Great vibe excellent beer and atmosphere! Our waitress Kitty made it so much better! We'll definitely be back!

qASi7s4-YjS0GaRrpjJ6IA.text: I love this place! Not only are they dog friendly, but they have an amazing beer selection and the best Mac n cheese ever!!

8bVibJTFBBwQKEEhE_vRxA.text: If you had asked me a month ago, I would have given this place 5 stars.  Sadly, after my second visit, I feel the need to write this review.  The food and beer selection at O.H.S.O. is pretty great, which is why I didn't give them 1 star.  In fact, my first time here was pretty good.  I thought this would be a go-to when I come to town, but then I had dinner there this past week, and well, I'm never going back.  Now, I admit, I'm a picky eater and I like to modify my dinner.  I live in LA, where almost every single person I know modifies in some form or fashion, and it's rare for that to be an issue.  You would think a restaurant in a city as big as Phoenix would see a lot of that, too.  However...  When it came time for me to order my meal, I started to explain that I would prefer my pizza with no cheese, and a few other items off of it.  The last time I had been there, this was not a problem at all, and that server was happy to help me.  THIS time, I unfortunately was served by Brooke, who not only didn't help me, but she served up a healthy portion of her less-than-helpful attitude.  Upon ordering, she told me "You could do that - but it's not gonna taste very good" (in a pretty b****-y tone, mind you).  That's funny - I don't remember asking her opinion of what I wanted to eat!  I've actually worked in the service industry before, and there is a way to let a customer know that a certain dish might not be as palatable that doesn't include a rude and condescending tone.  Little did she know that I had eaten the same exact dish a month prior and enjoyed it thoroughly.  In a town that has a lot of restaurants, I hope this is a lesson to treat customers like you prefer they come back again, and appreciate their business while they are there.

rFq45LCie9TThqFwcD6pOQ.text: O.M.G this place is good!! My husband and I stopped by for his birthday and the place was packed! (Granted, it was a Friday night and we did drop in at the tail end of happy hour.) Parking was a problem so use valet.  We were told it would be a 45 minute wait so we wandered into the bar area to find a seat.  We finagled two stools outside and enjoyed the spinach, crab, and artichoke dip.  Yummy!!!!  Our waiter recommended the orange vanilla beer and my husband had a Heffeweisen (spelling?).  Both were good.  Mine was very mellow and smooth. Good for people who don't really like beer.  Like me.  We ordered the smaller sizes and got two regular size pub glasses. (I think they were 18-24 ounces - not sure what the larger size would have looked like!)  By the time we finished our app the hostess popped over to tell us our table was ready.  (What 45 minute wait?  Secretly I think she only said that to discourage the group of 6 punk college kids that walked in ahead of us.)   As for the service, I don't know what everyone else is talking about but our waiter was great!  As soon as we sat down he asked if we wanted waters - which I did - and brought them immediately.  They use a thin cucumber instead of lemons which I thought was awesome...but I'd already drank half a beer with little to eat so everything is awesome at that point. :)   My husband ordered the barbecue burger which his boss had recommended.  I got the veggie burger after asking what the OHSO sauce was. It is Bloody Mary mayo.  Yes, you read that right.  Bloody. Mary. Mayo. I had to order it. I got fries on the side because I cannot resist potatoes in any form.    The food came out after a decent interval and my husband and I didn't speak for 10 minutes because we were busy stuffing our pie holes. (Bloody Mary mayo tastes like manna from heaven by the way.)  Between the beer and the appetizer I couldn't finish my food but I wasn't going to let all that flavor go to waste so I got to go box.  (30 seconds in the micro and it is just as tasty for a snack.)  The bill came to about $47 before tip which is to be expected after drinks and an appetizer.  Not too bad considering the damage we've done at other celebration dinners. ;)   I didn't give 5 stars because the parking could be better.  But we will DEFINITELY be back!  (There are like 20+ beers to try after all.)  P.S. we were told that the patio is dog friendly and they have a weekly contest. If you take a picture of your dog with one of their glasses or a growler you are entered to win a $25 gift card.  A winner is drawn every week.

NwJjiSvMf-AJlZxAiqQcJQ.text: I am sorry to say that OHSO was only so-so.  We came here because it had great reviews and we wanted to check it out.  I am definitely impressed with the selection of beers, especially because I am a big craft brew person.  They also sell and refill growlers which is nice.  The staff was very friendly and I like that they have a dog-friendly patio (always a plus).  The food was a disappointment though.  I had the brisket sandwich with tomato soup and my girlfriend had the prosciutto flat-bread pizza.  Now, I have had some good brisket in my day so I was excited for a good sandwich.  I was surprised to see that it was pulled/shredded and drowned in sauce.  The sauce wasn't bad but I could not taste the meat itself.  Not sure if they were trying to cover something up or what but less is more when it comes to sauce.  It wasn't bad, just not what I was expecting.  The tomato soup was okay, but tasted a little thin like something was missing.    The pizza had good points and bad points.  The flavor profile was pretty decent, but I am not sure I would call the meat on the pizza prosciutto.  If it was, it is not anything like I have tasted before (my girlfriend and I are big fans of good prosciutto).  This was but very thick and tasted like a better version of Canadian bacon.  Overall, not bad but not amazing either.  Our waiter was great and made some good suggestions for beer based on what I was looking for.  So now for the big question...will we be back?  Yes, but only to grab drinks before heading elsewhere or if we have our dogs and want to chill for a couple brews.  Other than that, I don't know if I will order anything to eat unless I know that they have improved the menu.

ojjA1YMQdR8Q6fq19VhqJg.text: GREAT BREW SELECTION!!!!!morning brew, bourbon pecan imperial porter

At3jU_8IvUKf00hbWMk7aw.text: Came here for Sunday brunch with the boyfriend.  A little hungover from the night before... go figure.  If you can ride your bike or walk here, do that.  Parking was a nightmare.  No, I don't want to valet my car but thanks anyway.  $10 for a beer & a meal?  That is something I'm willing to invest in.  Given the parking situation, we figured the place would have major wait times... not the case.  We were seated immediately.  The inside looks like a hipster warehouse.  Is that a thing?  It is now.  Atmosphere is laid back.  Really nice beer selection.  There is something for everyone... and brunch was fantastic.  I had the churrasco steak & egg.  I don't know if it was my hungover state of mind but the proportion was perfect & the flavor was spot on.  After brunch, we walked out to the patio.  What a cute little spot.  I love how dog friendly everything is... they have a little dog washing station.  AW.  Adorable.  Can't wait to go back.  :)

z7IRfeDP86qFC6aLdZe_Hg.text: This is the greatest place. Huge beer selection. Great patio and it allows dogs and even has baggies with home made doggie biscuits to take as you leave.   Good food, casual place, central location.   I highly recommend.

W6QRlbtCQkk9HpfOduExEw.text: My favorite place to drink in Arcadia...or maybe in Arizona. Great beer list (rotating), great atmosphere (as long as you're on the back patio or near the front. Middle of the restaurant? Not so much.   I didn't like the old food/menu, but it seems they upgraded and I hear good reviews about the food now. A great place to ride your bike as well and extremely dog friendly.

Xphthud0HEBJUCe1uWm3DQ.text: OHSO has a great beer selection with not only there own brews but other brews throughout Arizona they also have a full bar if craft beer isn't your thing. I didn't get to try any of there food but it all sounded pretty good and looked good from what i could see. I will be coming back next time I am in the area.

WwezaGBf0lSsYVg-4D9kdw.text: Patio and beer are awesome! Atmosphere is amazing. Food is not bad but nothing to write home about. Was extremely disappointed in the service. From the manager to the server we had it was just a really unpleasant experience. Probably won't come back.

K54BIO8MEm3xy2mVh2vWFg.text: Trendy mini brewery/restaurant.  Great selection of brews and wine for you to choose...$6 pitchers during happy hours.  They also have a wide selection of food menu, from main course to burgers to tacos and vegetarian options.  A great place to go with friends to enjoy a game.  They also have a pet friendly patio.  I would recommend making a reservation during typical busy hours and large groups.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mahi mahi + chips

tbD899Xbtn6_J3V44kDDRA.text: Yum yum yum!! One of our fav places to hang out and eat. A must try if you haven't been here! Great weekend brunch too!

kGsxlR1MFJftf-u8BTpCrw.text: I got here before all of my friends and went to the bar to wait for them. The bartender was awesome and let me try a couple of beers before I finally picked one. This was really nice of him because 1- i'm not a fan of beer 2- i'm extremely picky. this is a difficult combination but he was really cool and probably would have let me try the whole selection if i asked.   When my friends finally got here, we went to sit down and we ordered food. Everyone was really happy with their food. I tried the pizza and sweet potato fries and they were really good. Definitely a fun place to hang out.  Minus one star for horrible parking. they have valet which is nice but i really would just like to park my own car.

yQhb2DEtjiFRxBvwPdkXhA.text: Great brewery with great food! The handlebar hefe is delicious! I also like that you can bring your dog and play board games here- very fun and casual place to hang out with friends while drinking good beer and eating delicious food. What's better than that?!

qDErrFdMlq7hyfDfpSqHqw.text: Rude servers, slow service, dirty bathrooms. OHSO is a fun place but I'd bring your business to the Paradise Valley location. 100% better in every way!

qW-Gn6gs0gCMtIOH-ip6cQ.text: Great beer and atmosphere! Love that you can bring dogs and they have the home made biscuits for them.  Food is great and they have good veggie options,  fries are delish! I hope they jump on the bandwagon and open one in downtown Gilbert!   We could use something out here like it, plus I'd love to go more!

FwsmDe7BHJtEcoQLLtcFlA.text: So, as I have a Facebook page titled TheBikingBrewer, I figured the bicycle-themed brewery OHSO would be a slam dunk... but, actually, it was more like an air ball. First and foremost, the quality of their beers are well below average (I'm Certified with BJCP). The place itself was super crowded - too crowded - with minimal parking and then a 40 minute wait on a Tuesday. We went to the back bar which was again crowded, with people and more dogs than I've ever seen in a public place other than at a dog park. Our drinks took forever to come and after one tasting flight of the entire list of amateurish beers my girlfriend and I left. No need to ever return.

gn-LzuH4EKv8DpkDmUGSHw.text: I stand corrected on the view of Camelback. Their back patio does a grand job showcasing that grand ungulate.

kHXaa2M_dgihBKwLBnmOMw.text: Always liked this place, but Sunday brunch has gotten ridiculous.  This morning I was told there was a 30-40 minute wait, after standing at the hostess table for several minutes while the hostess scribbled on a dry erase pad.  There were lots of empty tables, but we still couldn't be seated.  Won't be going back for brunch. Also parking sucks.

iMuvr6v7J6aDa8CwQWRmvw.text: Came to OHSO for lunch with the family.  Beautiful patio but there were flies everywhere!  I've since gone back at night for a drink and there weren't any flies so maybe it's not an issue anymore.    Anyway we were sat at a table and left with menus...dirty menus.  Major pet peeve of mine!  Service left a lot to be desired for but the food was pretty good.  I got the Salmon BLT and it was definitely the best dish at the table.  Beer selection was great too.  Overall, I'd go back again for the patio and beers!

gtc-37HrrtiXQlIzugvhZA.text: LOVE THIS PLACE. Went to OHSO on date lunch with my husband, it was fantastic. Beer choice was just awesome and even managed to find a new favorite cider . I had the steak tacos and my husband had the shrimp. Both plates were just great superb flavor and plenty, the presentation was really good and just made you ant to go back again. Can't wait for a return visit

kmX-HGo6vjhhzr7YI2xb5A.text: Love this place!  It totally reminds me of my favorite bars back in Austin, TX.  It's very indie and eclectic -  definitely has its own vibe!  Very nice patios in each the front and back and well as delicious food!  I definitely recommend checking it out!

dM_YEEXkLa0vDCKdrPC6yg.text: I was in town for spring training and I decided to check out a local spot that was kid friendly.  Man, am I glad I stopped by here.  The food was excellent, pitchers of beer were  a steal at $6.  It was too cheap not to get seconds....haa.. As much as I loved this place though, I loved the family and dog friendly atmosphere more than anything else..   Great place.  I would love to see something similar to this our in Los Angeles... Cheers!!

oicYoUTGfhd2a4ppHO_vhw.text: Wow what a place!  Love the dog friendly atmosphere and free yummy biscuits - at least that's what my dog says.  Happy hour pricing and options are awesome.  Great selection of beer on tap!  The burgers are great.  I had the basic Burger and Cheese and LOVED it.  The OHSO Grilled cheese was a favorite with my kids.  Twice in one vacation says a lot!  Strawberry Rhubarb pie was FANTASTIC.  One of my new favorite places.

Ir1LwpPsjkz2kIv4cr-vAA.text: Came here severely drunk after the Waste Management Open...from what I remember it was very tasty burger.  I liked the patio.

9SwxiO0bGmcQ4aNFZvMXgg.text: I'm long overdue for a review for this place - my favorite bar in Arizona. As a craft beer fan (I try not to say "snob"...), I'm overwhelmed with a place with this good a selection of beers that I've never tried before or are worth trying again. In addition to the ones they brew themselves (which are quite good), they also have a terrific selection of locals and from elsewhere, on draft. I get sample sizes when  I have the time, a pint when I don't. Happy hour is $6 for a pitcher (roughly 2.5 pints) for local Arizona brews. I've been here for happy hours, dinners, and late drinks with friends and have had a quality experience every time. To their credit, for a craft beer place they have a decent selection of mixed drinks and some wines. For food, I've been pleased with chicken sandwiches (very tender), the Sunday all-you-can-eat bbq, and appetizers. The food is decent enough given that the focus is on the beer (in my opinion). Servers have been quite knowledgeable about the beers. Atmosphere is kick-back casual, with a bright interior with various types of places to sit - booths, bar, tables, patio. Patio is dog-friendly. Parking can be tight but I've parked across the (rather busy) street (i.e., across Indian School), and it's not that big a deal.  So far the only matches for beer selection are World of Beer (Tempe and Gilbert); Angel's Trumpet (which has no happy hour and the food is so-so at best); and 1702 (Tucson).

Ei5aYbaaweJKkB7G4C2DRw.text: I recently tried OHSO. Nice layout and design... modern and casual. Their menu features cheese and charcuterie plates, flatbreads, burgers, and other comfort-style dishes. I had the grilled cheese with a cup of tomato soup. The tomato soup reminded me of pepperoni pizza, which was strange at first but actually pretty good. It was the perfect order for a chilly, rainy day. The 48th Street Fizz (orange vodka, pineapple, lemon, st. germaine, and beer) was sweet, but tasty (love cocktails with carbonation). They have an extensive list of local and regional beers. Overall, it's a nice little neighborhood spot.

7vnyzlQf55H9mxAaZAuh5w.text: Mmmm, OHSO. I don't drink beer, but they have delicious cocktails and food. Plus, it's dog friendly, so I get to hang out with dogs. I don't have my own, so I live vicariously through the people on the dog patio. Thanks for sharing your dogs with us dogless folks! The food and drinks are prepared well and are good quality. There is ample space-indoor and out. Doesn't get much better than that! It can be pretty loud inside, so don't go there if you're looking to have a ton of great converstaion.

QYjsYh5TR89Xcgn_0MAMjA.text: After I left my first review owner sent me a message thanking us for our patronage. How sweet. ;)

stB6EAQP-NfTH1aj4K-doA.text: Amazing food, great breakfast specials, delicious cocktails, adorable venue and the most fantastic service from Allissa.  Dog friendly patio, comfortable seating very trendy.  I love this place!

JPJSHJkp8HQ0QloTa48TaQ.text: We had a great first time visit last night.  Great happy hour specials on Arizona beers, with solid, interesting selection (Don't listen to that beer snob who said there are no worthy Arizona-brewed beers!).  Green chile dip with yucca chips was delicious and all four of us liked what we ordered.  We sat just between bar and front patio---so ambiance couldn't have been better ( I agree with reviewer who called the inside seating area "cavernous"--- it doesn't look inviting).  But what really made the evening was the service---witty and attentive!!! We will be back!!! Sarah S. Tempe

AmzwNyUOJscUoChZC6JuCg.text: The only reason I give my review five stars is because of the service. Wow!! Zack recommended the spicy pulled pork and we loved it! He was knowledgable about the menu and beer selection. The atmosphere was lively and fun. We will definitely be coming back!

_urY-UQ4UzLzbAO38hgnag.text: If you like really, really good beers and a great patio, there is none better..... (Make sure you hit the BACK patio, not the one out front.....).   We did Camelback Mtn in the morning and got here about 1:00...just in time for their $6.00 happy hour mini pitchers....   Both made for a great day....

RhxAuoj9zhge1voZySLyJA.text: Great beer selection for all people!  Love all the microbrews on tap.  Good food too!

2POQ7_y43VgeDg6vrG6Wrg.text: the reason I am giving this 4 stars is because the staff and the weekend brunch menu rocks!  Staff is super nice and extremely helpful, great beer.  The food is not very good, I have tried several items on the menu and nothing very tastey.  The weekend brunch menu on the other hand is amazing!! Go on the weekend and sit outside and you will keep going back like I do.

rkn9lYSo0QwSZV5XH201uw.text: Really liked this place and will be back again soon for sure. Complimentary valet, solid service from the hipster leaning staff and the food and beer was great. Try the Barrio IPA. One of the best IPAs I've had yet. Good sandwiches (pulled pork with the honey jalapeno slaw was unreal) and enjoyed the charcuterie board.

rkiIkTM58xE6Du9E2tx4-w.text: I've been to Ohso numerous times and always generally enjoy it but it's not usually my first choice because their vegetarian options are very limited. I love beer, bikes, dogs, and good patios though so in most regards it's my style. Last night, I had a very poor experience here. I always order either kale and pear salad or the veggie burger (because as mentioned there are really no other veg options), last night I had the kale and pear. It was 98% wilted arugula and maybe 2 pieces of kale. The service was also quite poor. They're always busy so the service is never great. I will think twice before going back there for a while. Also, order sweet potato fries, the regular ones have a particular quality similar to cardboard.

3lr_HDyzN2uBj9ocSfoGLA.text: Cool vibe and dog friendly. Service was super slow and douchey at the bar. The server though, once we finally sat (at a table that was empty the entire time we were standing at the bar) got us a free round because he was from Ohio too. Go Bucks!

nk7jaw8sXAJRgGds_9D8sQ.text: I stopped in the other day while I was running around and decided to try this relatively new brewery/eatery in my neighborhood I keep driving by...I had a nice hoppy IPA and got the garden burger with it - both extremely enjoyable (I don't know how they got the garden burger patty to resemble an authentic backyard BBQ beef patty!). It was about 2 PM on a Thursday, so it was a totally casual atmosphere, hardly anyone in the joint...bartender friendly, service good...a pretty chill hang, all in all. I think that's what I liked most - the chill factor.

RoKK6zDOjx8iujPV8kp4wA.text: Very good. I'd probably throw it into the category of a gastropub. Because even though they brew their own beer, there is a great selection of other local brews and some great craft beers from around the country. Add this to some great pub grub and you have what most people would like in a gastropub.  I wasn't very impressed on my first visit back when it opened. But it's vastly improved over the months. Food quality and preparation has especially been better. The best deal is the weekend brunch. Breakfast items are very tasty and they throw in a 10oz beer to the $10 deal.  Open air dining is a plus.

q5PGFEjBVlJUBEhA8YKUEw.text: Parking sucks, but you'll get over it due to their delicious burgers and beer! I would come weekly but live too far away. I come for the Sweet Chili burger or the spiciest burger ever... AZ burger! Truly delicious.

3nRIwp83jG_Hg4RVwW4yow.text: I am in love with this place. Today was my first time and we need one in Tucson immediately!   The parking lot was packed and just as I was about to get irritated I noticed there is complimentary valet service. Que  fancy!   The inside is super casual and clean and the staff was awesome! We didn't get to sit outside in the crazy cool and dog friendly patio. I saw a dog sitting on the a table outside!   I ordered from the $10 brunch menu. Food plus 10oz beer or mimosa. I had the breakfast wrap, the wife had the breakfast flat bread. I recommend both. My girls had chicken tenders which were actual chicken with a tasty fried covering. They loved their food too.   If you have kids, a dog, and hankering for good food you owe it to yourself to come here.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast flat bread
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast wrap
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Here are some beers on tap, nice to see Tucson Brewery Dragoon in the house!

BSzcLVm55c87KXz4sOw6lw.text: No better place to kick back on a Sunday and relax. The brunch is good and the atmosphere is even better. This spot always draws a great crowd and the outdoor, dog- friendly, patio is so much fun. The staff are attentive and friendly.  They brew their own beers and make their own spirits #vodka.  Fun spot for a lazy Sunday afternoon.

LxMvb0dKk4uIO-SLb6m5-A.text: Great place to go for an afternoon, but the beer is super warm. Need to figure that out.

4ZPVZekuh93JEUIJs2k5zA.text: Today's visit to OHSO was excellent. The food was amazing and so flavorful. If you wanna go carb free try the Surf+Turf shrimp and carne Adams covered in pico over asparagus the carne was well Cooked juicy and was not fatty at all.  The back yard BBQ is delicious and comes with all the goodies on the side.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I love the outdoor patio with the heaters.

DtoZHGuOhChqbunrz3vEWQ.text: We've been here several times before for both late night drinks and for dinner with our dog.  We've always had an "okay" experience overall with decent food and service, fun atmosphere.  This time was so bad that we walked out before being seated.    The valet was rude and the hosts were even worse.  We walked in through the front (something we've done with the dog before) and while a friendly male host greeted us a short blonde girl ran over and told us to take the dog to the back patio because she wasn't allowed there.  We hurried out.    The host at the back patio didn't say a word to us so it took me a minute to figure out that he was the host.  He took my name and told us it'd be a 35-40 minute wait, but that we could also check in for the front patio to see if anything opened up there sooner.  I told him we had just been turned away from there, to which he responded, "THE FRONT PATIO!" as though I was either an idiot or hard of hearing.  So, back to the front I went while my father and his dog waited outside so as not to be scolded again for bringing her into the host stand.    The blonde girl was at the host stand, so I approached her and politely asked if we could put our name in for seating at the front patio as well.  With an appalling attitude she stated, "You're already on the list for the back? Well, we have NO seating here, either.  There's NOTHING up here."  I told her that I understood, but that the other host suggested our names be put on this list as well since it's such a long wait.  "Uh, okay, I guess I can put you're name in and you can just see which one opens up first!" (Not a bad thing to say, but the way she said it was awful!) Frustrated by her attitude, I responded, "Well yeah, that makes sense, right? That's what the other host told us to do, too."  She watched with a look of disgust as I took one of the complimentary dog treats for our dog to snack on while we waited (something we're usually encouraged to do!).    Having been in the customer service industry for about 15 years, poor service is a hot button for me.  No matter how busy, employees (especially those who are the first faces the customers encounter) need to maintain their composure and be friendly and empathetic.  We decided to leave and go to one of the many other locations nearby where the employees take pride in their work and know how to treat others with kindness.

Od7fmJ99sEZX0ZZK4cg9HA.text: OHSO is one of my favorite places in Phoenix and it has become a well known establishment among breweries and bars in the city.  I have been here more times than I can count but each visit was memorable.  There are 2 locations now but I still prefer the original one in Arcadia.  The atmosphere is wonderful!  OHSO is super dog friendly so there are always a ton of pups hanging out on the back patio.  The back patio is amazing but it is always packed on the weekends so I usually end up on the front patio which is a little quieter.    OHSO is brewery so obviously the beer selection is out of this world!  The best part is that they have an ever changing selection of their own beers.  I'm a big beer fan and I love trying new beers.  If you can't decide what beer to have, you can try as many as you would like for $1 each.  It's like your own personal beer tasting which is great fun!    The food at OHSO is great but not fantastic.  Some of my favorites are the crab dip, hummus, flat breads and the veggie burger is one of my favorites.  Brunch is a great deal at OHSO.  For $10, you get a full brunch entree and a large beer or mimosa.  Such a great deal with delicious food and local beer!   If you are really into craft beer-  check out OHSO for their brew your own beer.  Every Saturday morning they hold a brewing tutorial and you can make your own beer that will be tapped at OHSO a few weeks later.  This is how OHSO keeps their revolving taps of interesting beers.  Check it out if you haven't been or just go more if you have and hopefully I'll see you there!

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Mfc-mRmZdJJrY4jahjpk9Q.text: My buddy said he wanted to meet up and it was so good I had to fire up Yelp to tell everyone about it    We came during the brunch time and had the $10 for the meal and a beer. This is a seriously good deal. The weather was surprising nice for September and we chilled on the patio. It has a cool setup with TVs in the center.   They have bike parking and even a little bike repair/service area. Very cool.   Food was killer. The atmosphere was great. Beer was cold.

3NtjdhJw0hYjtSdXStNZPA.text: First time visitor for brunch. I'm a fan. Sat outside near the front. Perfect day out. Got the Belgian waffles with agave syrup and two slices of bacon and mimosa for $10. Waffles were good. The compote was a delicious spread. Fruit tasted fresh. Bacon was very thin sliced. Very standard. Also tried the carnitas bowl, which was flavorful. Everyone else around me who had the burrito, or lox seemed to enjoy themselves, as well.   Staff guy was great. Got our names to easily split the bill at the end of the meal. Very courteous.   Not that much parking nearby because they offer "complementary " valet services. Some of my friends just parked at the CVS nearby and walked over.

G0UBDdjcTMNN7oG0i5JMTw.text: Still a great place for brunch. Also, the mimosas are huge. They basically fill a wine glass to the brim.

2tLL8dANmsrTnxolJSC2ew.text: O.H.S.O. has the coolest patio ever!!! The atmosphere (inside and outside the restaurant) was so unique and laid back. My friends and I stopped at O.H.S.O. last weekend for brunch cocktails while we were on a leisurely bike ride. The Bloody Mary was good and my husband really liked the 48th St Fizz. We all tried different drinks which were delicious! Our server was very nice and attentive. The accommodations for dogs was over the top so it wasn't a surprise that there was a dog or two at every other table! There was a dog bowl fill up area, dog snacks, and even a dog washing station outside. Next time I'm in town for a visit I will definitely return to O.H.S.O. for more drinks on the patio!!

t-Vq4AJE6ff1rWJ0YFJChw.text: Good place to hang out with friends. This is my second time here. I love the patio side in the open air. Beers are plenty, good crowd and TV's around. My favorite beer is the S'more Stout.  Those who  like dark beers should give it a go.  The appetizers were really good. We had the steaks and fries along with guac and chips. Good enough for group of 4.For main course I took the blackened salmon. Usually I try to stay away from seafood but this time the fish was pan fried and was fresh. Loved it. So in short OHSO never fails in both beer and food.

PfIsqgffOmTBX5vwruUbBA.text: OHSO is such an amazing place with amazing food. I have been here a couple of times and I am planning on going back again soon. The food selection, service, and their dedication to the community are outstanding. The first time I went I tried several of their beers/ciders and the waitress was so friendly, knowledgeable, and patient regarding our selection. They have an awesome selection of local beers--the only sad thing is it changes often, so if you really like a beer/cider you better get two or three because you might not see it again. It is great that they have $1 tasters, so you can try as many as your heart desires. For our entree my friend and I shared their Kalua Pork--it was so tender, juicy, and sweet--I would have licked the plate if I could. For dessert we had their amazing caramel apple pie.  This past time I had their Spicy Pulled Pork and French fries out on their patio--the pork was very juicy and sweet--unfortunately it was a little too juicy as the bread became very soggy and it was hard to eat, but it was still wonderful. Like I said I plan on coming back here again particularly on a Sunday for their $10 beer and brunch.  OHSO is definitely a wonderful and fun find.

nSNbEcYlimULIH4I9sxTmQ.text: One of the best dog friendly patios in the state of Arizona. There are a few perks to OHSO that are worth mentioning. The first is the homemade dog treats that are given out for free for your pupper to enjoy.  The second thing to note are the mimosas that come in a huge glass. One comes free per brunch menu ordered. Even just one of these will make you a little tipsy and are a great value add to your brunch!  I can't give OHSO a full five star review because even with the above perks I do not find the brunch menu items to be overly amazing. I've had the fruity pebble French toast (which is overloaded with way too much lemon cream cheese filling), the brunch bowl (which is okay but nothing special, and the brunch burrito (which again is just a standard brunch burrito). The food does not particularly stand out as amazing, but the atmosphere, patio, dog treats, and massive mimosas make OHSO a great brunch destination.

cw3J5YyDBFZmB9OPO1Ivmw.text: Their sangria is amazing as is their beer options. Food can be a little overpriced but that doesn't take away from how delicious it is. Their burgers are most always juicy and filling. I personally enjoy dabbling into their tacos. Oh ps.... their guac has bacon in it so you know you need to give it a go

Cd9cHtotuYRrwr-6DmGq_w.text: Amazing brunch deal for $10 which includes a hefty meal and your choice of a 10oz AZ brew or a Monster Mimosa! They have a fairly extensive craft beer menu and everything food related has yet to disappoint. I love how you can bring your dog, too! OHSO makes it easy with water bowls, homemade treats and enough shade/ fans outside that even an Arizona Day can't keep me and my pooch away :)

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Allow dogs on the patio!

jekfgnRBy-rTqIJK-1RQpA.text: Saturday morning breakfast with pink beer and fruity pebbles French Toast. What could go wrong? Absolutely nothing! The food, the service, the atmosphere. All a pleasant surprise and the best part of the day.

OjrFfRnLyS4d7l8pKW0xkw.text: The food is fun because it usually has a bit of a twist with it. The flavors are not always 100% but they are better than average so I would recommend it. The staff is great.  Really Cool vibe overall.  I love that they are dog friendly, even though I dont have a dog. I go once a month with a friend and always look forward to it. Check it out.

1cvtG7GJs8er9QeWDnBQkA.text: Ask for the hostess with the mostess Kristin !! . You will love this business - great vibe and good mix of locals!!   Excellent beer selection love the  local brew micro brews!!  Fog City #1 Good vibrations #1A

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. O.S.H.O. HAPPY

HBuYbVvunFytxtjkWEX4ew.text: The whole dog prints everywhere and dog treats at the front, made me pretty hesitant, I mean dogs and food together?? Weird.  However, I didn't see a single dog there, mind you it was Friday night. We were able to get a table for four quickly with no problem. I really enjoyed the atmosphere it's very homey and cozy and not too fancy.   The food and drinks came quickly and our server was awesome. My friend and I each ordered some ohso brews. Mine, the white elephant was super hoppy so I didn't like it and it never said that it would be in the description. My friend got the groovy and it was watery tasting, yuck!   To eat, I had the brisket which was great! The crunchy onions and sauce just make it. My friend who also ordered the brisket, had her bun come out burnt. It's not that hard to toast a bun dudes... Our other friends had the chicken sandwich and they said it was awesome.  I would come here again, despite the dogs but next time I'll stick to water!

AvAzl0q7QO3WqaMzdNkg2Q.text: We received very slow service and the waitress was great at ignoring us. It was not just the waitress, when we were waiting for our table I asked the bartender for a menu and she acted put out by it. The restaurant was not all that busy. We were seated at 10:30 and didn't leave until noon, and that's with only one drink. The waitress did not come for 15 minutes for us to even get waters and drinks. When we asked, "so with the beer and brunch thing, if you order any of these things you get a beer?" She smirked and said yes as if we were idiots. My Monte Cristo turned out to just be a ham sandwich? I thought it would be more special. My husband really liked his beer so that's why I'm giving 3 stars instead of 2. We asked for a to-go box and the waitress didn't come back so we got tired of waiting and just left.

flNrQ84JPvumS5Sj50f3Zg.text: Stopped by here accidentally and realized that this was a lively place at 10:30am on a Saturday.  We did the brunch portion of menu and it was a great deal for great food,great service and great price. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brunch

m1Y7wSLwOC26FxOkygUMJQ.text: We came with a group of 9 for Sunday brunch and it was great! My favorite part was that they include a beer in their brunch prices!  I ordered the monte cristo which was spectacular. Generous amount of melted Swiss is on top of a pile of ham in between tasty French toast. They have a jam smear on the plate which tasted great with the sandwich (it may have been cranberry but I am not certain). The potatoes were meh, especially when compared to the sandwich.  My husband ordered their chicken and waffles which were also quite good. And that is coming from me, a person who is not crazy for fried chicken. It comes with a small bowl of fresh fruit.  One of my friends ordered the biscuits and gravy which was also surprisingly good. The biscuits were average. The gravy was great with a distinct southwestern flair. Lots of sausage and a nice chili flavor without being too hot.

TrQ_3U62HbURgVQePDeBtQ.text: Awesome Brewery and food. This is their original location and it is just as great as all the other spots if not better. Definitely worth coming down and checking out if you've never been here. Great addition for many years in the Arcadia neighborhood

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pretzel board added sausage
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pretzel board added sausage
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BBQ bacon burger with fries

MGf5xU0g7NfY8G1ifHeiQQ.text: Really love the ambiance here. Especially if you sit on the patio, such good vibes. Went here to watch the game and they have great BIG TVs everywhere which is perfect to watch the game on. If it was rated on just ambiance and vibes alone I would give it 5 stars.  The food, drinks and service are below average. Especially for the price. I've been here multiple times and tried different things on the menu and every time, I am not feeling the food. The fries were cold, the burger didn't have any flavor. The best part about the meal was the pickle. The cocktail I had was like a very sweet juice, they seemed to have forgotten to put the alcohol in.  The waitress didn't tell us her name, she came by the table maybe 3 times in the 2 1/2 hours we were there, and gave us our bill without asking if we wanted anything else. Guess I wasn't allowed to try another drink on the menu... hmm. 2 stars because i really love the patio seating.

Bay0SZtAI0Y0qbNmRtfPZg.text: Do not order from here for Prime now!!! $17 for a salad smaller that an appetizer!!!  I asked for a lettuce wrap, I received everything thrown in a box! What a mess

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. $17 for Asian Chicken salad..... ummmmm who ate 1/2 of my salad then?!?  HORRIBLE

bn7BH_-LIzoyGWKbA0e92w.text: Environment - Win! Cleanliness - Win! Service - Win!  Kale Artichoke Dip - Win! AZ Burger - Win! Dogs Allowed - Win! . . . Valet Parking - Fail! Unnecessary and a nuisance. The ridiculousness of phoenix restaurants forcing valet parking is annoying but fast becoming a standard  Other than the valet parking this place is wonderful. Beware of that AZ Burger though. If you can't handle spicy this will murder your taste buds. Lol But if you love heat then give it a try. The fries are standard but well seasoned. However, the star of this particular visit is the Artichoke Dip. It tastes similar to a spinach artichoke dip being a salty, cheesy concoction but this had an added bonus; sweet bacon relish. Omg, it's like sex in a little dish. If you're a lover of sweet food or mixing sweet and salty then please try this. You won't regret it. Another new favorite restaurant, I'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Artichoke Dip and the AZ Burger. Deeeelish!

IqBVhXRldPglOR9EYlgC3Q.text: Solid Place solid food solid beer. Make sure to bring an empty stomach and your pooch. Cool atmosphere with pretty damn good staff. There's a couple unsharpened tools in the shed, otherwise it is a great place to visit.

hxvr1iqX46DlcGR7am7rIA.text: Wow!! My wife and I travel all over Arizona trying out micro-brews and what they offer to eat. We've been to Kingman, Bisbee, all over phoenix and Flagstaff and this location was perfect. Great food and a great beer selection. The outside patio was fantastic. Views of Camelback Mtn and the ability to walk off your meal along the canal. This spot is a must stop for lunch or any meal. The other great thing is, it's dog friendly. They have a cool water tap for dogs and a outside shower for them to be cooked off by their family.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States

t_qveS_OPu5DKrj6a-skSA.text: Really enjoyed this funky bar with a dog friendly patio.  They even have dog treats made from the left over grains mixed with peanut butter.   Great food, excellent service and awesome music. Can't wait to return!

LIbqvK8HCPuQIVc28_djyQ.text: I came here for brunch before and it was great. Now, the quality of this location gas spiraled. The 1st sign was the less-than-half full restaurant. The 2nd was the completely disinterested servers. Then I ordered the shrimp tacos, & the order came with "four tacos". Upon receiving my food, there were 6 1/4 shrimp on my plate with 4 tortillas. I've never had a shrimp taco with 1-2 shrimp in it. I exchanged the order for the grilled cheese and that was much better. There must be a behind the scenes story here, and I would not recommend going here. Especially when there are so many great places in the Valley.

wmLz2CXj7jw72jyiGx_y8w.text: I came here for brunch with my hubby for a quick bite to eat. I ordered their orange juice, pear salad and biscuits and gravy. We wanted to try this place because it was recommend on the uber eats most popular list.   I have to be upfront about their biscuit and gravy... it was way too salty for my taste. I mean my hubby agreed with me and he normally eats his food with a bit more sodium than the average person. I think I like my food pretty salty as well.... so it shocked me that I could not bare to eat it... It was just unbearable to eat, at least for me. I felt like the gravy was coating my mouth with salt. It was not a pleasant experience for me. Thank god I had my salad to balance the saltiness of the gravy. I mean maybe it was just a bad batch. Maybe if I tried it again, it might not be as salty. However, I don't think I want to take the risk...   I would recommend their orange juice and pear salad.   As far as the atmosphere, it was casual and cool. It was super laid back and relaxed. It is a dog friendly restaurant with a dog friendly patio. They even had these complimentary and super cute dog treats. These treats are located at the front of the restaurant.     I don't think I would go back. I usually go back to a lot of restaurants as an usual customer. However, I don't see myself going back to this one anytime soon.

P5W3FoaaxU5O5Dl5Kzmb4g.text: Good beer and drink options, great outdoor patio. Food is decent, definitely elevated bar food with a few comfort food options.

ilDG6CaF25DO0mH3PDgOaA.text: The food was delicious and sitting on the patio with my puppy was great! They were so kind to us and the dog, they gave him treats and a bowl to drink from, too. Definitely a place we will return to next time we are in Arizona!

SCxRa_U502Yow18_dV36CA.text: I had such a great time at a networking event here. The happy hour specials are a solid deal, and the food was fantastic. The event was on the patio, and it got a little bit too cold in certain locations. I say under the ramada, and there were no heaters near by, so I will make a different seat choice next time.

nkamx4keMAdd3yt6TG58Ag.text: We are dog lovers and this is our absolute favorite and goto restaurant with our dog stormy. There is a wonderful brunch on saturdays and sundays with excellent mimosas. A great plethora of draft beers to choose from. And we also like to go for dinner in the evenings. The service is always great. The back patio caters to the dogs with taps for the dogs water bowls and home made dog treats.  Truly a special place to go with your favorite furry friend.

tzP9hP_M4UdApS0UNV-EOQ.text: My Gosh I heart this place... they never disappoint. My favorite beer is Popsicle, a house strawberry blonde .. wish they had it in local grocery stores. This is one of my favorite spots & the good is pretty good too lol

_Dszwx0GW_I9CR3gaXUw6A.text: Party on the dog friendly patio for Sunday Brunch! ...beer or Mimosa included. Views of Camelback Mountain. Good food. Great atmosphere. Great happy hour too.  Our favorite place for a casual good meal.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Ncmby5P8sdBip9h4T-QlYw.text: What a fun friendly place for dogs and us humans as well. Outdoors and great vibe not to mention fresh original foods. And the beer flights are such fun. Yummy bear.

Ya7KfmTOy4sKdwhl19SqAg.text: O.H.S.O is some sort of strange amalgamation of a craft beer bar and casual dinning. Still, this place is a solid choice for a meal, especially if you are a beer nerd AND foodie. They boast a variety of burgers, salads, flatbreads, and tacos. However, I'm a firm believer that their brunch menu is O.H.S.O's greatest strength.  I arrived during late morning with a group of groomsmen and the first thing we noticed (aside from the beer menu) was the brunch special. Choose one item from the brunch menu plus 10oz of any Arizona beer or 1 mimosa for only $10.99. They have a carnitas bowl, some flatbreads, and more typical items such as biscuits and gravy, but I went with a breakfast wrap! Who could say "no" to eggs, bacon, potatoes, guacamole, cheese, and salsa wrapped up in whole wheat? Came with a side of fruit too! It was pretty tasty.I prefer my food to have a bit of a kick so hot sauce was necessary.   As for the beer, I was hesitant to try the house beers and I've already tried the out-of-state ones so I went with local brews. Coconut Joe by Papago brewing was roasty and the coconut shined through. I also tried SanTan Brewing's Mr. Pineapple. They weren't freakin kidding. Tasted like I was drinking straight pineapple juice...  I doubt I'll be back in AZ. But if I do return, I'll keep O.H.S.O as an option. Check them out if you get the chance!

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast burrito

PrdbSkRobweKX6298jOM0Q.text: I LOVE that I can take my dogs here and enjoy food and beverages with my friends, more bars need to be dog friendly ;)  Food here can go both ways, sometimes it'll be the best thing I've ever eaten, and other times it's just okay. Of course, this could be effected by how many mimosas or beers I've had. (more alcohol=AMAZING food). Except the chicken and waffles. Those are delicious pre and post booze :)  Service is always great! Just be prepared for a wait!

1zcYvkEZzDpnIN1yoeUKfQ.text: Fantastic and unusual food, happy hours, prices, friendly staff, good vibe. Beer brunch is amazing on weekends. Choice of entree plus drink for $10. Crab won tons at happy hour for $3. Mac and cheese seafood yummy. 2 dog friendly patios, free dog treats.  Valet parking or ride your bike along canal path.

civZGAyV-3ANLNpQMDdyQw.text: Great food Great service!! I would make any excuse to go to OHSO!! And at would be a good day for OHSO!! Went for Mother's Day and Sunday brunch, AMAZING!! So good! B&G are the best!! Put an egg on it, makes it even better!  hmm OHSO for dinner...'yea for sure!!

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazing B&amp;G with a kick!! :)

IiIZhOAWXiC5NFWYdV7neQ.text: The craft beer is delicious, the bar leads to open patio which is nice concept. the food was great and reasonably priced. Our bar service was friendly and very attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious calamari and ahi tuna
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The food was amazing and the beer selection was great. The atmosphere is inviting.

BTwSQgkTrqe5x_2IRid5gg.text: Really enjoy this place for so many reasons: -beer selection! -the ability to brew and tap your own on site -the burgers!!! -the huge amount of space  -location -patio -dog & bike friendly  My husband and I try to ride our bikes along the canal to get to this burgers and beer party place.  Over time service gets better and better, when if first opened, it was kinda hit or miss. This is always my go to for visiting friends and last minute dinner excursions.  Lots of love for OHSo

4e-VKA4ogT2h0uL5r5XVTA.text: Went here for a Sunday brunch and had a great time. The menu is limited but you get a mimosa or beer included with your meal. The wait was not long and I loved the atmosphere outside. Food was great!   Be aware you must valet...it is complimentary but I felt lousy without a giving a tip so had to get a few bucks off my cousin since I didn't have any cash on me!

SlWWiVa8Pb8Qohjs-rO25g.text: I travel a lot for work and always make it a point to find a local brewery or pub in all the cities I go to.  I have to say this was one of the best!  The brews were fantastic and the food was upscale with a pub feel.  Note - the samples are a $1 each, but worth they spend.  Try and White Mocha brew....very cool!

hMAe_wfB4rJBbfNYHNNZzg.text: I just like this place. Originally sat on the front patio which is funny because in always sat there, but we moved to the back with the dog so we could watch all the sport. There was a slight rain a brewin so they brought us an umbrella. Beers are always on point! Good was hit and miss. Tacos were good but deconstructed. Works for some. The Thai hummus tastes like peanut butter hummus. Not a fan. Had a bunch of other apps that were fine. I love the beer, the service and the whole place. Just gotta find my dishes.

1U9wOfcgNsQjL5mG4NmAqw.text: I will say the food here is spectacular, but the service is something to be desired. We asked our server if they could change one of the TV channels which was showing the news to the ASU game and she said her manager wouldn't allow it because the TVs behind the bars are reserved. Who reserves the news behind the bar on a Saturday night??? There wasn't anyone even watching it. Being a Sun Devil alum and fan I have to give this 3 stars due to their lack of local team spirit!

017Kx_2nLYxvUdYD85id6Q.text: Best spot for hard to find local AZ brew!!!  They also have a very cool Nano brew setup that every homebrewer would kill to have!  Good food, good atmosphere, and enough bikes on the patio to start your own hipster bicycle gang.

dIKw4Kjzb_1Uw-csD6DKsQ.text: We stopped in here on our way home from Cave Creek. The service was great. Attentive and personable waiter. We placed our orders and waited. And waited, and waited. It took maybe 45 minutes for us to get our food.   Now this normally would be super aggravating but what happened next defined the experience for us. When the food was delivered to the table, the manager, Madison delivered the food personally and showed us a bit of "love" in our bar tab.   What this said to us was that we were valued customers and that the management was going to take a pro active approach to actually SHOWING us that.   Thank you Madison, Huberto  (our waiter) and OHSO. You guys rock.

xYBitlfZu5qiRD9eshV1wg.text: The service was cheerful and friendly-- the food was perfect...tasty and fresh. The mimosas are tasty!

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Inside ohso dining area

XClZvDGcGtgrt8-RopQRxg.text: After at least a dozen visits to O.H.SO, I just realized I never reviewed it. Maybe I subconsciously didn't want to endorse this Arcadia gem because I was hoping no one would find it... Well that plan didn't work! Here are the reasons I love O.H.S.O 1.  Brunch: $10 for entree and a beer (Or mimosa) 2. Dog friendly patio: Plenty of water and dog hooks near the table, so the pooches can enjoy the day too.   3. Beer Selection:  I'm not a huge fan of beer, but I they have a great selection of draft beers and plenty of fruity girly options (which is what I'll drink).    As a vegetarian, I have been very pleased with their menu, trying everything from the breakfast grilled cheese (minus the meat), O.H.S.O Rita flat bread pizza to the Yucca chips and have been very satisfied.  This location is also pretty big, so it's great spot for large parties.

j-J9w_ArXXL2-aBekFrI-g.text: Great place will definitely come back! We had the chips and guac- very good, hummus plate- LOVED IT, brisket mac- my too crazy about it since there was just a bunch of mayo and couldn't taste the cheese at all. Overall great quality of food. LOOOVED THE BEER! Great job on their brews. I ended up getting a pitcher of morning brew which was DELICIOUS and tasted like fresh coffee! Very satisfied! I'm giving 4/5 stars only because their service was a bit slow but then again, they were very busy.

yig5kYqVq9Hzo1kINOHAjQ.text: The interior is reminiscent of the queue inside the Indiana Jones attraction at Disneyland. The food is edible. Gordon Ramsay would only be mildly disappointed.   Three stars.

AFgodDepitwhsclLYpPltQ.text: I really like O.H.S.O. Made sure that we got here in time for happy hour and to get a place on the patio. Walking in there are doggie treats for free, should you have a doggie! The smell of pretzels, I am assuming, wafts thru the place and gives you the want for a large pretzel and beer. Free valet and friendly hops to take your ride away.  The pitchers of any Arizona brews are $6 ... Good price on the smaller pitcher for two and a good way to get a sampling without too much of a commitment. COULD have been alot colder. Nothing worse than beer that isn't icy.. in my opinion, at least. We started with apps of the hh smaller bites. I loved the pretzel and cheese dip/fondue. Could have given me a warm pitcher of that! We also had the OHSO Green Chile Dip ..not a thing wrong with it and the yucca chips are a treat. I'm a fan with the exception of the beer not icy thing and letting my water go dry. Picky picky! But a huge offering of brews on a nice patio is a good, good thing!

J4LyS41RHEXQNCBKGhLp3g.text: What can I say.... This place is great!  Beer selection is phenomenal and the brunch and a 10 oz. AZ beer for $10 is quite the deal! The back patio, which is dog friendly, is extremely relaxing on a nice AZ day with views of Camelback mountain. Bring your bikes as this is located right off of the canal trails and plenty of space to lock them up.

LSrMDpcr5j5NOhzRh8TzyQ.text: OHSO is the shit, I love this place. Great Moscow mules, killer vibes, and amazing veggie burger. Bring your dog, your friends, or your dog's friends to the back patio for an awesome time.

GXLjRtlAye5J3yfoxVdGuQ.text: I visited O.H.S.O for the first time on Sunday, meeting some friends for brunch. We sat outside on the patio. They have lots of umbrellas available so there is plenty of shade.  Their brunch menu is not huge but they have a list of items all for $10 and it includes a beer or a mimosa so not a bad deal. I ordered the breakfast pizza which was a flatbread with eggs, cheese, chorizo and arugula. The portion was large - I ended up bringing half of it home with me. The mimosa was a good size too - it was served in a wine glass, not just a skimpy champagne flute.  The breakfast pizza had a really great flavor and was a nice lighter breakfast, even with the chorizo - I didn't feel weighed down afterwards. I tried a bite of my friend's French toast, too. It was good but really sweet. I was glad I had the pizza.  The wait staff was friendly but not super attentive. My friend had to ask three times to get a refill on her water.   But other than that, everything was great and I would definitely go back.

srX8gEIa6MLUb2LAK5gxeA.text: One word: Brunch Sure you could come here for HH on Fridays (as there are always a large number of cute single ladies here).  Sure you could come to dinner.   I just don't know why you would! O.H.S.O is a brunch place period. A top 2 Mimosa in the Valley without question!  Back Patio! Forget about it. INSANE!!!!   I used to come here when it was "Black Forrest Mil" bar for dancing, and now that it has been totally revamped, I come here for the amazing back patio they added and great beer selection, mostly local to the AZ area is a big plus for us local boys.  And now... a game for you to play!  Everytime to you go... Create an acryonym for O.H.S.O and leave it as tip. I've played this game on FourSquare for years, but since Yelp is so much more amazing, I have to bring the tradition over here as well...  Some previously made acronyms we've come up with are... Obviosly Hot Sexy Occupants Other Humans Steal Olives Outlandish Hominids Sucky Oxygen Owning Honest Shiny Oysters Outlandish Hyper Sensitive Orks Orangutangs Have Sweetened Oranges Etc..  Please enjoy the acronym game here by leaving them as tips!

QRA2iX89MLy9wC9EGzjhuw.text: This was my first stop ever for food or drink in the Phoenix area.  After the flight I was ready for a cocktail.  Yay - they had those.  I also had some delicious carnitas tacos.  Then I ordered another drink.  The happy hour was super reasonable and the food was delicious.  I can see this as being good for several experiences:  meeting old friends, bringing your dog to lunch, first date, work lunch, etc.  With a mixed experience restaurant like this, your dreams will never be completely fulfilled.  But hopefully you are caught up in good conversation or your dog's funny face.  If you don't have dogs or friends with you, it may not be your best bet.  Probably your best spot for a late afternoon lunch and drink with your amigo.

xfwuYoIyHNgjFwXcEuUeMQ.text: Good food, good beer and good service.  Easily the best turkey burger I've ever had.  The outside patio in back is great when it's not too hot outside.

GMCO4tdLHmUN-eV1DvFOag.text: The only reason I'd give this place three stars is for the design, floor plan and variety of beers. Otherwise it is obnoxiously over packed, horrible parking situation, and under staffed. Sitting inside can be a. It intoxicating due to the food smoke from the kitchen, so prepare to smell like charred bacon when you leave.   Otherwise, very friendly staff, good food, and beer.

MxKQfGwvZ6qi7YEjWe_-DA.text: O.H.S.O is a great place for a beer and good food. We most enjoy visiting O.H.S.O on Saturday and Sunday mornings as we can bring our dog and enjoy a mimosa and breakfast for $10 per person. This dog friendly restaurant offers easy access from the canal, homemade treats for your pup and a water bowel station so your furry friend never gets thirsty.

t9wrVM6E2Kl-Jidma9rbhg.text: One of my favorite brunch places in the area. Saturday and Sunday they do a "beer brunch" where you are served a pint of your choice with breakfast. Usually ranging about 10-15$ that includes a range of choices, my favorite being the fruity pebble french toast. Simply amazing. I pair that with a rotating beer they are currently brewing and voila! Patio is dog friendly. Even in our hot AZ summers they cool it off enough with umbrellas and misters everywhere to enjoy yourself outside.

D5sARPEXrIDr8koKZvy0xw.text: Almost forgot to leave a bad review, glad I didn't.  This place is the worst place I've come to eat. We come after pat's run and are seated and there's a freshly dead cockroach right next to our table. Guess they can kill it and just walk past it until it disintegrates.  Then we're talking for 15 minutes patiently then start to question where our waiter is for at least a drink order. Many waiters walked past us not even greeted they're just in their own world.   We wait 10 more minutes and decide to leave and go some place else. 25 minutes of waiting and not even a drink order and a newly dead cockroach near our table in plain view.  Terrible experience and staff.

O9y4qcOubxC8s7_jR_jcww.text: In town for business...this place popped up as being nearby. SO glad it did! What a laid back bar with AMAZING comfort food. I had the brisket sandwich and I'm convinced I'll be dreaming about that sandwich for the rest of my life. It was awesome. Great variety of unique cocktails too. Friendly service, great casual ambience. Highly recommend!

_H6vYQQiOGNqcV8xoejeBw.text: I've visited this location as well as the north scottsdale one. My husband and I walked in and asked for a table for 7 and the "hostess" was rude, rolled her eyes and responded "wait here. I guess I have to put tables together for you". So sorry to be bringing business to your employer! Had a wonderful and patient waitress, sampled many beers as a table and I settled on the Orange Blossom. YUM! For dinner I had the carne asada tacos, amazing!! Others had the burger and cheese, az burger, salmon blt and surf n turf...no complaints except one of the burgers was pink when they asked for no pink. Oh, the fries are delicious! Only other con... The bathroom is disgusting!!! Yuck!

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carne melts in your mouth and the jalapeño slaw is SO good!!

_IVETrS8W8I4O6RERJcLjg.text: Best veggie burger in town, Artichoke dip is a must and they have an excellent selection of beer.

JCI4ppKAI24mZRq6t4ZA8g.text: Food was delicious, mimosas great, service was good. Now....if I could tell who was working there as opposed to who was the customer. Everyone dressed same. Parking is terrible. You almost forced to valet. I hate that, personal choice, obviously. I may try a different time but for now,  on the back burner. Go b4 noon on weekend's, the crowd starts going in after they either wake up from night before or after morning workout.

YSIOuFPQem4-BEXxAWxHxQ.text: 4 star for beer selection.  2 star for food selection. Average 3 star. Don't come here if you're hungry. Might as well eat at McDonald's (yuck), then come here for a beer or two. Or vice versa. Seriously. I can't stand the food here. It's the reason OHSO is no longer on my list of places to be. Oh that and parking is even worse than the food. The worst! The more I write, the less stars I should give them.

qVtD2hFlrCgJDBf1S-GqKA.text: Ive been wanting to come here for a while, so when we left another bar in the neighborhood and the question of "Where now?" came up, i jumped at the chance to try it.   Great beer list with lots of AZ brews as well as others. We didnt eat dinner, but I tried their Sunday brunch a few weeks later. Everything sounded delicious but my 2 friends and I all opted for the breakfast grilled cheese (fontina, prosciutto, green apple, w/ agave nectar and fruit on the side). I wish I wouldve ordered something else. The bread to cheese ratio was not good. Regardless, I would definitely come back to try something else.  Both patios are awesome, the one in back is much, bigger than the front ones. It has tons of shade, misters, fans, and a large bar in the middle. OHSO is also doggie friendly (if youre into that sort of thing).  I would definitely recommend this place.

FwRK5A4s0PotnazPNKhjOg.text: Food was good, staff (the majority of those we came in contact with) could use a class in customer service. From rude comments to forgetfulness (and then an attitude when reminded about the water we were waiting for) and a hostess with a bad attitude. Based on this I'm not sure I would come back. The food is good but when the service is crap it makes you think twice. You can get good food somewhere else.

YIS8N6nf9yAD4I8qrQfmCg.text: Love this place for brunch. $10 and $15 specials for things like fruity pebbles French toast and chicken & waffles. Servings are generous, but more than that, their mimosas are HUGE. The place is big enough that you never have to wait for a table, even if it's prime time on a Sunday morning. Plus, cute pups galore on their gorgeous patios.

7NRbuDJ9nn7HdbgQQD6ULw.text: This seemed to have a good reputation, from the people I've talked with, for food, but sadly, it appears expectations were set a little high.   I ordered the waffles, as I had a craving the previous night, and had a mimosa with the meal (it was brunch on a Sunday at 10 am). The mimosas arrived (I was there with two others), and lacked any sort of flavor. The alcoholic content seemed rather low and the orange juice was decidedly bland (agreed by all).   Then the food arrived, the other two had order breakfast burritos which looked like burritos - always a good thing.   The waffles on the other hand, were distinctly cold and dry, as if they had been cooked first, or at the very least cooked an hour before we arrived. Upon further examination, they were more dry than expected, even pouring on the COLD syrup (which tasted like the cheap "syrup") couldn't take away the dryness.   The waiter could be bothered to ask how things were until after other two had finished their meals (he had walked by three times during the meal). I had left three quarters of the plate and yet there wasn't a single question as to why I didn't finish it.   Won't be returning for brunch or breakfast again, maybe for dinner as I hear the apple pie is good.

pfR7AeGIrf47vW467KlicQ.text: Love this place! They have the best food and great service. This is a must stop for me and the family when we're in town

U6FGw_fd-4p6_ZFnkr4XoA.text: man will not be coming back the service was crap when I need to go look for my own silverware ketchup and go up to the bar to get water because the server never comes back the food wasn't very good sandwich that I had was just bla salads was so salty or maybe I was just mad because of the service but we'll never know
