There are 40 plus brews on taps but since this is a brew pub there's wine and other cocktails available too. I have to say our food was delicious and the service exceptional. If you're a guacamole fan you do need to order that as a starter. Bits of corn and dried cherries in there. Trust me it's incredible!

qBoX_MZPwLl48UrsOMR6cw.text: Nicely situated spot in Arcadia, with a pretty nice selection of beers. However, my experience was unfortunately severely soured by the unpleasant server who made threatening remarks, comfortably profiled our party as "people who'd buy nice fake IDs", and combative language.   The serving experience was puzzling and I had thought the restaurant was one of those locations in which the staff are intentionally rude and combative, however that is not the case as other staff members were smiley and very approachable.   I am disappointed that this was my experience, but the crowd and menu balanced out the atmosphere.

0Vcm3abSTBiI2EhzeJj2UA.text: Great place to come with dogs and relaxing to be outside in the cooler months.  Generous pours of bourbon every time I have been there.  Have had about 10 of the items on them menu with some very good and others just so-so.  Try the chicken and waffles meal - it's a hit every time.  Can get busy at times so be prepared to wait 30 minutes or more.

C61peMoRCG1aKi7flnSbcw.text: I have NEVER been treated so poorly at any  establishment than I was at OSHO tonight. I and my husband have been going to OSHO Arcadia since it opened. Took our dog there, know the waitresses names, have met the owner. Tonight we where served by waitress Andie who we had never seen her there before. We where not intoxicated. We were eating our food. We then had 4 friends unexpectedly join us. They were not intoxicated. Manager came over and said that Andie was suddenly not comfortable serving us drinks. We have heard comments from other friends that also have not been comfortable eating there. We have been eating there for years. NEVER AGAIN. #oshoisdead #oshosucks I love and have lived in Arcadia for 30 years. Never have I been treated so poorly at an establishment. I will never go back. 0 stars. Wow so disappointed.

zxNB0LrBmTVvKOSMjP91jg.text: AmaZing chicken and waffles plus a great brewery. Wide range of beers to select from. Should definitely chose patio if the weather is good. Service 3/5

D0l8iQv-viWg4m5aV07VxA.text: All the beers you can have for sure!! I had the Mr. Pineapple, softly flavored blonde beer and I paired it up with the blackened salmon. The quinoa with the salmon was a delish. Their patio facing the canal is also nice!!

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Blackened salmon with quinoa and asparagus! A tasty healthy choice!!! ;)

Kke2lmy6gNQWAf156CW8mQ.text: I have enjoyed osho since they hosted &  saved the university of Arizona coaches tour several years ago after the devil brewer bar in Tempe dumped the az event last minute u devils! Great food bbq & pastrami sandwiches w side sauces & hoppy beer! Enjoyable local dog friendly place.

7UO9zESF1XPR2pdYOxjORQ.text: My husband and I ride our bikes up and down the canal pathway during the milder months, which are most of them in Phoenix. OHSO is typically our final destination of choice as we ride about 20 miles there from North Phoenix. They have a great brunch option on the weekends and convenient bike parking in the back. The people are great, the atmosphere is super fun, and the growler options are fantastic. Bonus--they are beyond dog friendly. We are most recently in love with their liquor distillery options. I buy bottles and growlers and will drive out of my way to go buy some local goodies before any family I have is in town.

FB--yCA6VJ11eRSQLzmC9Q.text: Happy hour until 6:00. $7 for a pitcher of local brew and for some drinks or a glass of wine. Not much on happy hour food. We split the Del Mar Mac and cheese. It was excellent! Loaded with shrimp and plenty for two to share. Too hot for patio today, but will be great come cooler weather.

-A3mMf6KhrjLTsU4ccrzCw.text: I love all the OHSO locations. This one happens to be the closest to me so I go here but I love them all! Love the dog patios; all the staff members are always SO kind and helpful! Also love that they have valet here!

PONZHXkFHtvUPjXbK3DG0g.text: Love this place! Great atmosphere, good beer, love that they also serve liquor, and the food is great! Highly recommend the salad with goat cheese and adding protein, you get a very large serving and its one of the best salads I have gotten. The service was a tad slow (hence 4 stars instead of 5) but if youre not in a rush I highly recommend!

OB9DuDApFQrl0_22qC07DQ.text: Industrial style, yet upscale brewery. With trendy food. That let's your doggy come. No light beers for lightweights. We tried the Rita pizza and a taco plate. Both were fine but I couldn't get by the prices. I realize I am in a trendy Arcadia place where my doggy gets free biscuits.   The Scottsdale Blonde brew was great, we finished off a pitcher. I didn't care for the pizza, it was a spray of pesto and some cheeses over a so-so flat bread. the bartended seemed disinterested in us.   Worst part is the dang valet. This place is the Arcadia version of Postino/Vig. You get the good and the bad with some menu gems. Bring your wallet and a full bank account.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ohso Rita pizza
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beeeer
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beer n complimentary dog biscuits

kbkBacoeipUhFcZiewUpRg.text: Best bar on tap in the area! There are so many different beers, brewed here and elsewhere that are delicious. Combine that with a bomb happy hour, and this is a great place. It might be my favorite happy hour around around!  Just think about it, come here after work any weekday and enjoy some beers with pretzels and cheese. That will make any headache from the workweek go away!   I still haven't tried this place for dinner but I need to. As for the other food, it is good but nothing special. Try an Orange blossom, you won't regret it.  Also, yes yes, dogs are welcome here and they're pet friendly. The outside patio in the back is the place to set, if the weather permits!

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken wrap

yBvOAvKhuWzyrSJ4OTS4_A.text: What a great place. Made beer yesterday with Dave a brewer at OSHO. He was very knowledgeable and I picked up a lot of new techniques about brewing beer. During a break I had the chicken and waffles. They were fantastic! Great place and great people!

I3bM62Z4d2-AK5ZFwq1K-w.text: Great neighborhood place just bike down the canal to get too. Great food dog friendly just sit outside and  people watch.

uRyrCWZBqGHiry_3HAcENA.text: Very great experience at this location! I was meeting some of my friends at noon and our friend got there before us and they seated her at the front patio right away. The restaurant was very busy and very packed because it was Sunday and brunch is a staple here.   Our waiter was the sweetest and he was very attentive. I was very impressed with the service beyond belief. He was very sweet and very knowledgeable about the restaurants menu.  My sister ordered the chicken and waffles and they tasted amazing. And I ordered the biscuits and gravy. It wasn't my favourite dish but it was still well made and tasted okay.   All breakfast orders came with a monster Mimosa which was awesome. These mimosas are very strong. And very well worth the price if you're going to order them separate.   The waiter also separated all of our checks without even having us tell him which was super amazing on his part. I have been very impressed with this location.   The restaurant itself is very clean. It does get a little hot outside so be cautious of that.

nFji0MofURmTuHTcNrx3yg.text: Wow. Went to OHSO and thought let's try something new. The food took almost 45 minutes to come out which was a pretzel and dipping sauce. Once we received the food we had limited interactions from our sever.  The best part about the night when we went outside we found out our car was towed. The signs were in the dark and no warning from anyone at OHSO about parking.   In the future it would be great if the hostess could inform restaurant guest not to park next door.  Very upsetting.

CBs5MJkTeDzJ8s4OFe_65A.text: I was only able to stop here for an hour after a recent business trip, but the Morning Brew, a blonde, coffee-flavored light beer was incredible. $7 for a pitcher was also a welcome surprise. In addition we had the chips and guacamole, which had an interesting guacamole (there were corn and onions in the guac - it was a "meatier" version of guac than I've ever had before, but not bad.  OHSO tops all this off with friendly staff and incredible decor. There is no way I won't be back here on my next trip.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Inside restaurant
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Front entryway
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Inside and outside bar patios

HR1gEfU-MRHfY6DGVEzRHg.text: This place is great! Dog friendly and love their beer and it's a fun, casual atmosphere. It's also a short bike ride away. The only thing keeping me from giving it 5 stars is they don't have any vegan options. We would visit way more often if they did. So many people out there are on plant-based diets and with the rise of Beyond Meat and the Impossible Burger (even fast food joints are using it), it's time for OHSO to get with the times. Also, places like Scramble and Snooze use egg replacement options like "Just Egg" so we end up going there instead. But I love OHSO and would rather go there for the beer/mimosa brunch egg bowl if they used egg replacement. Please OHSO, help a brother out.

rTOBsXvMlKJuzl62mSr-3Q.text: Came here as my last eats while visiting Scottsdale from a friend's recommendation, and am very glad I did! It was a beautiful day so I chose to go out back to the bar outside and it was a dog lover's dream! I was surrounded by cute dogs and pups - all who were on their best behavior :)  Decor is very cute and the place is kind of separated in different sections which is cool. I would recommend sitting out back if you can in the outdoor area, though.  I tried the grapefruit vodka and cucumber vodka (both just with soda water) and enjoyed them both a lot. For food, I got the brisket mac and YUM! It was sooo good. I thought I would save some for later but I ate pretty much all of it. Great flavor, good chunks of brisket, and delicious crispy onion strings on top. I highly recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Adorable pup out back!
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brisket Mac

gTXaw60qFh10cKqveOZeRA.text: Came for my birthday and OHSO again didn't disappoint. We had the breakfast burrito, biscuits and gravy,  and the breakfast wrap.  While my wife said the burrito was missing it's usual chorizo, the wrap was just the right size and texture. The breakfast mimosas are ALWAYS great and to stay the weekend off with a nice buzz is always enjoyable. This place is always busy when we visit and I can see why - they do great food and the beers are super. Have yet to try their distilled concoctions but will do eventually.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_BFP8nJhZHrRL7Dis5-PAw.text: I am rating this a 5 solely for their Brisket Mac and Cheese - so good! I enjoyed the cheesy and creamy noodles with a touch of sweet bbq sauce and brisket! Yumm.   Coming from California, we were looking for something that's not in California and this place fit that criteria.  For the experience, decor and other food items, I would give this place 4 stars.   Restaurant had indoor & outdoor seating. The decor & lighting was a bid dim, but set a nice bar/brewery ambiance. Restaurant was very dog friendly as well. They offered doggie bags and had some paw prints on the floor leading up to their doggie area (so cute).   Ordered a cheeseboard for an appetizer- Roughly $18, but had a nice presentation.  The Pb&j burger was pretty good as well, but I've tried juicier ones before.   Beer selection was pretty good! Offered lots of local Arizona drinks.   Customer Service wasn't bad either. Staff was pretty engaging, but had to break the news that they ran out of beef jerky for my cousin's Bloody Mary (but at least they were humorous and honest  about it)!  Again, rating this place highly for the Mac and cheese. It was something to remember. Enjoy :)

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brisket Mac &amp; Cheese.
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. PB Burger and Fries.
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheese Board.

s7ydbX8CHis8gDExxivDcA.text: Overall Love OHSO and this location is no different from the others I've visited.   From the food to the atmosphere what's there to not love.    If you love dogs this is a heavenly location, as it's pet friendly on the patio. If you don't like pets or allergic their is always the indoor option. At this location I don't think I've ever sat inside but the service is always great so I bet is a great option.   All of the OHSO offers a Saturday and Sunday brunch. I don't think you can go wrong with anything on their brunch menu. The plus, with a brunch order you can get a free mimosa or beer. Definitely can't go wrong with that.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken and Waffles
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States

NeiOvyhxXI3ndL26EfgWNQ.text: I give this place 4 stars solely based on the food. First let me talk about all of the good things about this place. It's dog friendly and it was great to see all of the little "human dogs" as I call them. The dogs are allowed on the patio areas and I enjoyed walking through with my boyfriend and his dog and seeing all of the different dogs either sitting at the bar, at the tables or on the ground ready to greet the other dogs as they walked in. The environment is very cozy and hipster chic. The staff is abundantly friendly and the people that come here seem to be very friendly and chatty as well.   Now to the food that disappointed me. I ordered the Blackened Salmon which I thought was going to be a lot more flavorful. The salmon was very dry, the green beans could have and should have been cooked a little longer to give the green beans more of a softer texture. The salmon also came with some kind of veggie that seemed to be either cooked carrots or cooked yams(shoulder shrug)....I'm not sure but it was the most flavorful thing on my plate. Lol. I believe they rely on the creamy white sauce to flavor the salmon but I didn't care for that sauce.   My boyfriend ordered the Mac Del Mar though and it was DELICIOUS!!! I know what to order next time! (Flashes smile)

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mac Del Mar and Blackened Salmon

s6ozVVSu3CXLcppD1D9hcA.text: I always love coming to OHSO, and I think this location is probably my favorite! The back patio is awesome, and I love seeing all the dogs. It's usually too hard for us to make it at a good hour since it's always sooo busy here, but we got lucky the Wednesday before Thanksgiving this year.  Happy hour is pretty awesome, we got a $7 pitcher of beer and my fiance also got a $7 Moscow mule. He didn't love either, but I liked them so it worked for me lol. We also got the Pretzels & Cheese Dip from the $3 Small Bites menu on HH - these were so good! Just beware because they are in fact really small bites haha.  For dinner, I got the Chinese Chicken Salad which was super good, and my fiance got the The Brisket sandwich and fries which is always amazing (I'd choose that over the salad for sure).  Our server was awesome, too, and she said we were her first table ever! So that was impressive. Def recommend giving this place a try :)

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Brisket Sandwich
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Moscow Mule
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chinese Chicken Salad

baS_oKnsx2iVwfh_4DuY7A.text: Excellent customer service and food. Hung out in the patio area and enjoyed great company and food. You can bring your fur babies with you and they have a great selection of pup brews.  Highly recommend stopping in and grabbing a cold one or two and try their food.

sdUfbag0Wdzui0yfdz8paA.text: Back here again. It is dog friendly and right along the canal.  There are a lot of TV's both inside and outside on the patio.  This place is awesome for large groups.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Patio with TV&#39;s

9A5mBDk0sC9G5ooqHOjlBA.text: Loved the patio.  We didn't bring our dog but very dog friendly.  Please open a restaurant in Tucson!

bCleoVqw_mqRa7Qw9_GyEA.text: Awesome local restaurant!  I love coming here for weekend brunch.  Great options and a mimosa or beer is included with the meal!  Huge patio space and probably the most dog friendly spot in the valley.  (Probably not your go to if you don't like canines) They brew their own beer and make some spirits as well (horseradish vodka in the bloody mary was )   Go support you local neighborhood watering hole!

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. With their homemade horseradish vodka.  Yum!

FiyuALGoo4CovTqOdoSKCg.text: I came on a Sunday so it was a little busy. Service was pretty slow, but expected.  I love that a mimosa or beer is included when you order something off of the brunch menu! I wasn't in the mood for bottomless so this did the job!  For the food, four words: FRUITY PEBBLES FRENCH TOAST! To die for, absolutely amazing. Will definitely be coming back for more of

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Avocado toast, fruity pebbles french toast, breakfast bowl with steak

ennktZr9TWb9sDZrrctIXw.text: This is the original brunch hot spot. They have multiple locations, but this one is the OG. I mostly go to either to just drink or drink and brunch.  They have one of the better brunch specials in town. You get a meal and either beer or mimosa for $10-$15. As much as I love beer, I'd go for the mimosa. They are huge and about 90% champagne, just the way I like them. Getting a good buzz here can be quite economical with their mimosas.   This is definitely a fun place to drink and hang out, but I've never been overly impressed with their food. I had the fruity pebbles french toast on my recent trip. It was just a bit too much for me. Also, I normally try and get some sort of nutritional value from my breakfast, so I'm not sure why I ordered it.   Long story short, this is a great place to drink, hang out, and have a nice brunch. The food isn't bad, but not that great either. Parking here is a nightmare, so plan on doing valet.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fruity Pebbles French Toast

fiORdIeD1IpaqAUgugrxHQ.text: Could be better  I came with very high hopes and expectations. A lot of my friends had recommended this place, stating it was their usual spot. I came here during my lunch time to grab a quick bite. Its a cute little spot. Nice clean, service was very attentive and nice.   I ordered the Green Chile Burger with a side of fries. Boy, did it look BIG. I cut my burger it half. It was perfectly cooked to medium, the bun was nice and warm, cheese melted, and tons of chopped green hatched chile. I LOVED that it didn't fall all apart. However, I was SO disappointed that there wasn't much flavor to it. No heat from the chile, no spice. Just a plain burger with cheese. The fries were good, again not much flavor. Maybe the chef went had a light hand ? But I was expecting much more. I will probably give this place one more try due ot all the good review, but I really wouldn't pay $15 for my burger and fries if theres not flavor. It also didn't fill me up. I could definately eat another burger...  ALSO, pet peeve: I paid in cash and the waiter didn't give me back the change, he just rounded DOWN as if I was going to give it to him... After that, my waiter was not around so that I could tell him I needed the exact change back. I was short a dollar and some change. If youre going to round at least round UP so that your customers don't think your jipping them.   Environment: 5/5 Food: 3/5 Price:2/5 Service: 3/5

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Green Chile Burger

5MPXHFy0f2WV58AH1rumLg.text: Great staff, solid beer and subpar food.   Stopped by for a beer, turkey burger and spicy Bloody Mary which was probably the best part.  The turkey burger was falling apart so bad that half the burger fell out the bottom and the bread ripped all over, in short it was a hot mess. The fries really saved the meal because they were a perfect mix of salty and crisp enough to hold a crunch for the 30 minutes or so I was sitting there. The bloody was also pretty good and had a nice kick to it.  Service was great but I spent way too much money for the subpar meal and drinks I had, nearly $55 for 2 drinks and a burger which is the reason for the 3*, otherwise would have been a 4*.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Turkey burger - falls apart quickly and has a lot of bread

0eDz_Y6h8rNj6N-ZtgmPRg.text: I came for Sunday brunch and can I just let you all know they include a large mimosa or beer with every brunch entree purchase! Definitely a laid back atmosphere, quite a retreat from the Old Town scene! The food was great. I got the breakfast bowl with egg whites and it was tasty and so so filling! The prices are reasonable considering the free beverage. A great place to bring the pups and relax.

_38NMumcda0gGYBpLMXYAQ.text: As newbies to Arizona, we have finally made our way to this local favorite! So many good reviews but I am eager to send my good words as well! The spot is very cool, as well as they have a nice mister system outside which keeps you cool in this heat! My husband and I went and they were doing happy hour! They have the best happy hour as it's Monday-Friday from opening till 6! Covers a bunch of beer options that you can have in a pitcher, Moscow mules with literally 9 vodka flavors even horseradish! Lol, that's some brave people to order that :-) I had a glass of the red sangria which was delicious as well! As far as the food, we love loved the buffalo cauliflower!! My husband had the angry bird sandwich which he literally inhaled practically! Haha. I had the pilgrim sandwich which was turkey and cranberry relish which I am obsessed with. So so good. The fries were great. As far as the service goes, it was great. Everyone was friendly and actually seemed to enjoy being there. The vibe is great and we will most Ferris my be back. On the weekends they do a pretty amazing brunch from what the server told us!

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sangria and the pitcher of beer plus my husband
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Inside the spot :)
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu of all the cocktails!! Happy hour Monday-Friday

O4L-rWJa-lFb2Gaw8szSlQ.text: We've visited here almost every time we're in Arizona for Spring Training. We first found it as a beer destination and then we fell in love with their patio. This year we decided to try the food. It's very good - but we were toward the end of our vacation and on beer and food overload, so it seemed just meh. We will always stop as a beer destination - so next time, we will stop here toward the beginning of our trip. Hope to update this to a 5 star after our next visit .... when my stomach is cooperating :)

8yEUsvuEeGBjn-phRjRLNQ.text: Awesome place for happy hour! Great food, great drinks, great service, great prices, and all around fantastic atmosphere! Love the cheese dip and soft pretzels! The spicy hummus is awesome too. If you're in the Arcadia area, make sure to stop in for a quick bite, you won't regret it!

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Peach ale! So refreshing!

q94ZMjXpbOuRA0HZCAdJ5A.text: My favorite brunch place! Great outside patio. I love the atmosphere & the friendly staff. Best part- dog friendly!

vC_Z6u6LFkNeFBFDEMObDQ.text: review to follow does not indicate dissatisfaction with OHSO. i still love the place, the beers, the patio, the location, the food. service on this occasion was far, far from expectations at OHSO.   work happy hour. arrived with only a few minutes left. the waitress says, "ok guys, last call for happy hour, what'll you have" and then walked off. so we grabbed another server who seemed to be helping our previously arrived friends. the first waitress comes over and shoo's him off, asks again what we'd like and again, starts to walk off! what...???? we quickly call back for her and shout out our orders. the remainder of our experience that evening, she seemed frustrated with us and put out...never smiling once...which is unusual considering the stellar service we normally get. i understand she was trying to get last happy hour orders in, but all we needed was 5 seconds for her to write our drink orders.   anyway, a one time fluke i think. of course we'll go back!

o9TyWg-VwZNWHBvUcsgMFg.text: We came in after a long week of work thirsty for a beer. Well we were lucky enough to sit next to Josh, one of the brew masters. Josh made us feel like kings sitting in our barstool thrones. He even went out back and brought us a sample of the prickly pair beer straight out of the barrel. It was truly a unique experience to try this beer especially when they went out to the dessert and picked the prickly pears themselves.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yup :)

YB5dAqMAYpyNwnXCQsHr5Q.text: It's my new favorite place in Arizona.  I love the bicycle part decor and the super dog friendly patio.  O.S.H.O. is awesome not just for the good food, but also they have dog treats and dog bowls for water.    Now to the awesome food.  Their Mac Del Mar is soooo good.  Melty cheese and juicy  shrimp and bacon is a fantastic combo, though the crab could have been chunkier.  Their bbq burger is juicy with the best burger bun Ive had.  The  bun is fresh, fluffy, and tasty.  Their other dishes I've tried are good too, but these two dishes are the most memorable. And of course the drinks are yummy.  I'm not a big fan of beer, but their pumpkin and apple ciders are sweet and light.

EsC71A8OdbQqXIUrcFhJtA.text: Overpriced and underwhelming.  Not worth the wait for dinner.  Nothing has ever been particularly good.  Hot food is always lukewarm. I only visit when work is picking up the tab.

lHfbR8C7GBDg5c2sttaQhA.text: This is by far my favorite bar!  the back patio is where you want to sit. Great atmosphere, large beer selection, and great for winos like myself too!  I love coming here for weekend day drinking the best.  It gets very busy so often the tables are all taken but if you give it 5 minutes normally a table will open up.  Great food too. I love the white bean dip as an appetizer. And the veggie flatbread is probably my favorite meal there. I always take any visiting friends and family here! And always my pooch :)  This is a great place for people who love riding bicycles to the bar and/or have dogs!  They have free u-locks to borrow for your bike and it backs up to the canal so great for biking to and from. They also have water dishes for your dog, as well as homemade dog treats.  There's hooks to connect your leash to. Really awesome bar!!

MyPGALPZljPQsCb37i8mXQ.text: This place has the best patio in Phoenix. The view is spectacular and the beer selection is awesome. They are constantly updating the selection so it is always different. I love being able to take my dogs with me, or stop after a bike ride on the canal.  The servers are great really they can get the large crowds served in good time, some other places you could die of thirst when they get busy. I think their menu is the weak part, a few dishes are excellent like the pastrami and short ribs. They are lacking on good salads their choices are not as imaginative as their beer menu. If they upgrade the menu a little this becomes an even better place.

Z5uVcBYzjKJCV_Ek143V7Q.text: I love OHSO for it's laid back atmosphere and amazing patio. It's close enough for me that we can bike there, and they have plenty of bike racks plus tools to help with small bike repairs, and even locks. Their patio is also very dog friendly, complete with water bowls and dog treats made from the spent grain from brewing some amazing beer.   Their beer list always features their beers along with other local beers that are rotating on tap - I've always found something to enjoy to drink (even for brunch - how about a cold brew coffee beer?).   I enjoy their food but I've been so much that I kind of wish they would update their menu with a few new items. My favorite stand-bys are the veggie burger and the fish tacos. You can also substitute any of their regular burgers with the veggie burger or the turkey burger, and they are both delicious. Their fries are good, their brunch is good, their BBQ is good, basically everything is good.

Wrq-fxDKmJASnZaRmV2hkw.text: The food was decent - probably slightly above average bar food.  Service was good but we were extremely disappointed the host never asked us/told us about the patio.  My husband noticed it after we had eaten & he was looking for the restroom.  We ended up going to the patio for an additional drink - but still were very disappointed that it was never mentioned when we arrived.  It was a Friday for lunch - not that busy at all - so capacity wasn't an issue.   I'd probably come back & definitely recommend the back patio.

i2w_98v_8tPjIU-e4UwggQ.text: Came here from out of town on a business meeting/dinner. Food is pretty standard fare with an emphasis on their craft brews. We had the calamari and cheese board apps and both were tasty enough. For my entree I went with the surf & turf which I'll admit I expected to be more of a standard steak with shrimps but was surprised to find it's more of a steak and shrimp melee, but no complaints it was actually quite flavorful with a nice kick to it. So, all in all, no complaints on the food which to me is most important. Our server was good and responsive and the ambience was good although music is definitely on the louder side so it's advised to take the patio or front seats.

LNSwxs_E4927TYq7qm4FEA.text: Went there today and sat at a table that was reserved in about an hour and ten min from when we got there. The first thing the waiter said was "you know you only have an hour right". Very rude first impression. He barely talked to us the whole time. I ordered a cheese burger medium cooked and it came out cooked fine but there was an inch long gross red bloody spot on the bottom bun that was soggy. I'll post a pic if I can. Told him they shouldn't serve food like that and he said ok as he walked away and never said sorry or anything. I will never go back.

l88aiHCdd6lRcRKpCNDCcg.text: My boyfriend and I came here this past Friday night for dinner as we had both drive by the place quite often and have been wanting to try it out.   The service was great and I liked the wide open space. We tried two different beer samples for a $1 each and settled on splitting a pitcher of Levitation which we both enjoyed.  We ordered the green chile dip appetizer. I ordered the shrimp tacos and my boyfriend ordered the brisket. He LOVED the brisket and after taking a bite of it, I could see why. It was quite good. My shrimp tacos however, were so bland that I barely ate half of my meal. And it was a "small plate." I wasn't the biggest fan of our appetizer but after tasting my dinner, I decided I liked the dip a lot more and finished it off. Definitely do not recommend the shrimp tacos.  One annoying thing was our meals came out right after our appetizer. A little time in between would have been good - but I'll take that over slow service any day.   I'm giving this place four stars because of how great the brisket was and despite not liking my dish, I had a great time and think this place has lots of potential. I'll be back to try something else!

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. beer sampler

1Syr4o7mwmncyevGTs1bpw.text: Came here for a brunch Saturday morning after a Crossfit competition in Scottsdale. Downside? Obviously it was a bit impromptu on the brunch so we did not call ahead to reserve seating, and being there was 12+ of us, figured there would be a bit of a wait.  Ended up sitting the patio (a bit hot, as this was during summer), and the downside was that none of the tables are able to move together. Did not mind sitting outside, nice shady umbrellas and misters, but having the group broken up on multiple different tables was a bit disappointing.   Ordered waffles and mimosa, both were very tasty. Did not hear any complaints from any of my fellow crossfitters either!! (And they can be picky! Everyone seemed to enjoy it). On the flipside it was not terribly expensive, a decent price for a decent meal.   I enjoyed the atmosphere, and being dog friendly rules!! I plan on taking my furbaby here for a return visit sometime in the next month or two. Can't wait. Hope the food and drinks are just as good on my return!

Q4GAMOUqjQyY8-NP2eno7w.text: Our first time there with our two pups. the environment was warm and welcoming, and our pups loved the other pups. They also loved the homemade treats. We sat in the "backyard" and are thankful for the water bowls and water. We ordered the avocado bread, and biscuits and gravy. We recommend both, but what fell short was the temperature of the biscuits and gravy, Luke warm, so my boyfriend couldn't finish them. We also waited for ten minutes for a beer. We loved it but just wish the food came out when it was ready rather than sit and wait to be delivered!

n0k55ZFufh-hbCzcxIlwPA.text: Pros: Awesome selection of beers several of which are local. (I know; that's sort of a duh because it's a nanoBrewery). The food is really good, especially their flatbreads, and the staff is friendly and efficient. You can have your dog on the patio and they have treats and water for dogs which is fun. Overall, it's a good atmosphere and an awesome place to bring out of towners to show them a cool local spot. The other patrons are always nice and interesting as well. In fact, pretty much every time I've gone here one of us girls walks away with a date! Good to know for all of you single folks!   Cons: Parking kind of sucks. They do have free Valet but of course you still have to tip. It's not that big of a deal because they do have an ATM inside (which does charge a ridiculously high interest rate for withdrawals of course!) but still, something to keep in mind. Also, I feel like every single time I go there one of the toilets is clogged. Again, not that big of a deal but a pain nonetheless. And lastly, yes, it's fun that dogs are allowed on the patio and granted I know this is out of the restaurant's control so I didn't let it factor my rating, but some of the people that bring their dogs here are really stupid and ironically not what I would call "dog people." In other words, it's hard to relax because you're constantly trying to keep your dog under control but also other people's dogs at bay as well. Not a good time in my book.

jgpZXH8EwS9fH-nXSIfZTA.text: My wife and my three boys took me to O.H.S.O. for a pre-Father's Day dinner, to avoid the crowds on Father's Day.  This place is never disappointing, always with good food, and good beer.  I've been here on many occasions prior to Father's Day weekend so I can attest to the consistency of O.H.S.O. as far as food, beer and service.  Located right off of a major canal in Phoenix, O.H.S.O. is easily accessible by bicycle...and many cyclists do frequent.  Another unique feature is the dog friendly patio, out back.  On any given afternoon, you will find the patio occupied by K9's and their companions....there are even complimentary homemade treats for the quadrupeds made from spent grains from the brewing process.  Oh, and if you have the inclination to brew your own O.H.S.O. offers a program where just about anybody can come in and brew, using their equipment and facilities for storage while your beer conditions for a couple weeks.  If you like beer...real beer.....good craft beer brewed locally, O.H.S.O. is your place!

-2qwTyYZCuXKYuftBzUN_Q.text: This is a fun place. All the action is happening on the patio outback. You get to bring your dogs! this is good if you like dogs. The atmosphere is one of the key highlights. The back patio is lined with bicycles which also act as fans. The Decour is also one of the highlights. I had the breakfast bowl for brunch. The brunches are tasty and priced right. For $10 you gets a breakfast entree and a 10 ounce beer or a Mimosa.  My breakfast bowl was a little on the dry side, I should've asked for more salsa which was my fault that I didn't ask. Otherwise I rate this place a five for great food and great atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carnitas breakfast bowl.

_Zxjf7eaCSgN1tmg3LigAQ.text: Friends and I visited this place for the first time. It was different and trendy which we appreciated. The back patio is dog friendly - they have watering stations and treats for the dogs. They offer a nice variety of beers on tap. The food wasn't anything fantastic but it isn't your traditional bar food either, it's a step up. A little pricey but cute place to  hang out with friends and  your furry friends.

UgDhmMzjSS2585G91Zriqg.text: Came here for a late night snack and some beers.  Outstanding beer list with tons of choices.  Food was surprisingly delicious.  We got the Thai peanut hummus.  Very tasty, but if you're not big on spicy food, ask to leave the sriracha on the side.  The steak and fries were delicious too.  Try them "smothered" style!  Service was quick and friendly.  Would love to try O.H.S.O. during nice weather when they open the bar up to the patio!

WCK8CV7j-GEXid4Q1N3eDA.text: Still a fan because I love the beer selection, and the venue. But, I want to update because the gnocchi has gotten a little chef-boy-ardee-ish. Not inedible but not as impressive as it once was...  so, I guess, I retract my love for the gnocchi but there's still a lot to love about this place!

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Neat patio! Heavily misted which helps with the heat.

Q6oeV3UtxpldnemqpYwoFA.text: Went here on a recent Sunday to celebrate a friends birthday brunch. We had two large tables outside for our group which was nice. I do love the dog friendly patio even though we left our two at home (oh well, next time they will join us). It wasn't to bad sitting outside since they had the misters on but you do fell pretty "damp" all over which is better than being hot.   I really liked their brunch menu! You could select a beer or mimosa and an entree for $10. I had a mimosa and green chilie pork breakfast burrito. The mimosa was good and so was the food. The only think I didn't care for was that the only green chilie pork was just a tad that topped the top of the breakfast burrito. Oh well...it was still pretty tasty.  One draw back was how LOUD it got when the World Cup Finals were playing. The volume on the TV was a bit much where I just stopped talking to people in my group because I was yelling so they could hear me and that was frustrating.   I will be back with the dogs but not during sporting events that is for sure.  Service was great this day as in the past it hasn't been the best.

CUakNrzDRrWJ9RFcQX29fQ.text: I bring all my dates here! LOL. You cant go wrong with amazing beers to woo the boys, and for us ladies, they have the best mimosas, sangrias, and cocktails! I love the Arcadia and the 48th St Fizz. Flatbread pizzas are amazing and you cant go wrong with the classic Burger & Cheese!   The staff is amazing, very knowledgaeblw of all the beers and give great suggestions. But what I love the most is the back patio! Might be too hot in the summer, but for 9 months out of the year, it is the place to be! Bring your dog, your bike, and your date- for a night of great suds and grubs!

mAxCUb_cBvOyomJ_zSBQCA.text: Beer for breakfast? Yes please!  I love O.H.S.O. for many reasons- their phenomenal beer selection, the tasty menu, the patio, the free dog biscuits I snag for the pooch- but their beer brunch is the reason I get up most Sunday mornings. For the bargain price of $10, you can enjoy one of several breakfast entrees and an Arizona beer. I'm a huge fan of the green chili pork and the biscuits and beer gravy. They have a great happy hour too with several $3 appetizers and $5 pitchers of Arizona beers.  The only thing I don't love about O.H.S.O. is the parking. It's practically non-existent, but they do have valet.

4ulZaPRNbtRdMwVTTv_cZw.text: Beer with brunch?  Yes, Beer Brunch on the weekends at O.H.S.O.! I've been here a few times this past year.  A few weeks ago, I decided to go and try their Beer Brunch, only $10 with a beer.  Yes, beer before noon but hey it is a BEER Brunch.  Nobody will judge you there!  The beer biscuits and gravy was awesome! Huge pieces of sausage in the gravy.  The biscuits were moist and buttery.  The gravy had a kick to it for sure but went really well with the beer.  I had ordered the Raspberry Wheat to go with the dish.  Loved it!  The dish came with two pieces of crispy bacon and a bowl of fruit.  I ordered coffee as well.  And the refills kept coming for the coffee.  Service was good..friendly and always coming by asking you were ok and needed anything else.   For only $10 it's a great place for a weekend brunch with friends or by yourself!

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States

LLxIqncP_CdIH2Lbr-rBUg.text: In Phoenix visiting my brother, I looked up breweries in the area since I always try and drink local beer (I am from San Diego, best beer in the world) I found this place on yelp and decided to give it a try.  I really didn't enjoy the beers that were brewed in the  building. I had tried tasters of everything, I mean everything!! But, it seems their list is always changing.   I absolutely did love the patio they had. So so cool. Very dog friendly. Great food. Excellent service. And loved the beers that were not brewed in the house brewery! (Mr. Pineapple, peach ale)  Make sure you grab the free home-made dog treats on the way out!  I will definitely come back and try some new beers!

7RUOjqc-hnBdXTaZl8JetA.text: I love OHSO! Amazing food, amazing people, great location and a True love of dogs! With all that they would get five stars. I deducted a star because we came for game day Sunday and they don't have the ticket or enough Tv's. Add that to the ambience and they have a new game day hot spot.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brunch Menu!
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States

w_g3TtlrPAXYEVzzUOceEQ.text: No review needed. If you have fur baby (dog) and love good food, plain and simple. COME TO O.H.S.O.

iF0mZ7oAjXsB_IrB0NKNkQ.text: Food here is excellent! The Diablo burger was fantastic!!! The beer is above average as well and the place is nice. Reasonably priced too so you won't be let down. We tried and rated all the beers on tap on a large sampler. Fun times!

URr5Q6nfVHXF0s9HJLQFUw.text: Best dog friendly patio! Great little $3 happy hour noshes, $6 any wine, $5 brewskis- gotta dog? Check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Another happy hour happy dog!
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Jennifer &amp; Hydro &amp; Layla
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The dog friendly back patio on a gorgeous Friday!

eULm1RNVMQynwUXeSmgo0w.text: I just can't get enough of this place. Every time I come it gets better and better.   This last time I went on a IPA frenzy. Dragoon IPA 7.3 abv slightly bitter with a wonderful aroma Good Vibrations 7.2 abv citrous hop notes with a caramel taste. OSHO IPA also tried a couple of 2oz tasters for a buck or two  Appetizer; Shrimp ceviche was surprisingly delicious. Plenty of juices, a good lemon/tomato balance and plenty of chips.  Dinner: I want to come back not just for the beer but the AZ Burger. The combination of cream cheese/poblano aioli is mouthwatering. The only thing I didn't like was not enough fries  love them thin and crispy.

n3qBLAlhNXikSyLVwdcr4A.text: Great double date place that allowed us to bring our dogs to sit at the table outside with us. Although it took a long time to get a table, the beer made up for it. As well as the BBQ chicken. The Sunday special will have me coming back for only the chicken and cornbread.  Downside was the service, and when we were advertised the BBQ buffet, we ordered seconds and got "the last of it,so enjoy". And no chicken.  Good atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My dog, begging for more treats

I3qsCf9ZmW17EiCjC6fR8A.text: One of the few good places that allow dogs. The negative- the parking Is horrendous and the outdoor patio where dogs are allowed is completely full of pretentious a-holes who could sit anywhere in restaurant but chose to sit at the 6 tables dogs are allowed at and sip on their waters for 2 hours while half of the table are reserved for other larger parties.  The positive- the food, the staff, and the beer selection are truly fantastic, but these terrible patrons sit there staring at you with your dog and and your 2 year old child as they continue to waist oxygen on this earth.  And before you think I'm some 45 year old bitter woman, you should know that I'm 24 single dad how loves to try new places, but after trying this place 3 desperate times I'll never be going back again.

6PLtG16Y8onPksFIOk9sIg.text: In July my husband and I went to the North Scottsdale location and w were very disappointed but decided to return but to the Indian School location. What an improvement on the beer choices and the menu. Great beer and terrific food. My husband and I shared pork  tacos which were very good but the seafood mac and cheese was fabulous! Very cheesy with lots of very large shrimp, My mom came with us and she had the pastrami sandwich and she loved it, she couldn't believe how lean the meat was. We finished off with the caramel apple pie which is to die for. It is a must have! We had great service, the place is very clean and of course dog friendly and our dog loves the complimentary dog treats. We will be back.

gU4J-cGYCB1hIVJuz-LYHg.text: This place is amazing. It's a beautiful Saturday morning or sitting out here having a wonderful breakfast dogs next to us and it's packed in here.  Did I mention that they have really good mimosas?

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegi flatbread.

x93h0NbSto_z_43-ylAbBA.text: Great environment to hang with your friends and with your furry friends too in the back pet friendly patio bar! Would recommend a nice cool Moscow mule and also their AZ Burger!! Hands down a great burger! If you are looking for something healthier I would also recommend the surf n' turf!

fM4NAbsbOVrUTei4J3AsLQ.text: We stopped in for lunch during a weekday.    The beer we tried was a light pale ale with was refreshing on a hot day.    We both had a barbecue burger.  The burger was done as requested.  All the ingredients were fresh including the jalapenos I had added to my burger.    The service was friendly and relaxed.  Budget more than hour for lunch if you are visiting during a weekday.    I look forward to returning and trying the spectrum of freshly brewed beers they offer.

k72Clunwtge835mLQ8gfFA.text: Went here with my mum and a friend for brunch since its pet friendly and our friend has 2 mini huskies. We got some hummus and waffles and eggs, bacon, and toast and the diced potatoes and toast are just ok but the waffles were AMAZING. The servers are nice and attentive, and I think it's cool that each table has some biscuits for pets. I think the only thing I particularly didn't like was the music above us blasting out a song with the f bomb as we started sitting down. I mean don't get me wrong I curse but it's not exactly what I want to hear eating breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States

oCekY-GGPmtbGTEJ09xmug.text: I like this place as a bar, but I haven't been impressed with any of the food I've tried here....  Will probably skip this place if I'm hungry

LXi9IOi4Bc-LB_Fc5rJNPA.text: Just had brunch here. Food was ok, but my girlfriend ordered a cocktail and the waiter never brought it out. This was towards the end of our meal so after he came back by we let him know the drink never came out, but instead of going to get it and bringing it out he asked her if she still wanted it. Of course she still wanted it, why would we have ordered it in the first place if we didn't service. Sadly, it almost feels as though he was trained to respond this way to a forgotten order rather than to accept the responsibility of the mistake.

4UJvhgrFm3afVlUb7NM8kw.text: 7/28/12  Met with a few friends who'd already started drinking during happy hour (read 530p) and finished dinner before I arrived around 840p.  Serendipitously found a great parking spot across the front entrance.  I knew I wouldn't enjoy my stay here when I was hit by such loud chattering as soon as I opened the front door.  That and the scent of rancid beer that greeted me were enough to make me want to bolt, but I'd already let my friends know I'd arrived via text and Yelp check-in.  Found my friends at a four-top, sat down, and proceeded to shout hellos- strike three!  I REALLY dislike having to shout to a person who's sitting/standing right beside me to be heard.  What's even worse is having to nuzzle my ear to their mouth to understand what they're saying...  Really made me wish I was at mellow Four Peaks, already sipping on a cold pint of Peach ale and waiting on dinner to arrive.  I sat at that table for twenty minutes watching at least three different servers pass by without stopping to ask if I needed anything.  Thank goodness I brought my bottle of water with me, or I would've been really annoyed, because not only were my head and ears aching from the noise, but I was also hungry AND very thirsty, as well!  It was only around the 30-minute mark, while I and two other friends were standing by a landing of stairs did a server stop and ask if I had been helped.  By that time, I'd already made up my mind to leave and was already saying goodbye to my friends.  Too bad I couldn't get any love... 3 oz beer samplers are $1 or $2 (those designated with a plus sign).  Would've been a fun way to taste my way through the menu while checking out just how well the servers know the beers they offer- I'm a newbie to the world of beers, but I already know I don't like a lot of hops.  Pints are $5 each (boo!), but $9 per pitcher (awesome!), and that's not even happy hour prices!  A pint of local brewery Four Peaks is $5- what?  I expected to see a lot of O.H.S.O. brewery beers, but I only spotted TWO.  But I shouldn't have even bothered to study all of this since I never received service!

yMNfbysXUUuAnX4TQnxcRA.text: Friendly service, I love the different beers and going there after a running event. My dog lives the homemade dog biscuits.

A9E_4ewVNenATRsB5wi9bg.text: This place has it all.  Environment, layout, huge patio, great beer selection and food to match.  I recently found out you can also craft your own beer here with the OHSO brewmaster.  Great spot for happy hour, lunch or dinner.

lq7lWB4ab4YEaYTP2NYNbw.text: Not so much too loud food is fried menu not that great for people who enjoy a healthy diet like me I'm not impressed better places to go also the mandatory valet parking is a bit too much  Try if you want I just think there is better places out there

6DlioiYoPQ_8f24HFSWu9Q.text: I really like any place that allows me to take my dog, the fact that they have a "bark bar" with water bowls and treats makes me love it even more!  The outside is really nice, right next to the canal with easy access to walk the pup dogs. They even have an outside wash area for when you need to wash your hands and can't go inside since you got your animal friend with you.  Bartenders are really awesome, I have yet to find one that is unfriendly. Love the 3 oz samples for only $1. The OHSO salad with chicken was good, pretzels were good, yucca chips with dip (it's guacamole. Which I thought was a little weird that they said dip instead of guacamole) was really good. Something different from corn chips.  I love that they started serving up growlers! I absolutly love that I can go less then 2 miles and get a growler filled with yummy Four Peaks and Oak Creek or any one of there tap selections. I can't wait to try out their brew once it's done!  The fact that it is just a bike ride away makes me wish the cooler days would come even quicker!  I definitely recommend everyone try this place out! You just might see me there ;)

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States

hjnI7gSQXTP2qP4XN6bPRA.text: Great sweet potato fries and amazing artichoke dip! I love the dog friendly patio and staff.  But my favorite part is all the games on the patio!

iLM2N4aUPRhlYUnUEU6rTQ.text: Love bringing the puppies here! They enjoy seeing all of the other dogs and people - and getting their complimentary dog biscuit packs!

Db8eY9pxRbFUi0Y9-bWEpw.text: The beer is good. If you order a burger medium, be prepared to send it back. It may very well be rare. No big deal, but if if you don't have a lot of time and everyone else already has their food, it's kind of a hassle.

peTsVFoUpWtb5N1SXGFIDA.text: This place has a great patio PLUS a great selection of microbrews.  I loved the setup of this place- great front and back patio-dog friendly too.  The back patio setup is awesome.  Great view of Camelback Mountain and the bicycle wall with the tires that are fans is super cool!  We came on Father's Day and for their BBQ Sunday special and we were not disappointed.  The special was great, huge portions.  The staff was very friendly and attentive.  Our waitress gave great recommendations and did not steer us wrong. Can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States

h2qojwbMGOo-hJ1VYm2Zxw.text: My man and I, Steve have been going to OHSO about 4 yrs now and have always had pretty good food, and service. However,  tonight was a complete waste of time, and money. Had a waiter that we have not seen before named JUSTIN...  JUSTIN was a bummer as a our first interaction. We ordered drinks, not a problem,  order food, another story... Like I said we've been going for the last 4 yrs, so we've ordered a lot of food never had any problems with ordering to our liking, and not like we order anything too crazy,  nor are we difficult...But here's  how it is when Justin's taking   your order..... ME: I'll have the Turkey burger- No Pear Compote. But can you please put the Green Chili cheese sauce on it instead  ( this is the sauce from another burger). JUSTIN: OH NO I DON'T THINK SO. OUR KITCHEN DOESN'T LIKE IT IF YOU DON'T ORDER STRAIGHT  OFF THE MENU THE WAY YOU SEE ON THE MENU. IT UPSETS OUR KITCHEN STAFF...LMAO... JUSTIN: I'll have to go ask the kitchen if you can have a different sauce on your burger. ME: NEVERMIND! I don't want to UPSET the staff.  JUSTIN: OK GREAT.  ME: I'll have the Salmon Bacon burger instead  with NO Lemon Aoli sauce, and sliced onion.  ME: IS THIS OKAY, OR DO YOU NEED TO CHECK WITH KITCHEN?  LMAO...  JUSTIN: OH NO THIS WILL BE FINE..  JUSTIN : Puts order in, leaves. Now we are sitting and waiting for another drink. JUSTIN : Comes by 10 minutes  later, looks, Sees I need a drink- walks by, NOTHING.  JUSTIN: Comes by again sits kitchep on table, looks at empty drink- NOTHING! WALKS AWAY. We wait longer still no drink! We move to bar hoping for better service. Get drinks, food is served about 30 minutes later after moving up to bar. Waited at least 45 mins or more for food. Food is served, fries are cold, Salmon burger TERRIBLE.. NO BACON, NO ONION. Had to ask for the bacon- hence SALMON BACON BURGER( how do you forget half of the ingredient) lol. I did not even bother to ask for onion. Cost of burger $14.00. Sorry I ordered it.OVER PRICED FOR WHAT IT WAS!  I had to add a large amount of salt before it had any flavor. BOO! We also ordered a salad, added steak to it which was good, but $16.00  which seemed a lot for what was not that large of a salad, nor was there much of anything on it, but did have good flavor.  BTW JUSTIN- YOU WAS JUST TO LAZY TO TAKE THE TIME AND INPUT SOMETHING DIFFERENT THEN WHAT WAS ON THE MENU. IT MUST HAVE BEEN DIFFICULT TO DO. I UNDERSTAND ; -)  Order dessert- Add one extra small scoop of ice cream $3.00 extra...   Total bill: $90.05 plus tip. Was not worth it. FYI: BLOODY MARY WITH HOUSE VODKA-$.11.00..BOO! Was basically a glass of V-8 had to order Vodka on the rocks to add to it- Another $9.00 BOO! BLOODY MARY $$20.00 if you want to add a taste of Vodka...lmao... We would have rather spent that money at  Eddie V's Happy Hour. Better service, better food. JUSTIN YOU SUCK!  OHSO was not on point tonight.

VyKNy4bxU3X5wTnEMJ8KrQ.text: This was probably the only place that was still opened late into the evening (9/4/2016) when we stopped by. It seems like a good place to hangout--people seemed to be enjoying their evening in the outdoor patio. However, I didn't feel the vibe. We had a few different wait staff waiting on us. I was disappointed with the arcadia so I had to order an extra shot, which was even more disappointing since it was $7 and less than half of a shot. We made our visit short and left.

_cPDToXtsUjC7befmINGfw.text: We sat outside on the patio.  What a great day! The food was fresh and delicious!  We had a large group and had a blast for brunch!  Great place! !

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast bowl was amazing.
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The mimosas are Hugh and great!

82RRXm5vTIpnpoXp5JAuYA.text: Fun place I go often. They don't have any beer that I love and sometime the staff seems less than happy to help us but I will keep coming back for the environment and the food.

KF5QaG7dlHnYFdfYCA4TLQ.text: It was my first time at OHSO on Sunday around 3pm.  They ran out of brisket the day before so I didn't go for their bottomless bbq special. I ordered the Hot Pastrami sandwich with fries. It was a good sandwich. Nice bun, toppings, and quality pastrami. But I was very disappointed with the fries. I think they use the same supplier as Burger King.   My girlfriend and I shared a pitcher of mimosas, so unfortunately I didn't try one of their nanobrews.  The bathroom could have use some attention on our visit.   Otherwise it was a fun and relaxed ambience, and a upscale casual dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hot Pastrami sandwich and fries.

y-StdpPYh7CBxmiOF97Ylg.text: Went here again for the Sunday $15 All-You-Can-Eat BBQ Special from 3pm-7pm. Let me tell you it was NOT that special... Ribs were over cooked and dry, like chewing on beef jerky. The brisket is pulled & had a vinegar awful sauce. It's placed on a slice of white bread. The chicken leg & thigh had that same awful sauce. The cornbread though was excellent. Potato salad & coleslaw were alright. Our waiter was friendly & the service was good.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pulled brisket on white bread &amp; dry ribs.
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BBQ plate

YdISzzWXJdQRgoi4InEv9g.text: Came here to check out the dog friendly patio and the homemade dog treats. It's a really chill environment to get some beers, we decided to try out the pepper salad which was on the happy hour menu, it was extremely small portions for the cost of the dish.  Yet, they have an awesome rotating beer list and great deals on pitchers. The fact that they have an assisting brewer course that you can sign up for is pretty cool, and the service there is great. I would love to come back and get some entree to test out more of the food.  Also riding our bikes down there since it's near the canal route and they supply you with bike locks too!

l-2htMD0iVwKAnnW0nsVKg.text: This wasn't really what we were looking for as far as brunch, however, the drinks were ok and my friend said her food was good. The staff was super friendly. My experience was very low key, a couple of drinks then left. The place is super casual. Cute and clean inside. I would totally try this place again.

2sRrM8ypXHnKmvpDJ_L1Ug.text: OH-EM-GEE! Not only was the food excellent, but you can bring your dog(s)!!! Great atmosphere. Not too long of a wait to sit, but too long of a wait for the food. We figured they were trying to work the bar-drinks angle... and unfortunately we were drinking water. Doesn't matter. I'd go back in heartbeat!

x6m-rXT4E3qugcwoTezA3g.text: Friendly service, good food, and great drinks and beer. Very very dog friendly patio as well. The grilled cheese and del mar Mac are my personal favorites. It's a calmer more quiet environment during the day, and at night it's a great place to come hang out and grab drinks.

afrbPW0_g8I9BP0HNS1ZXA.text: A fun local establishment that has a dog friendly patio. Busy weekend brunch makes for a vibrant environment. The beers are good and yes it is ok to have one for breakfast. The Grovey goes well the the French Toast.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. OHSO French Toast.

ITTq8A8EG-FHcfKgBD7FYw.text: I really liked O.H.S.O.  My friend and I came in on a Monday for lunch, and had our pick of the patio.  Pitchers of beer were half off, and they have a great selection of local and non-local brews.  Our server was incredibly attentive.  We split the green chile dip to start, and it was awesome.  We literally devoured it to the last drop.  The housemade veggie burger was good as well, and didn't fall apart which is a complaint I have about most veggie burgers.    All, in all a great place.  Nice patio and good beer and food? A new Phoenix favorite.

YViGUdgI9zpuGk1PTlOBlQ.text: This place is quickly becoming our favorite bar. Been here 3 times so far and every time I keep finding something awesome about this place that makes me love it more.   1. It's right off the canal and 48th bike trails so easy to get to from Old Town and Arcadia on bike.  2. They have a nice 'backyard style' patio that you can bike upto, they have locks you can borrow and they have awesome bike decor all around that is also functional (bike wheels that are actually fans, bike chains that make up some lighting).  3. It's a dog friendly patio (I counted 15 dogs last time!)  4. Great crowd and beers!  Never ate inside yet but the patio is the place to be, awesome views of Camelback, great people and dog watching and on Sundays you can enjoy their all you can eat BBQ for $15 (and it's a lot of food!).   They have a lot of my favorite beers on tap including an Orange Blossom beer by the folks at Papago Brewery.  Pricing is great on draft beers and I felt like for the experience and delicious food we ate the pricing is spot on.   Go check it out and send me a message on what you thought of it because I think there needs to be more places like this around Central Phoenix!

2vjiIMufYeMqPNSd0EPDWg.text: 7 years strong, I religiously drive down Indian School past the German Sausage Co. Recently, I started seeing some activity going on...and then one day - BAM!! A sign pops up: O.H.S.O. Eatery + nanoBrewery .  I couldn't wait to try it out, and knowing it opened just TO-DAY...I jumped at the opportunity.  5 stars might be a bit pretentious, but I'm giving them an A for effort and 5 stars because honestly, I'd leave my office late....night after night ...after night....and would see these guys STILL working at 2 and 3am...just to get the place open. It's apparent there is some serious sweat equity, late nights and blue collar effort to get this place going. I highly respect this and give them props.  Not to mention, I love the simplicity of the place. Yet, I can see it being the new, semi-non-trendy place to hang out. I know I'll be making it a recent stop. Rumor has it...they'll be renting out bikes (check them out as you walk in) and they offer mini-pitchers for $5 before 5 with tons of local beers on tap. It's nothing fancy, frilly or Scottsdale...it's casual and comfortable. My kinda place.  So let's get down to business: Beers on Tap....they carry one of my girly favorites the White Chocolate Ale but this time I went for the Count Hopula and Nut Brown. Both great! The O.H.S.O. Amber was really good as well. Girls who might not be big beer fans might be a fan of the O.H.S.O. Raspberry Wheat although it was a bit light for my palette.  Had some small bites, including the Brewers' Choice which was a mixture of your choice of 2 meats and 2 cheeses, accompanied by caramel popcorn, roasted nuts, bread & butter pickles, a homemade fruit roll up, cheddar crackers and fresh Italian bread. There was also a date/goat cheese butter that rocked and another assortment of roasted veggie/fruit relish. Great starter platter for sure. All the bread is made in-house! The Sharp Cheddar was awesome...the Red Dragon was basically a Mustard Seed cheese (don't choose this option if you hate whole grain mustard :) ) They have rotating meats but on the menu today was a Colorado Elk Sausage....AMAZING! Loved it.  We also added the Crispy Calamari + Spicy Seared Ahi to our assortment. It was great with a citrus zest. Although next time, I need to try the marinated skirt steak.  All in all, I believe this place will be an OH-SO great addition to the neighborhood.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Some serious rides out front...for rent?? Hmm...
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The cleanest row of beers on tap I&#39;ve ever seen.
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Interior

bDKbp15ty287YoH2snFlCQ.text: A word of advice - don't set inside. Stay by the bar area or in the front or back patio. The inside setting has zero insulation (i.e. Carpets or sound blocking material) Two people can barely hear each other YELL! I'm not kidding either...  But I love the atmosphere there and the beer is really good. I just know where not to set....

trjYS896dUGhpCcg4Pp7cQ.text: Under very rare circumstances I visit Phoenix. However, if the weather isn't too unbearable, I thoroughly enjoy eating and drinking on the patio. I have been incredibly blessed continually having Athena as my server. Not only is she well versed in the food and drink items, she explains the dishes with such enthusiastic detail that my mouth is fervently awaiting the first bite. Luckily, the service is quite quick, even on a busy night. Dogs are allowed on the patio making the experience even more catered to my favorite things; cute animals, good food and drinks.

ZqtYw0aeYEtciede1FJSsw.text: We loved their beer so much I almost didn't try anything off the distillery menu, but the cocktail I had with cucumber vodka, basil, and lime was also amazing. The food was really good too. This will be a must visit if we're ever in the area again!

t3LSCH7gldT2wlN_BI0qQQ.text: My favorite part of OHSO is how bike and dog friendly it is. I love the access from the canal and especially the complimentary tools available for fixing minor problems you may have with your bike. I love the area for the dogs for water and treats and the tie ups at the tables for leashes. The sangria is my absolute favorite but can be dangerous! :) The food is good but my least favorite part.

btQVDrrZhK66Z11MsnTUdQ.text: Went in for late night grub and drinks. Enjoyed the Hummus and deviled egg appetizers. Also enjoyed their Oatmeal Stout. Realized they had one of my favorite vodka brands Deep Eddy. Shared the 2 burgers on the late night menu with my friend. The BBQ one was awesome! Left full and satisfied. Bartender was attentive and i will definitely be going back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crab wontons and siracha humus
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Deviled Egg appetizer with bacon bleu chz and pita

m34MdhVlTxE66NQZ1Lu6tg.text: I was recommended to go to OHSO for brunch from an AZ local.  Driving up, it was very busy so I assumed it was going to be pretty good.  It is a good deal for their $10 beer brunch, where you get a dish from their list and an AZ brew, which always makes me happy.  I was with my girlfriend and we ordered the blue crab dip to start off.  There was hardly any crab in the dip and the chips were very much stale.  So needless to say it wasn't he best start to the meal.  I did however enjoy my mocha java porter that was an OHSO in house brew.  The rest of the meal was not bad, I got the carnitas bowl and my gf got the bratwurst breakfast.  I'm a potato fiend so definitely they were on point, but for the most part nothing was too extraordinary, but not bad.  I would come back for the beer :)  Cheers

3i5_Dr-JOu5t98wS2_7kcg.text: We've been dying to try O.H.S.O. for a while, but had never made it over. We have now been there twice, and it was even better than we expected. They are BEYOND dog friendly, and that's what we were looking for. We have brought our dog twice, and everyone is super friendly, and welcoming!   The last time we visited, there was a dog event going on (what we went for), and despite it being VERY busy, the service was quick and friendly!  The food is VERY good, and I couldn't think of a negative thing to say about the restaurant!   Can't wait for the PV location to open!

no0u54vaawgctHuQPHY3Gg.text: I ordered a Bloody Maria and it was phenomenal.  The ingredients were refreshing and they even put their own house made beef jerkey in it. Mmmm. The Strawberry Spinach salad was good. I've tried other "hot" entrees at OHSO and everything always tastes so amazing.

nyIG4sWfMsbEiWnuWNG5mA.text: Love the dog friendly back patio.  They even had free dog treats.  Service was great. Pretty cool place, a place where I would go hang out if it was closer.  Their own beers sucked.  They only had a couple, hence the name"nano", but what few they had was not good.  Luckily they had many guest beers on tap.  They update their beer menu often, which is a perk.  Now if they can focus on their own brews...  I will try them again, maybe grab a bite to eat next time.  Its a neat place, just go for the guest beers.

K4NEFw66lNcbNYul_29L9g.text: I don't know what all these three-star reviews are about, because OHSO is legitimately awesome. In fact, it's probably my favorite bar in Phoenix! I went for the Pie and Beer event and even though they had run out of pie by the time my friend and I arrived (which sucked even more because I could see other patrons enjoying pie while I waited for a table, and it looked amazing), I was delighted by what I could order, which was 1 Cherpumple beer, 1 Coconut Joe beer (hands down our table's favorite), and 1 Amber Creek. Every beer I had was top-notch. I also ordered the calamari and Ahi Tuna appetizer, which was quite tasty (my friend's friend said it was the best calamari he's had in Phoenix, although I believe that honor goes to Hiro sushi). The burger he ordered though looked amaze-balls.  The beer is definitely the star of the show at OHSO though, which is exactly how it should be.

N93brSDibLfQAv1H9SVPcw.text: I took about a 7 month hiatus from OHSO.  I was dragged back kicking and screaming for a friend's birthday this last Friday.    They have a happy hour which apparently ends at 6pm.  Fine.  We got there around 6:05 and ordered a few pitchers of beer.  I will continue to give them praise for their beer selection.  My beer was very tasty.  Our server came by and asked us if we'd like any appetizers to start with.  I had seen on the happy hour menu that they serve a pretzel cheese fondue type thing. During happy hour (which ends at 6), this app is like $3 or something.  It is now 6:13pm.  I ask if I can have the pretzel cheese fondue thingy....aaaannnd....wait for it...wait for it....our server says NO!   I, of course, assume that there is some sort of miscommunication on my part.  I tell her that I fully recognize that I cannot have the pretzel fondue thingy for the $3 happy hour price.  It's 6:13 after all, and the happy hour ends at 6.  So I ask again.  AGAIN SHE SAYS NO!    Undeterred and extremely desirous of the pretzel fondue thingy, I say, Look, I know I can't get it for $3.  Can't I pay you some exorbitant price and get it?  AGAIN SHE SAYS NO!!!  She says the pretzel fondue thingy is ONLY AVAILABLE DURING HAPPY HOUR.  WHAT?!  She then proceeds to tell me that I can wait until 10pm when Happy Hour starts again and order it.  WHAT?!  THE MICROWAVABLE PRETZEL FONDUE FAIRY IS TAKING A 4 HOUR BREAK OR SOMETHING?!  Ok. Ok. Ok.  I get that sometimes you can't order the thing you want.  I get it.  Breakfast at 10pm when you're not at a Denny's? Fine. I understand.  BUT THIS IS A PRETZEL!  A pretzel that was available 13 minutes ago and will be available in another 3 hours and 47 minutes!!!  Crestfallen, I ordered some pesto hummus, a cheese burger, and a couple more pitchers of beer.  All were perfectly fine.  But all I really wanted was my pretzel cheese fondue thingy.  I have never offered to pay more for something and been denied.  Like, literally never in my life.  Why OHSO? Why do you so desperately want me to hate you?

bvicbQbs62bYGgdoZwGxjw.text: We went there to have lunch on Saturday. they only have brunch until 2:00. Not very appealing options,(biscuits and gravy in 100 degrees..really?) that is just my opinion. Odd for a Saturday and the menu is very limited.  The lunch menu starts at 2 and ends at 4 when you get the dinner menu. The wait staff comes around about every 20 minutes whether you want them or not. I guess if you want service you have to go find someone. The prices, for a beer bar are too much.  $11 for a glass of swill wine!!!! Come on!  It is barely worth $4. Needless we did not stay for lunch and won't bother to come back. There are actually a few better places to go around here.

XKjyWAGxZk74MTRUopX2_g.text: I've been meaning to review this place for a couple months and came across a picture of my son there and it reminded me. We were staying in Phoenix from Tucson and wanted to eat at a local restaurant. Our hotel gave us a list of chains, ruby Tuesday's, Applebee's etc, no thanks. I looked to Yelp and found this place. We were traveling with 3 young kids but this place said kid and pet friendly, we had no pets with us but I'd welcome a dog smooch anytime! At first I was worried because the outside booths were very high but they had coloring pages and crayons and there was a bike path behind us and the kids were so well behaved and just watched everything going on. Ok, drink and food selection was fantastic. Great beer selection. I had a mushroom burger with onion strings and it was the best restaurant burger I've ever had. The two other adults loved their food although I don't remember what they had. The kids ALL had Mac and cheese and it was a generous serving with fresh fruit. We WILL be back. Oh and we had a sweet black lab named Henry sitting behind us that would love on the boys :)

RsTE0Z6oEpCFylRUw3jXag.text: Hell yeah, this is my spot. Good food and great beer. Valet parking. Lots of space. They have food specials/drink specials when it's convenient. Staff is always helpful. Dog friendly patio too!

J9Uz11-1aWir3i310nyDBg.text: The two biggest things I like about this place is the back patio - it's big, open, dog-friendly, and has a decent view; and of course I love the beer selection.  It's always changing and they always have great stuff that you can get samplers of if you want.  Apart from that, the food is decent too - creative bar food.

jU5wFVXd6ps0GM4OBkc0Bg.text: We stopped in for brunch and this may have been the best brunch I've ever had. For $10 we each received either a mimosa or a 10oz beer plus our choice of brunch item. I went with the breakfast burrito.. a lot of great flavors in there! I also sampled the flatbread which was unique and tasty with red sauce combined with breakfast toppings. Their biscuits and gravy featured a spicy variation of gravy that I wish I would have had more of. The beer selection was equally great, featuring a variety of AZ/NM beers and others from around the country. My only regret was that I wish we would have gone again while we were out there!

z4MsZTom_W96WIMxfDT9HQ.text: I was just at this location Sunday April 22nd and services were ok, good was good, but then it came time to pay, they brought me the bill, in which I paid. 2 days later, the tab closed at double what the bill was!! I spoke with the manager which agreed to refund the doubled part which was wrongfully charged but I spent over 2 hours of my day trying to get this charge resolved. A mistake they made! They could have comped the tab for this inconvenience!!!

JcHQbN_VVyTTjbIgdbigyg.text: One of our favorite breakfast spots to eat at on a Sunday! There brunch menu followed by a fabulous mimosa is the best way to start a Sunday.

3NeOftPLPkBJehFF7w_Iuw.text: My only drawback for this place is price (apps are at cheapest like $12!) and distance from Mesa. Everything about this place is great. We came here around 5pm on Christmas Eve and the bar tender (Kyle) was amazing and so nice. The food (spinach artichoke dip with bacon jam and AZ Burger) were amazing! Love this place, will definitely be back for next year's visit!

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brunch!!
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spinach artichoke dip w/ bacon jam (YUM!!)

JdhSIeFQCQfSF0zbc1aZfg.text: Family friendly brewery/restaurant. We enjoyed the steak fries and the mango, grapefruit ipa. The only downside is the parking lot or lack there of.

KYB0xMOMrRhy8tO_Fqpj5A.text: Love the patio and the vibe here, but I'm just never super impressed with their food. Come for the appetizers - the boards are great - and the beers. Great place to bike, too!
