F7k7aIJOioPLDCBsP-Nx0A.text: Great place for group dining! I hosted a brunch with my Meetup group a few months ago.  They gave us the front outside patio.  It was perfect!!!  You just can't beat a meal and beer or HUGE mimosa for a flat $10.  You just can't!!!  I'm a fan .. a huge fan!

Aw4imu6eYK0QipTHaIl8ag.text: If you're from out of town, and you want a great place to drink great brew I highly recommend this place! If steven (bartender) aka esteban is there you're in luck! The dude is awesome so tip him well. Definitely coming back to this joint. Might be my favorite spot in AZ :)

LOTKCy5g-IAdwhjEcrEOPA.text: This location is one of my favorite hangouts! I especially like to ride the canal path, pull up to the bike parking, walk onto the patio and refuel with an OHSO specialty brewed beverage. They have a lot of their own brews to offer. Today I had the Popcycle Blonde Ale which has a light raspberry lemon background flavor. Very refreshing on a hot summer day.  They have a great menu to choose from and on Sunday's, after 3:00, they have a barbecue plate with pork ribs, chicken and brisket accompanied with cornbread, potato salad and coleslaw. It's an all you can eat for $18. Very tasty, but make sure you have an empty stomach before. Lol The atmosphere is very laid back and comfortable. Good music, comfy seats, lots of room for larger parties, and a great back patio. Sunday's are 'bring your dog day' on the patio.  They even offer free homemade dog cookies. Way to go!  If you're in the area, give it a try. You'll like it.

OSzuTtY0aklIb9WHfWnWUA.text: This is the O.G. O.H.S.O! Great spot for just about any occasion.   I've frequented their North Scottsdale location and knew I would have a good time with friends at this spot. It's definitely a prime Arcadia location since it's next to the bike path/canal.   I arrived early for a happy hour for a decently-sized group of 15-20 people. We didn't have a reservation, but since I did arrive early and it wasn't terribly busy, the OHSOers were able to push together a bunch of tables for my group to sit altogether. Our server quickly greeted me upon sitting down and got a bunch of waters to the tables since it was one of our "nice" hot summer days. On the beer list there was a lot of new stuff on both the OHSO side and the local side.   I decided to try one of their cocktails instead [the Herban Woman] of beer [gasp], but one of my friends let me try his IPA. Glad I went with the Herban Woman, it's a sweet sipping summer-y drink. Not too strong and not too sweet. I noshed on really great fries that he ordered as well and didn't want. Perfect compliment to my beverage.   Happy hour at OHSO is amazing. $7 cocktails and pitchers! Beer pints are normally $6 so you're basically getting 1.5 more pints for just $1 more. There are discounts on food as well, but I didn't take a peek at the offerings. Will definitely have to come back soon for another happy hour!

WNVH7hEr44A_HN92KIRGdA.text: Beer and food was fantastic! Was an amazing first time experience and even with a group of 18! The service was fantastic and accommodating for our group. I had the Mac Del Mar and Mac with brisket. Phenomenal! I loved both! The nano brews were great and had fun names. Definitely worth a try if you've never been!

O11ik3WqbSU7viA2-AxIBA.text: Went to meet a friend i havent seen in 4 years visiting from out of town. Grabbed a beer from bar and chilled outside for a while. Went in to cool off and get a bite to eat. We stood up at hostess stand for a minute, and no one seemed to be at the front. We walked through the bar area and sat at a booth by a server station. Server comes over in an obviously shitty mood and gives us some menus. Her demeanor was so uncomfortable. It wasnt even late (830-9pm) and she was probably the closing server. I had opened a tab with the bartender earlier but I was going to order another beer and told the server that my card was at the bar. She cut me off before i finished my sentence and very rudely exclaimed "Uhhh then you need to close your tab with the bartender". I think it pissed her off that I ordered a water from her... Whatever. Well, ok then, miss bad attitude, guess who is obviously not getting a dime for a tip and a bad review for your terrible excuse for service. A very polite BOH guy even delivered our food and I said thank you every time anyone came to our table, INCLUDING grumpy girl. So I was TRYING to help her not hate us so much. It is so much easier to be nice than mean. She was even slamming stuff around on the server station right behind us, like putting away menus or something. LOL. Wow.  Point is, if your table has a tab at the bar, most restaurants can transfer the tab to the server. And then the server has to tip the bar a certain percent based on alcohol sales anyway. I was a server for 8 years in fine dining/bar/sports bar atmospheres so excuse me if my expectations are a little high. Sorry not sorry.  Rest of the employees seemed nice and the place was clean. Menu looked good. I had shrimp tacos. Shrimp was cooked perfectly and we had spinach artichoke dip for app. It was sweet which was weird but was ok. Hate to write a bad review, but no excuse for server attitude. Leave that at the door.

CROflm4A1fp5axsAboIDFA.text: The patio at OHSO is the best! Even on a hot afternoon, the misters, fans, and umbrellas kept  us cool. Dogs are welcome on the patio, and they even provide little water dishes for your furry friends. There's a bike entrance from the crosscut canal, so people can walk or bike in on the canal path and enter from the back.   Service is exceptionally friendly, and there is a great brunch deal (buy a $10-15 entree and get a local beer to go with it). The beer is really great as well. On the downside, the food isn't super exciting. I've had the veggie burger and avo toast, neither of which were bad but just not mind blowing. In general, the food is typical bar fare.   Come for the atmosphere and beer, and have a great time on the patio!

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Super fun patio with plenty of fans and misters to keep it cool on a hot afternoon

p5ssMRKsc1kQ-SI1S5Le5Q.text: Well, a waste of time and money.   The hostess was so cold and rude, like she was doing us a big favor to seat us, that we considered leaving immediately....which we should have done.   Chinese chicken salad was tasteless, barely had any dressing at all and was not cold or even cool.  Room temperature lettuce and tasteless chicken.   The Pork Wing $15.00 appetizer was so dried out, tough and chewy it was a throw away.  See photo.    There's no reason to eat here at all.  Maybe people like the beer.    Once was enough.  Never again.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dried out, over-cooked, tough $15.00 appetizer Pork Wings.  Horrible.

YQlWvINiczj54Zx2oZpwIg.text: Good food, but some of the worst service I've seen.  The AZ Burger is a significant portion, and has the right amount of heat from the jalapeno cream cheese.  We had a party of eight on a Sunday afternoon.  Waiter Humberto took 10+ minutes to acknowledge us.  Then another 20-25 minutes to take orders.  Actually, that was another waiter to take orders because he was nowhere to be found.  Getting water refills was a non-starter, despite our esteemed waiter walking by with a pitcher numerous times.  Perhaps if we were blonde and had aftermarket breasts, we could have had waters refilled.   Compounding the lousy service was a group of loud, drunken sorority skanks that mysteriously continued to be served despite state regulations.  Hello, ASLB!  Asked for a second beer...three times.  Never got it.  We got the bum's rush because our waiter was coming off shift.  God forbid the customer be right, ever.  Perhaps his don't give a ---- attitude would be better suited for the overnight shift at a Waffle House.  Guess I won't be back for that second beer.  If you go, do be careful of this obnoxious roll in the vinyl flooring.

zQ8ug2w9ca8MUs287mttdA.text: I'M OBSESSED WITH THIS PLACE. Came here for a bday brunch, which coincided w/ 2 Frenchies which pretty much made my birthday.  If you're a dog lover, you need to come here! The patio was full of dogs of all sizes that my party and I could barely keep up conversation as we just watched the pups around us.  (**If you're not a dog lover but still like a good beer brunch - inside is good too!)  Beer brunch - while I wish there were more non-sweet food options, the plentiful beer options made up for everything! I couldn't decide between all the different options, but our waiter was very helpful in providing samples/suggestions!  *chicken and waffles - this seemed to be the crowd favorite and the most bang for your buck! I tried some of my friends' and I thought it was better than my breakfast bowl  *fruity pebble french toast - this was really aesthetically pleasing if that helps anyone  *avocado toast - 2 friends got this and they seemed to really like it!  The star of the show (other than the pups though) were still the beer. If you like good beer and good deals, OHSO is an incredible and unique environment to enjoy those!

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States

PEEOlLcH4geN_Fg74wrmXQ.text: Walked in they had a bunch of open seats and said it's a 20 min wait. What a joke. This state is just terrible why does anyone want to live here

59RNVwhGiPRobBvKsCQ5Gg.text: The Beer Brunch on the weekends is the way to go! You have a choice of various brunch items between $10 and $15 which includes a mimosa or a beer with your meal. I got a mimosa with my breakfast wrap and it was huge! Definitely a good balance between champagne and orange juice. The breakfast wrap wasn't "wimpy", as described by the waiter, but it wasn't huge either. It was more like a someone who skipped leg day. The wrap was delicious and my friend really enjoyed the avocado toast. We also got the donut holes to start and those were so tasty! The chicken and waffles are pretty humongous so that may be the next item to try, followed by the biscuits with gravy. Overall the food is delicious and I cannot wait to go back and try more. I want to eat out on the patio too as it looks pretty cool out there.  Be prepared to valet your car because the lot here is TINY. You pull in and there really is no place to go but straight to valet. Some people may be annoyed about this, but it's nice that I don't have to worry about where to park and such. I cannot wait to go back for my next visit!

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Donut Holes. So delicious.
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast wrap! Small-ish, but so tasty!
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mimosas. Excellent champagne to OJ ratio.

PBVGjMlU85W1OTiHKyA4zQ.text: Except it to be very busy on the weekends, but they are normally very efficient and you can usually snag a spot at the bar if you want to squeeze in. Any seat in the back porch area is a great one! LOVE that they are dog-friendly, as I normally try to get my little buddies out and about on the weekends for some time out of the house.   The food has been pretty good so far; no complaints. You get a free beer or mimosa with a brunch item, so that's definitely a WIN!   A few servers look a bit unhappy to be there and lack a sense of urgency, so that would be my mild qualm with this place. The VALET staff is phenomenal however!

aa5rrYLyiByg0P25ysSlYQ.text: Probably one of the best dog friendly spots around. The pup knows it well enough that when we walk past by the canal she tries to go in  She loves the treats they make and the staff loves the dog. The beer menu changes frequently which is great. The Lost Viking is one of my faves. The food is good. Have to say the gobbler and the salmon BLT are my favorites there

_br8eyT8EQhf1Rgc1mc26w.text: I used to come here all the time when I lived here so coming here on vacation was a must! I love that it's so dog friendly and they have the best happy hour!!! 11 am - 6 pm for a happy hour!? Who else does that?! I love it!

LPeim-X-6d7Emd4TexuqDw.text: This is the second time my family and I have came here. The first time our server was cut and another girl named Jessica took over the table. This time the same server waited on my family. Jessica is beyond amazing. She greets the table with a smile and a personable attitude. I appreciate her, because of her I feel comfortable and welcome. Each restaurant I go to some give my family and I dirty looks and horrible service, and as a bartender I know it's because of our ethnicity. Well OHSO Brewery definitely has my money, aside from Jessica , the food is great and the restaurant is clean kept.

GahEKh7bM2Wj6G9FeYc2ig.text: Very few words are necessary.  I live in the area and this is like 1/2 dozen time that this was a bad experience unfortunately.  I can say on the upside, the waitress was nice, she was prompt and the bad experience, once again, was not her fault.  As well, the onsite manager was responsive.    I'm walking distance and I will never go back, even if everything was free.  If you are looking for drinks and a local drinking hangout, this is your place; however for dinner and good food, go elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. OHSO - keep going if seeking good food

NtoxhZ4QtnfnZNiOEd7s0w.text: Friendly staff. Went for my first time last Thursday and sat on the patio. Loved all the doggies! Service was pretty quick and the staff were on top of it. Would defiantly go again!

WC4w694L58fif98yYIpGug.text: The two best things about this place: the patio during a cool night and the happy hour. The happy hour has an amazing beer deal and keeps me coming from more. I also like the pretzel appetizer on the happy hour but that's pretty much it.   Every time I've tried the food, I'm upset. Every time I get seated, I receive the worst service. Bad food, bad service, and overpriced regular drinks? I'll stick to coming during happy hour.

a7lIY86n5mEKAXiHKQp7Tw.text: Had an awesome time here with my family! Brandon (one of the workers there) answered a ton of questions and made us feel very welcome. I'll definitely be coming back with more family and friends!

OzGkxVP9jmd8BdiE4Ugc_w.text: Large selection of beers. Beautiful patio. Nice place to hang friends.  Visited for a weekday lunch. It was not too crowded so we were able to get a nice table in the back patio.  I had Carnes Asada Tacos. It came with 4 tortillas skins on which you can mix the meat and salsa yourself. The steak was well marinated and cooked with cabbage. Chipotle sauce was peppery and flavorful. I also loved the cold, "icy" guacamole.  One slight downer: there were some flies on the patio probably due to the canal's proximity. The food was also on the pricy end.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fNCcBYuKojrBe22tW16UzA.text: Nice chill place.  They have good food.  I had a side of their fries, and their fries reminded me of McDonald's, I was very impressed. Also they have the bomb beer.  I love their Mango Wheat Beer.

2KE9wMvaN_0GsO7d1A_6CA.text: Deliciousness - 4/5 Happiness - 5/5  OHSO is a must visit. It's a micro-brewery that has a vast selection of in-house and local beers (as well as a nice selection of national beers). And if you don't like the beer selection, in about three weeks the entire in-house list turns over. That means you can get a wholly unique beer flight each visit.  But saying OHSO is only about beer sells it short. It has THE BEST BLOODY MARY in Arizona. Notably, it comes with house-made beef jerky along with the normal toppings. The jerky is so good. They've also begun distilling their own liquor and they have crafted a delicious gin.  The food is tasty but wildly overpriced. The location is just off the canal and has a bike bar (i.e., tools you can use to tune up your bike), a gorgeous outside patio and bar, games to help you bide your time, is dog-friendly, and even gives away free dog biscuits to those canine owners out there. What more could you want?

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States

b0F7Wrz-MiIzydYR3M6VTw.text: Christmas beer!!!! Yummmmm that lemon vodka. Wow so good!!!!! I've been wanting to try ohso, so I'm so glad I came! Also had the hummus- yum I love that thy give cucumbers! Pretzel bites were good as well! Our bartender was so knowledgeable about their beers and vodka. He's passionate about his work and that was really nice to see!  3 stars because I saw something I didn't like and won't be returning to this specific location....

F-X2lH6PY2wENymHwzhk9w.text: Good beer, delicious grub, and dog-friendly? Who could ask for anything more?!  The space is HUGE. There's plenty of table and booth seats, but if those don't suit your fancy, you can also take a seat at the bar or the outdoor patio area. We came here for dinner/drinks on a Sunday night, and the Cardinals/Seahawks game was on. (You know, the embarrassing one where both sides messed up their field goals and the chance to score a win in OT? Yeah, you know the one.)  O.H.S.O. has an awesome selection of beer that will suit your tastes. I don't remember exactly which beer I ordered, but it was something white chocolate-y and delicious.  For food, I've always been a mac and cheese kind of girl. O.H.S.O. did me a solid and offered mac and cheese with brisket and I was. so. there. It came out just as I expected -- tender brisket slathered in sweet BBQ sauce lying on top of some ooey, gooey mac and cheese. I still drool when I think about it...  Sadly, I'm not a Phoenix native, but if I were, you can bet that I would have brought my pup to this place. There was a golden retriever hanging out in the patio area when we were there, and I couldn't stop staring at its fluffy adorableness. I absolutely love how dog-friendly O.H.S.O. is. I took a pack of treats on my way out and offered them to my dog when I got home. She gobbled all of them up and couldn't get enough. Thanks, O.H.S.O.!

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grab some dog treats on your way out/in!
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brisket + Mac

rWtY9f5xL5nP56j595xpoA.text: Stopped by for a couple beers and to celebrate our dogs birthday, and couldn't have had a better experience! our server Richard was really helpful, and made sure all 3 of us were well taken care of.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. happiest pup!

M9gzkwHHu07OMvLz9pxJyw.text: Great beer, great happy hour! The steak fries and the hot chick sandwich are amazing. I love that I can bring the pupsters when it's nice outside too!

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Taking selfies at OHSO lol

J7Pp1VGRyCnG5vi1N8GEog.text: Don't order the brisket sandwich here, unless you like it sticky, sweet sauce, and not so fresh. Like a lump. Judging from the sandwich I think they are doing better to focusing on the drinks.

MKyNwfpiPfWz4z1zKGau0g.text: Picked up my buddy from the airport, and on the way home, we stopped here.  He's a big beer fan, and I had seen that they have a late night happy hour.    I went with a pretzel, and their crab wontons.  Each item was $3.00, and even for that, I thought it was just a tad skimp (mainly the wontons).  The pretzel was hot and salted nicely.  The cheese dip they serve this thing in, was great!  It had a good texture to it, and some jalapenos/peppers mixed in with the nacho cheese.  Tasty, but the pretzel was small, so you couldn't even dip it enough times to use up all the cheese.  Oh well.  On to the wontons........for $3.00, you get 3 of these things and they were sitting in a sweet sriracha/chili type sauce (really tasty and good spice!).  These things were definitely skimp.  The filling was minuscule.  It was basically like eating plain fried wonton wrappers.  Couldn't even decipher that it was crab inside of the wontons.  Honestly, I have never seen a skimper wonton/dumpling/egg roll type food item in my life.  Definitely would not get those again.  My buddy had a couple of beers and thought they were ok.  Since it was Pi Day, they had some unique brews on tap and I tried a couple of my buddies samplers (lemon meringue pie, blueberry pie and a bourbon pecan pie).  The lemon meringue pie taste exactly like a lemon meringue pie.  They definitely hit the spot as far as flavor profile.    Service was friendly.  We had a few different servers/helpers/managers come by and everyone was awesome!  3 stars for the cool vibe, the service and some decent beers.  Wouldn't come back here for the food, but it is definitely a chill place I can see myself returning to with out of town company for a couple of beers on the patio.

GbMFx7H-Kx8ddu4zI8zKjw.text: Went for Sunday Brunch.  The wait was almost an hour, but we actually found seats at the bar right away so that was great.  Loved the Sunday Brunch deal and had the giant mimosa (which was excellent).  Tried the chicken and waffles.  The chicken was amazing - the waffles were cold and seemed like something you'd buy yourself and put in the toaster, but the chicken was excellent.  Would definitely come again and try something else.  Had an amazing outside patio.

n_jP8f_RhNUjoLT0IJ4tKw.text: OK appetizers OK food beer I was just an average night on an average place nothing special

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Hel2xkNXV2laJy4DaVD-Qw.text: After a friend recommended this local brewery we figured we had to give it a try while we were visiting Scottsdale. Everything was just okay...but for $72 it definitely wasn't worth it.   We had the steak & fries as an appetizer. That was the best part of the meal. I got the Brisket Mac which was SUPER heavy. After 4-5 bites I was full. My husband ordered the AZ burger. Again, it was okay...not great.   $72 for 1 beer, 1 soda, an app and two mediocre meals just felt like a lot. Maybe we ordered the wrong things? Not sure we'd recommend it again.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States

bRc_a1iPt7fgQZAc37-j_w.text: We love OHSO! Their veggie burgers are bomb!! The atmosphere is great and it is very dog friendly! :) highly recommend to anyone!

IFfGWtJupC8W-zXw5Fkc-A.text: I went here for a birthday party, rather large party. The rest of the restaurant was empty, and we were only assigned one new waiter. The waiter was nice and tried to get to know us, but the food took a very long time to come out. I got the chicken and waffles as well as a few others at the table. The waffle was not good with no flavor and the chicken was very dry. I would not recommend that plate to anyone. Especially if the price for the meal is going to be more, I expected a lot more. Overall atmosphere was fun, but will not be returning.

ie7sJdxpKfd9V_ut4i1dww.text: Happy hour was awesome. Great prices and the service was great. My only complaint is the dumb parking. I was told if I didn't want to valet that I had to park across the street and j walk... yeah real safe. Real annoying!

p-FK1tY7RQ4yVooToT55Gg.text: Their Rise and Shine stout brewed with maple syrup and coffee was the best stout I've ever had. It's the only thing I had, but it was so good it gets its own 5 stars.

7JpcL-kmezoJqDlldBSL8A.text: Are ten stars available? Visited OHSO today with a very large impromptu party of 15+ people and three dogs. They were able to accommodate us and were gracious in handling our group, splitting checks, and providing great service. Perfect place for good food, beer & atmosphere.

5dHSqEVSqg565z119HHFvw.text: One of the best veggie burgers ever! And great beer and very friendly customer service

xK1M9P1-UcRWxAADcyWEEQ.text: Went here with my husband and sister tonight for the first time, was actually really good. I had a Asian salad and LOVED it. Was a little on the pricey side but definitely worth it for a splurge kinda night! Would be a great date place! They also had complimentary valet which I have never heard of, so cool! Everyone was really friendly.

ZyDJry3spAKRaQvz31mlZQ.text: Overall, good for a beer and that's about it.   Service: Was ok at best. We were frequently forgotten by our server on the patio out back.   Food: Vegetarian options were slim. I had the salad and hubby had the veggie burger. It was ok. It would be nice if restaurants offered a thoughtful protien option entree for vegetarians.   The beer menu left a bad taste in my mouth because one of the featured brews was called "Nerve Agent." I find this name in extremely bad taste. Nerve agents are used around the world in acts of terrorism and murder. It's not funny. It's not clever. It's culturally insensitive and tasteless. You can do better.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This is a terrible name. Poor taste. Why not name it &#34;mass school shooting&#34;? You should know better.
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salad was just ok.

Qh075jbZWtOnkTG5u5rxpw.text: Been here for brunch a few times, the chicken and waffles and mimosas are divine. Although I have been there when they have run out of menu items, or when the wait is too long to go, so be wary of going at busy times. Also, be warned that it is generally valet parking only

q8XWKWSbyew1puMXEcInMg.text: I absolutely love the atmosphere, but I am not a fan of the food for the price tag. They have a great happy hour appetizer menu that I wish was offered all day.   Perfect date spot as they have an array of beers + cocktails. My boyfriend and I love to come here for their Sat/Sun brunch. They are happy to accommodate food allergies.   Your date can be male, female, or furry :) Great place to bring your dog. Not too hot in the summer as they have misters.

eb-dZz92dTcGCbPmXXOhxw.text: Ate here last night. Great vibe. Not a bad thing, but we were almost the oldest people in the house (at 60 and 62). Excellent selection of brews. Some of the home brews a bit hit-or-miss.  I had the Brisket & Mac. Interesting and fun. Could have had a bit more flavor. Good sized portion.  My partner had the burger and liked it a lot.  I like the Dollar per Pour method of creating your own flights. Nicely priced. Tried three that I wouldn't normally have gone for.  The only real negative is that the kitchen was having some issues and our meals took a long time to come out. Server was good about letting us know about the issue.  If I lived nearer (2000 miles away), would definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My three choices from last night.

bLK4pJRFEMG4RLX1CuncUw.text: Came here for my first time two days ago with coworkers, and want to return with my mother! We ate on the back patio under large umbrellas and blue skies. I chose the Ensalada Del Sol- a delicious and refreshing salad that I recommend topping with a side of ranch! Fantastic food, and great atmosphere. You have my recommendation!

Vvn1ICupj3CJY-JdyKLSbw.text: Great place ... looked small when we arrived but lots of seating both in and outside. The back deck is even pet friendly. Great selection of beers with lots of local microbrews.  We had appetizers and dinner. Both were great. Pricing was good and they have good happy hr deals for the beer.  Would certainly return.

MhwVC3Z0SkVZULKd334OiA.text: We never made it inside because the parking situation is a joke. It's valet only, there are NO options for self park and the the valet guy is drunk that continously reminds you that it's free and they work for tips. Annoying experience.

cM0F5iYLBlcilmj5yL3asg.text: Check Please Arizona brought us here and boy are we glad it did.  The pretzel board is a fantastic appetizer, the gobbler turkey burger with pear salsa was a great combination, and last but not least is the Carmel Apple pie--do not miss it!  Great service; loved this place.  Will definitely recommend to others and come back.  P.S. the Piehole Porter was great!

pRBrXzjTcjJhMgyMICDVlw.text: I'm a big fan so far. A bit hectic on a Friday night, we just stopped in for a drink and casual meal, so we opted not to wait for an hour - hour and a half for a table and just hit up the bar instead. The bar gets really crowded but the service was still attentive and friendly.   The macadamia and vanilla beer was absolutely incredible. We also had the hummus appetizer which was average but good, and I had the veggie burger which was delicious.   The parking was a little chaotic but I believe they had complimentary valet. We just parked in front of the dry cleaner next door which worked too.  I've heard their brunch is great, so I will definitely be back, and I recommend you check it out.

r-kAvIv53s6tcEEwf67lig.text: The cobb salad is huge and delicious! We also shared a plate of fries covered in delicious aioli and steak. Our waitress was excellent! She kept up with all our orders and was super nice and funny. Can't remember her name but 5 stars to her. We loved the dog-friendly patio and the music was great! Will definitely come back the next time we are in Tempe!

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak fries and Cobb salad. YUM

-wwO-xXubBrU4cS1PHvgtw.text: Let's nip this shit in the bud right now.  If you are one of those people that feel the need to bring your dog everywhere with you . . . because you either feel entitled to, or because you think everyone else must be a dog lover, then this place is for you.  Here is what we need to get nailed down . . . the regulations as far as they pertain to dogs, restaurants and patios.  The animal must remain on the ground and cannot be with 200 feet of where food is prepared or the door from which the food is served.    What I don't need is a place that I've gone to enough times to know that dogs are not only allowed on the patio, but in the restaurant, on the seats and a lot of time on the tables.    Where is the health department when you need them?

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Last time I checked it was against every health regulation to have a dog, at a restaurant&#39;s patio, on anything but the floor.

0LdB9u6y0SF381mVPksK1Q.text: You can hardly ever go wrong with coming to O.H.S.O.  I don't know why I think of the song by 2 live Crew {me so horny} every time I think of the name.  However, the service and food was good.  We got the tacos.. and the the limes were extra dry, I mean.... I am definitely not picky at all but I feel if you order tacos.. you should be able to add all of the flavors that you want.  Needless to say we asked for fresh limes, which probably had the waitress talking about us in the back, but it made the tacos taste that much better.  The drinks were on point!!  And the service was pretty good. Our waitress was gone for a certain point in time, but when we got a hold of her she made sure to come by at a more frequent rate.  This would be my second time at this restaurant/nanoBrewery and I love the environment.  Definitely good for groups and to let off some unwanted stress.  Everyone for the most part is very friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wet bar status

GnAC0r7cj3FMsbugZx32_g.text: We came here for a beer and a meal. We were not disappointed.   The beer list was great! I wanted to try a bunch of them, but since we do not live close, we only had one.  The food was good. I had "The Pilgrim" a turkey/bacon sandwich with sprouts, tomato, and cheese on a croissant. My sandwich was pretty big, so I only had 1/2 with my fries.   There are so many other things to try on the menu. I would like to come in for the brunch sometime.   Thank you, O.H.S.O. for a great lunch!

ty_KCva8nOgtH4ewB62nAw.text: Good food! I have eaten here a few times for the brunch with beer they offer (though I get the mimosa) and the food has been so yummy! I was sad to see they do not offer the berry waffles anymore, but the fruity pebble french toast was delicious! (But I still hope they put those waffles back on the menu, pretty please?)  They do have a large menu, but the options for vegetarians are a little limited but good. They have a veggie burger, though I haven't tried that yet, and have options that can be eaten on the breakfast menu.   Prepare for somewhere loud if you want to go, but this is definitely a fun place to enjoy a tasty brunch with friends.

0MsvLSk9cItKCXD2VIEVxQ.text: Just wanted to shoutout Sam McD for being an AWESOME server with our large group this weekend!! He was helpful, accommodating, and made paying so easy (when it's usually a nightmare in big groups!). Thank you, thank you!  OHSO is a neighborhood classic, you really can't go wrong. Fun patio with adorable doggies, bike racks for the "winter" (aka anytime that isn't 120 degrees), local friendly feel. You really can't beat the $10 brunch special - any food item from a selected variety... go with the breakfast wrap and ask for salsa and pico on the side ;)... and a beer or mimosa for just ten bucks! When I'm there for lunch or dinner, the fish tacos, tomato soup, and sweet potato fries are my go-to items. Keep it up OHSO!!

0_yMGylsEg6tVBrRsJyMqQ.text: Location and patio are great.  Food is way overpriced for quality.  Seems to be overly focused on drinks and not so much on food.  To get protein on a salad is going to cost well over $15 and it is not close to the quality of an LGO or Flower Child salad. Tacos were super bland and boring. Food quality and taste needs to improve drastically.

FcUUZfXL12pjCyVU21B7Bw.text: O.H.S.O. It's an incredible place with a longer name that I promise I'll never recall -- O.H.S.O. it is. I've been here three times, and each time was a very enjoyable experience.  The atmosphere is top notch. It feels very welcoming and friendly. The decor matches. The inside feels very industrial, while also maintaining character. The outside, particularly the patio in the back, feels open and inviting (even for pets).  The food is also pretty good. I had the grilled chicken and a massive burger at this place and both were very good. I have no complaints from the food I tried. The portions were also very much welcomed. I felt satisfied each time.  The drinks are also interesting. I'm not a beer drinker, so I won't comment on that, but the cocktails are really fun to dive into. There are ones with funny names and different tastes. I am not an experienced drinker by any means, but it was good in my opinion. The prices are a bit on the high side though, so going during happy hour might be a good decision.  Overall, this place is great. If I ever wanted to hang out with friends and have a drink, this place would immediately come to mind. Definitely check it out!

cqpqm60mI7fXprTqsbTkxA.text: First time ever at this location and we had good results. They don't offer alot of lagers, but they have a bunch of others choices. I had the same sandwich as I had in the other location and again, the brisket was top notch, topped with onion strings and BBQ sauce. The star of the sandwich was the green chile cheese sauce which I had served on the side. You can dip those fries and your sandwich in the sauce and you will leave happy. Prices are about $12 per sandwich and the indoor crowd had thinned out by around 8:30pm on a Saturday night. The back patio was still packed as we left, so the party continues out there with the youngsters.

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Frisky brisky

MSQNdt5LLV-_CYqRHyZMgA.text: Food is very good. Beer is amazing.  Main dining room (behind the bar) is horrendously LOUD. We were nearly shouting at each other. This is the reason for four stars instead of five. Try to get a table outside, or if you want to sit inside then get a table in the smaller area right next to the front patio tables.

2f6Cw3_Xg6Eu5m7nLGeHSA.text: 09.01.14 Final meal pre-departure of the bachelorette party. FABULOUS time at OHSO. We each did a beer brunch ($10 for an entree and a beer), and I selected the veggie flatbread and an amber ale. Super fun atmosphere, cute cycle decor, just great feelings all around. Prices are hard to beat! yelp.com/biz_photos/o-h-...

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. beer brunch.

eJt_9Dz8_W-VJJyhyjWycQ.text: Well, after visiting twice over the weekend and three times since the new year, I figured I had better add my review to the pile.  It has a causal, very dog friendly vibe. The kind of place that fits perfectly in the Arcadia neighborhood.  On the Friday night it was busy when I arrived there with friends around 8pm. A nice mix of locals and tourists ranging from dressed up to casual.  The crowd died off around 10 or 11pm.  On Sunday afternoon, the back patio was full of people. The access to the walking trail along the Indian School Canal pulls people in, especially if out waking their dogs. This place has water dishes and free dog treats. As I mentioned, VERY dog friendly.  I came for beers with friends, but we had some food too. The flatbread was good with an appreciated, slightly flaky crust. The other food items were also enjoyable as batter than average bar food fare.  TIP: Happy Hour is Monday through Friday from 11am until 6pm. All Arizona pitchers of beer (about 2.5 pints), all glasses of wine, and all house specialty cocktails are $6.  By the way, in March they are opening a third location in Paradise Valley at the intersection of Tatum and Shea.

zgHuJwrY1NsnB1lCLKz_rA.text: Please do not support southwest autism research center. They would rather have me pick up my phone rather than possibly getting kidnapped and there might also be a possible chance of being used for human trafficking. That's why I wasn't answering the phone to Southwest autism research staff. They would rather not let you have an escape route of being kidnapped from your room  at midnight tonight which is total bullshit. I am also pissed because one of the staff here bribed me in paying for another students transportation and I am down 900 bucks which the girl with black hair said l would be reimbursed by the other person but never was. Yes I am also autistic.

8Qgj8ZiDErrAcunCC932Ew.text: Recently noticed they changed their menu and no longer have the sweet chili burger that is my favorite. They were still willing to make it for me except they don't carry the specific cheese anymore. I'm still a happy camper!

xw-XGxb9Kcti9M5RrTivIg.text: Great atmosphere and really great customer service, food was so-so. Like some of the other reviews this is a great bar and they are always busy so they're doing something right. But customer service goes a long way with me and they make you feel right at home here. Ill definTely be back.

NsWWbHbkCK_vuID2C7Xpbw.text: I had the beginning festivities of my 21st birthday party at OHSO. We had a dinner and were able to reserve tables for my group. They were very easy to work with and even let us set out decorations and bring our own cake!! Some places don't let you bring outside food in - so it was so great that they let us bring our own cake because it was custom made and beautiful. OHSO has the best mojitos I have ever had. They have a great atmosphere outside in the back which is where we were. The food is awesome. I would definitely make it a regular spot to eat and drink

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States

d6cvsrFkt1Sb2SsQNIGfgw.text: The food was good, the noise level not too bad for a Saturday night, the service was even good. What really sucked, the reason for 3 stars for a 5 star dinner, is the beer. They were out of more beer than they had on tap, and the kicker is they didn't even have the courtesy to print out an updated drink menu! We had to have asked for at least 6 different beers that were on the menu but they were out of. And not even "just ran out", two of the beers they've been out of for two months! We would have stayed for a few more beers if they carried what they said they did. I'm hoping for a better experience next time.

iRkAPBxBcIaRGaidTr4Tdg.text: What a great spot! We are in Scottsdale for vacation and were looking for a casual place close to our condo on our first night here. Terrific outdoor patio and really cool bar inside. Between the 4 of us, 2 had tacos, 1 had salmon, and one had the brisket sandwich. We all agreed that our meals were terrific. Good prices too. I had one of their specialty cocktails. It was very tasty but there was so much ice in the drink that I think I only got about 6 sips out of it. Even with that, I highly recommend this place.  I'll just get a beer next time!

LHg-BYc3X337q_fdL6XXLw.text: We have come here a lot. Has a nice vibe and you can bring your dog. The Arizona Burger, caramel apple pie and steak + fries are the only things worth ordering. Multiple times we have had horrrrrible service. I'm not sure why we continued to come back. I think we kept hoping it would get better. There's so many other places to go. Not sure why its always packed.

6o6I_rJ1q0wk9NkdK3yw7Q.text: This place is FANTASTIC. The server was great, beer selection was impeccable, and the food was amazing. I have no complaints for O.H.S.O.!

-BeLox4u4DU8uGfWm5xSOQ.text: The place is really nice. Great patio, nice lay out, good service.  The beer selection is also good but the food is barely OK.  The fries with steak have no personality and the serving is bigger than I would like it (at least fries wise, not that much steak, though).  I had the pulled pork sandwich and the meat was excessive, the flavor just OK and too much cheese.  Great place to hang out but don't expect anything from the kitchen. Stay with beers and comfort food and you'll do great.  Prices are fair.   Cheers.

Kd4co6NXaOAPd7nNz4P2rA.text: The food was just average. I had a hot pastrami sandwich, which was nothing special. My husband had the vege burger, which he really liked. The sides were disappointing. Both my french fries and my husband's sweet potato fries were frozen-from-the bag types. We also shared a pretzel bite appetizer which was unremarkable. Beer selection was good. Atmosphere was ok. Service was average - again, nothing special. Maybe we caught them on an off night, but I was expecting more.

AXA0S4juWYJQHh5fPbTwDw.text: 5 stars for their large mimosas and brunch on the weekends.  The food is great, beer list is always updated and the atmosphere is amazing.  I especially love that dogs are welcome which makes OHSO my number one choice to grab a beer, or brunch!

xmiTdYgJf-b_WdNdhxbmbg.text: the patio was So enjoyable to be out on!  we got the BBQ burger and the chicken and waffles and i would give them both SIX stars out of five!  ha!  we didn't have any of the beer so i can't attest to those, but the food is AMAZING!  highly recommend!!

htlN5GmPotb2sCwQqPwK3A.text: Love this place!  The food, and especially the beer selection, are delicious. Definitely a favorite spot for brunch!

j76GJV2iludVhVrf2eiKlg.text: This is a great neighborhood pub - especially if you like craft brew.  If you are that Bud Light kinda guy/gal this place is not for you.  If you love beer, casual atmosphere, great food pub food, and outdoor seating then this is a great spot! The only reason the parking suck is because this place is popular for good reason.

gJkuuLce52pIOVIGFHvVYA.text: OHSO is a must! I love breweries and this one is one of the best! They have all sorts of beers on tap including their own! I haven't tried one thee I didn't like! I do with they had a little more IPAS (I'm a hop head) but their selection is awesome thee is something for everybody. I've been quite a few times and the service has always been great. The patio is really fun to sit on and get brunch on the weekends. It's dog friendly which makes it all the more fun! The food is also awesome I haven't tried anything I didn't like! Some of the things I liked most are the carnitas bowl, biscuits and gravy, the grilled cheese, and the Mac del mar! If you haven't gone grab your friends and go! You won't be sorry!

z0pPMwQeG2sJ0UjbacOZYQ.text: Great guacamole, salmon tacos and bloody mary's! Being dog friendly is definitely a plus. They even provide a homemade treat for your dog. I love it!

OotjlZHYjpbw4HqGlY9JdQ.text: I'd say  3.5 stars if I could.  Really cool atmosphere. We chose OHSO as our happy hour destination due to it being dog friendly; they were. They have a "barking bar" where you can fill up a plastic container of water for your dog, and bags of dog biscuits. The servers even seemed used to doling out food with a dog laying between their feet.  They did have a really good beer list. They were out of the White Chocolate Ale, which was what I'd been looking forward to, so I settled for an Arizona Peach instead. That was pretty depressing to me though, being out of a beer. - 1/2 star. The service was very hit-or-miss. The servers were a little standoffish until later, when ours seemed to have a change of heart and came over to say hi to my dog. It did take a little bit for things to come out. The bus boy never brought the box I requested either :/  -1/2 star again.   We came to drink, but also had the spinach artichoke dip with crab; it was good, bit spicy on some bites with onion, but the crab was a nice topping choice. I wish there had been more pita bread, but I doubt it would have showed up had I asked for it.  I know this isn't OHSO's fault either, but it was incredibly strange that there were so many kids there. It's happy hour... at a nanobrewery.... and I'm having to watch my pirate language because of the 8 year olds wearing Catholic school girl uniforms sitting one stool over. Awkward.   Edit: I forgot to mention, the valet parking bit. There's maybe 15 spots that belong to OHSO. Otherwise, it's a mandatory valet parking job. This is just weird... I now feel obligated to tip someone to drive my car 10 feet away to a spot. The person who said "job creation" in a previous review was totally right.   - 1/2 star for the atmosphere being... jarred and the valet parking weirdness.

0glZEMhtV1I1twuZ_4TKpg.text: Just have to add a couple things....  1. I heard they are going to start letting people come in and brew their own beer?!? Where do I sign up I say!?!?! Sounds awesome! Anything we want, we get to name it and everything. I can't wait.   2. The Sunday BBQ Special, redick! Some friends got it the other day and raved about it. Looked amazing too. And at $15 and all you can eat, no brainer! "The best BBQ I have ever had!" He said

BUpiBXQe_jHqxWzFc6Y2TA.text: Place has always been my favorite. Great atmosphere, great specials. I only have two complaints... I always walk out smelling like I was cooking in my nanas kitchen and the salmon was dry. I'm unsure why I walk out smelling like food when I'm not cooking but it's overwhelming. Ventilation might be a good thing. Everyone there is fantastic. I just wish I wouldn't walk out smelling like a kitchen. Still my favorite place.

AlSoNBhZelwsI5RGVeBRYQ.text: Update: A week after my last visit described below, I decided to give OHSO a chance to fix things.  Kathy The Incredible Bartender listened to my story, apologized and fixed the growler mistake.  Kudos to her and OHSO for hiring her.  This is more like the OHSO I'm used to.  Original review: Have been going to OHSO for years, but the last couple visits were disappointments.  Most recently, we sat outside in the front for the delightful February afternoon.  It was 2ish, so the restaurant was busy, but not packed.  The music on the front patio roared.  The four of us had a selection of different beers and entrees.  The entree portions were smaller than usual and just OK for taste.  When the waiter brought two apple pies for dessert, he noticed our looks and said "They're kind of small, so I'll take care of one for you."  Didn't happen -- both appeared on the bill.  Worst of all, we ordered two growlers of Orange Blossom to take home which we later found to be something totally different.    A weird experience which wasn't like the OHSO I used to know, but seemingly more typical of recent visits.  I'll give it a pass for awhile and see if they straighten out.

qV6g1FaV0zxZHfzofc-KDA.text: One of the best burgers I've ever had.  The staff could not have been more friendly or accommodating to my dog.  Have heard a lot of good things about this place and glad it lived up to the hype.  Will be back soon

jzLhvbxy_UPelNijsfdBZw.text: Flys flys  flys did I say I don't like flys how can a bartender work with flys all over the counter.  Brisket is like pulled pork slice don't pull  bbq out of a jar first and last time here yuck

uwg1yKOm5fsBdvkp-PvX4Q.text: I absolutely loved the flatbread pizza. Very good. I was a little disappointed with the beer though. I had the orange blossom and the orange pail. I'm not sure exactly what it was but they just seemed very hoppy or strong, but not in a good way. They were good but not great. But just my opinion. Can't wait to see the outside once they are done renovating it. It was closed last week.

hlGl8xmvnu6yLQIMGeJDPQ.text: Love this place! Has an urban feel inside. I had the garlic shrimp tacos and they were AMAZING!! Tried the sweet potato fries (basically my favorite food) and they were very good. No comment on the beer (since I don't drink it) but they had a good sized selection.

mjD63aiA-Zuo3FOzV2c7XQ.text: OHSO Is my go to for a craft brew here in the valley. With a rotating beer list, friendly staff, and an awesome covered (and cool) patio, there's not too many others than can compare.

elVNLO2VUIAZJFCt1q8b0w.text: Food is always amazing, they don't skimp on their mimosa pours. Very friendly staff and is one of the only dog friendly bars in the valley. I come here at least once a month and have never been dissatisfied. They even sent us a $25 gift card for posting a picture of us and our dog on their Facebook page. Super cute bar idea and tons of good beer options.

NN_pV8N-TfR8UgY3RF7xvg.text: If you like hot cucumbers, you'd better get into OHSO fast, because I'd bet this place has a six month to one year lifespan.   Really, hot cucumbers? My partner and I were excited to see OHSO from the street, and I was particularly intrigued with the "Nano Brewery" moniker. Sounds great! Big disappointment. They are trying to be like St. Francis or The Vig, and it ain't working for them.   And then I ordered a $12 or $13 "flatbread," which was a tiny square pizza with hot cucumbers on top of it. That's right . . . cooked cucumbers. Ugh!!! After scraping the cucumbers off, the balance of the chicken flatbread tasted OK. But like so many things on the menu here at OHSO, it was overpriced and uninspired.  I like the beer list, but that's about it. Give it a little more intimate interior design, set up an outrageous happy hour, and this place could make it. But not like it is now. No way.  Edited on Jan 3, 2015: We've been back. We really like the back patio there. Beer choices are great, not so much difference on food. I'd like a better happy hour. Bumping up by one star.

SyZOHzu4I_YD2TIl7EEtmw.text: I was very excited to check this place out with a friend of mine. It's always nice to have a new spot open up in the area. You always hope that someone has finally done it right. The unfortunate truth is that this place needs to be on the show called "Restaurant Impossible". I'm not kidding when I say this, go and see for yourself.  I have no animosity for this place, it was just very disappointing to see a group of guys / young boys (owners/Investors) standing around in their poor choice of wanna be club shirts that they probably got on sale at Marshall's, along with their poor hair grooming and unprofessional demeanor. It was as if they felt that their machine was up and running and that no improvements or the customer experience was even a possibility of a real issue. The bartender had a frown on his face the entire time, and our waitresses were as friendly as can be but really need to be informed and educated on their brews. I do not put this responsibility on the girls as much as I do the poor management.  Now, with my ranting aside, my reasons for disappointment were as follows:  We ordered the Brewer's Choice Plate which consisted of Mortadella, Prosciutto, and Tuscan Salami, along with a choice of cheeses and a bunch of fillers that they included.  The plate came out and was presented well, but right away the cuts of meat were a disappointment. The thickness of the cuts was ridiculous and embarrassing. The Mortadella was almost room temperature, which can actually be a health hazard. Prosciutto was some sort of cheap salt cured, and hopefully pre-sliced. If they sliced it in house their chef should be fired for slicing such a thick cut of prosciutto. Even a non-chef knows that much. The salami was certainly nothing special, and again the Mortadella was the biggest disappointment. With this as my first impression of the food, I was very turned off and don't see them lasting very long if they don't fix such simple but important things. I suggest that they visit 'The Parlor' and take a look at the quality of the Artisan meats that they serve on their carving board, along with the thickness and temp of the meats. There is no comparison, and this is a no brainer for even a Foodie, much less a chef or a business that was swarming with inexperienced management at the time.  So the next item was the Meat and Potato Flatbread with Pork Belly and three cheeses. I will say that it was mediocre, but missing some element of flavor to make it complete. The chips and guacamole were simple, but no complaints there. I enjoyed the Yucca Chips.  I am not trying to be an extreme hater, but this place has a ton of hype out there and they aren't delivering quality products or service. They need to turn it up and light a fire under the asses of these young guys that are looking at a high profit margin by sacrificing quality food. They will need to offer much higher quality products if they want to stay afloat.   i wish them the best and would love to try them again if I hear that they got everything straightened out. This would be an ideal location and they have a great concept.  Cheers and good luck guys! Constructive criticisms are all I am offering and wish you the best. :)

S268iiStpR76HdDXsBkEYA.text: I had heard so many great things about this place and I'm glad I finally went! The atmosphere is kickback and fabulous. My girlfriend and I hung at the bar and our bartender ROCKED. I tend to be very picky when trying new beer and he was very patient in giving me samples and educating me on all the beers. We didn't eat so I cannot comment on the food, but I will be back and I'm doubting I will be disappointed! (: Looking forward to taking my beau along for the next visit!

_QiN91QZcYUIVXZHWyyI_g.text: A friend and I met here last night and had a great experience!  The restaurant itself is very cool, the staff is great and they've got great beer and food!  The complimentary valet is also a nice touch.

diTVAqKGZU5wogJBoNEyog.text: So far, so good. Great selection of local and/or seasonally appropriate beers. Burger is one of the best I've had in some time. Go on and get that bacon. Looking forward to their home brews, starting to be served in August.

vvcj_JwkQ2dIrn7miH09mQ.text: Good beer and good food, what more can you ask for?! I had their raspberry beer and it was good. I ordered their non-margherita flat bread pizza and it was really good but definitely not a margherita!

2gCM7WDP6SNfsJnOiOkl5Q.text: This place had a really nice back patio...and I even enjoyed it on an 108 degree day due to the misters all around. The layout was great. The beer and pulled pork were amazing! The service at the outdoor bar was hilarious/pathetic...the bartenders were seriously tuned out and either forgot to offer us napkins/silverware or kept asking if we were done every 4 minutes...we also found it amusing as the one bartender who had been there since we sat down--and who also helped us--looked over at our friends and said, "do you need a drink or a menu?" And we were like, "uh no actually were leaving we were here the whole time." lol....overall though everything was delicious and the dog friendly environment on the patio is a huge perk!! Loved the pups!! And anywhere that accepts dogs as well as people is def alright in my book.

ziKTzpWy1C-8ezJ-PNIYUg.text: Went there for the first time last night. This place was awesome. Has an amazing patio and beer selection. A perfect atmosphere for any type of crowd. Great music. My new favorite place for sure.

YQSR7jF6hBPIRuQskACQ6g.text: What a nice, chill place to eat, hang out, or just have a beer or three. I had the white chocolate and the Essie coffee beers which were great. We loved the Green Chile Pork Sliders, sweet potato fries, and the AZ Burger. We plan on going again real soon.

DFFT3-lI-sT7I_eOjn6NVg.text: Great addition to the neighborhood! Since I discovered this place, I have been at least 4 times. The space is very  big yet cozy. It has an area for whatever mood your in. There is the main dining area, the bar section, the front patio, and the super cool big back patio. The back patio is lots of fun, but only open during the weekend. You can even bring your dog. I have tried several food items and all were very tasty. Of course, there is the beer. Too many to comment on, but the staff is very knowledgeable about the beer, and are very patient with helping you choose something new. Keep this place alive and go as often as possible.

wGV17GCyTQDPQ7JZ0fAacA.text: Came to try out the $10 brunch special. There was a little bit of a wait which I found to be odd since there appeared to be plenty of seating available. We found a spot at the bar. My french toast was pretty good and I like that they give you the choice of beer or mimosa. The servers were nice, they were running drink orders but still had to the time to explain to me the meaning of the name: "outrageous homebrewers social outpost" and the way the brew-your-own beer works. Talked to a nice couple who had just brewed their first batch and had come in to taste it/enjoy on draught. The concept is quite innovative/unique/cool...you come in, pay $50 to brew, pick your flavors, start your brew, they ferment it for you, feature it on draught, and then give you a $50 gift card to buy your beer or any others that are on draught. I didn't bring my dog with me but like/appreciate the dog-friendliness of the establishment and took one of their "to-go" treats home for him. He liked it. Wish I was staying longer in PHX otherwise I would've started brewing my own beer!

Vkwut_yM9hMDIC-5bnEkMw.text: LOVE this place!  I've only sat on the patio- which is very nice and right on the canal.  It's very dog friendly with water bowls and free treats provided!  Really good hamburgers too.

YDSN9N1nFVibw6LIb1M1vw.text: Beer is good, food is very good. For some reason they have picked locations with really bad parking options. Outside of that I can't find a reason not to recommend this place. I'm not a dog lover but being able to bring your dog to a bar is cool concept. There happy hour is good with $3 small aps and $6 pitchers.

qlZoCsrmNZiYUI3c5E8g0g.text: I was not happy with the bad service and then asked what beer might match my favorite beer and i got a very wrong choice by the staff, then asked to try another beer for $1, wow that's wrong.  Then my friend ordered a simple Sam Adams and it was either bad beer or tapped to a wrong keg (either way still tasted bad).  Not a good showing and wished it could have been better.  I will try back in 6 months and see if they have oiled the process out to be better.  A word of advice, if you have 40 some taps of beer your staff better know them, go look at yard house....

-xa573tsWxNx17HtPFFMkQ.text: Always a good time here! Love the local beers, great food, bloody Mary's (with homemade beef sticks) & red sangria! Pet friendly patio & biking in is fun. Casual & friendly. Love it!

N2H-dQY67AusbFk-fI8kqw.text: We've been here twice in the last few months and both experiences were fabulous!  The first was a happy hour for our friend who brewed a house beer with the brewery.  This was very unique to try his beer and we sat on the patio in a large group. We only tried the green chili dip which was delicious.  I loved the local beer selection especially the Papago orange blossom and four peaks hefe!!!  We returned a week ago for a birthday dinner and sat inside.  It was a lot more mellow and quiet inside. This time I ordered the pork tacos which were very good and seemed homemade.  It comes with a nice bowl if pork with a slaw, a bowl of yummy salsa, 5 tortillas, a dish of guac!  Amazing understated friendly service both times.  You can tell they like eating at thier restaurant!

PafuZPxPpbqovIV47CxZ6A.text: Complimentary Valet is always a plus The inside has a cool industrial, outdoorsy, bicycle feel...  It is also a "seat yourself" deal which I'm not sure is all the time or just on the weekends but I didn't mind because I got to choose a cute low table in the main seating area... I love the chalkboard signs and menus on the wall...   Our server was nice and cool...  Gave us a menu and took our water orders... The menu is pretty small but everything sounds good I chose the pumpkin ale which sounds yummy For my entree I selected the Skirt Steak with fries which seems like a very popular item... The pumpkin ale is great!  I was informed that the skirt steak was mixed sort of like carne asada fries and so I would thought I would give it a try  They are really yummy Such a great flavor and the steak is cooked perfectly... I was not expecting so much flavor from this dish but it is exceeding my expectations   All in all it was a great visit and I am glad to have tried this spot, I will be back soon

photos.caption: Photo of OHSO Brewery- Arcadia - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Skirt steak and fries

Vbd9fenMbF671RFnfFsBUw.text: Cute place with a good selection of beer to choose from. I really enjoy the $1 samples so I can try a variety and find new delicious beer. They also allow dogs on the patio so that's a big bonus! Our server was fun and friendly but he didn't check up on us often enough so we had to go in and order and the bar at one point. He also brought us a pitcher of the wrong beer and said he'd bring the correct one but charged us for both, so we paid for his mistake.  The food was hugely disappointing, I ordered Carne Asada Tacos which was a few bites of Steak on top of a little Lettuce and two Tortillas on the side, it barely filled on Tortilla....Ay, caramba! Overpriced, small portion and not even tasty.   If I come back I'll just stick with Beer.

g1C-HmRYNc2vrPXmeSxIsQ.text: Wanted to update after doing the brewers experience. Thats right, I brewed my own beer at OHSO! So basically you sign up for one of the dates on their iphone app. They have a list of dates and then each date has a different type of beer. So porters, ipa's, amber, then some interesting specialty beers.  You pay but then they give you a gift certificate for the same amount back so it free then right?   Anyway, expect to spend about 5 hours when you brew. Dave the head brewer was awesome and went through the whole process and answered any questions we had. Although you might think you are stuck making a plain old porter for example, they are great in embracing your creativity. You can add ingredients, make it more or less hoppy. You get to customize everything. Dave's first answer when asking about adding things is yes. He also explains why something might not work how you want and makes alternate suggestions. The brewing area is in the open so the whole time people were taking pictures and asking questions who were there eating dinner.   This is pretty unique. Don't think i've ever heard of a place letting you brew your own beer and then letting you have it up on the board for sale.  So you get to brew your beer and then you name it and pick a tapping date. Thats right, your own beer will be for sale at OHSO.   Oh by the way, you can eat and drink while your brewing. If you need beers or food they will have it brought over for you.  So lets recap fowks...You get to spend 5 hours brewing your own beer while drinking beer! Then you get to go back a month later and drink your own beer and see it proudly displayed on the beer list..

ecOs1olZ2HyqgTtXmz1tJQ.text: This place is amazing love it!! The food is excellent and so is the service... Drea (Andrea) was such a great server and made sure to accommodate my food allergies to the fullest extent. I will definitely be back.

dVJlB16WCP8Hzcsv9cfm7Q.text: Went here on a recommendation from a friend and as soon as we got to our table outside I knew I was going to like it. It has a great atmosphere! The staff are very friendly and the food was delicious! Definitely will be going back!

G2aqpmewd2E95OwcNtr03w.text: A friend brought me here when I was visiting during the NASCAR races at PRI. I liked the outdoor seating area, the doggie bar, and all the cool bikes there. The first day I was there, I drank like it was going out of style and needless to say woke up with a bad hangover. The next day I went back and wanted to do nothing with their special brewed beer. Unfortunately, I went on a brewfest weekend so there wasn't any other beer to drink.

tI1Z8kw1X6WqS4bevQ2bCw.text: Great food.  Great drinks.  Horrible service.   Went Sunday for brunch    They had just launched new menu but by time we ordered they had run out of a couple brunch items.  Means bad ordering by chef   Took over over 7 min to get drinks.   Had to ask for waters mid way through meal Bc we never got them.     It wasn't that busy Bc it was raining.    He was a nice guy(server) but all over the place and did bare minimum on service   Had the French toast--one the best ever Breakfast bowl--good but nothing to write home about Bloody and mimosas--on point   Staff didn't smile.   Besides hosts no one said hi or bye.   Just seemed very unorganized and off that day.   The location in PV is much much better.

zYZYsDZhY6Yh_zqlAfQ_HA.text: Great place our sever was less than professional. I would go back but I avoid the male server. Rude!

3oeaKxuiEloSBlIcLkuqDA.text: So, This Brewery was pretty good like the fact that they had  good amount of guess Taps too, Normally I don't do the guess taps my first time at a new brewery I only stick with there beer But they had Two Hearted Ale from Bell's I couldn't not pass that up since I can't get it In WA. As far as there beer 3 stood out The Morning Brew, Peanut Britt and The Hoppy. The Morning Brew and the Hoppy were pretty good the only reason The Peanut Britt stood out cause it was different it wasn't great but not bad I would not have more then a pint.. The BBQ Burger Was very good asked for pink in the middle there was no pink but it still was good. I'll go back for sure

OFBld1jNJxG_PW77ZM0oYA.text: What I liked the most about this place was the amazing patio!!!  A dog friendly patio with hanging lights!! Beautiful and brilliant!! Plus, this place brews its own beer!! The food here is good, nothing too extravagant.  However, the service is great, friendly and loaded with a very attentive staff!!  :) A must visit for a good time with the amigo(a)s!! :)

O5zMquajtCbeygKK417f9A.text: My first time at this bicycle and dog friendly eatery in Scottsdale, AZ. The ambience is hip and cool. Decor by far is really awesome. Lots of bicycle themed around.  Very friendly staff. The food is delicious. Not the usual you'll find at eatery/brewery place. There are some healthy options wc is great. Price is very reasonable.
